loans.name: James

texts.en:
James C. sells drinks and other food items. He is a single parent with four dependents. He is managing with the little income he generates from his sales. He wants to increase sales so as to increase his income to enable him meet the needs of his family.

He is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more food and drink items to sell

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 44119

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is fifty years old and a mother of seven children. Three of her children are in school.  She is also taking care of five grandchildren. She has grilled and sold fish in Mankessim for the past twenty two years. 

Ama wants to use her loan to buy cartons of fish from Tema since they are cheaper there.  By stocking the fish, she can also avoid price hikes.

She is a member of the group called “Gyedzi,” which means believe.  Group members agree to take responsibility for the loans of their peers, which serves as social collateral for the loan.

loans.use: to buy more cartons of fish

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace B. sells clothing. She is married and has five dependents. She is working very hard to support her husband to meet the needs of their large family. She wants to increase salse to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more clothing to sell

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 44121

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adjoa is a young and enterprising woman of twenty one years of age. She has sold a variety of biscuits for the past eight years in Mankessim.

Adjoa’s business is doing very well.  Therefore wants to use her loan to purchase more boxes of assorted biscuits and candies to meet customer demand.

She is a member of the group called Stewards. Group members agree to take responsibility for the loans of their peers, which serves as social collateral for the loan.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of assorted biscuits and candies

loans.name: Felicity

texts.en:
Felicity is a young and unmarried woman with one child. She is nineteen years old and has been selling groceries like tin fish, biscuits, tin tomatoes, spices, cocoa powder, Milo, etc. for seven years. She depends on middlemen to buy these items from Accra.

Felicity wants to use her loan to buy products from Accra herself as middlemen price the goods higher which reduces her income.

She is a member of the group called Stewards. Group members agree to take responsibility for the loans of their peers, which serves as social collateral for the loan.

loans.use: to buy more cartons of Milo, cocoa powder, skimmed milk powder, etc.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a widow and a mother of two children. One of her children is currently in school. She is fifty four years old and since her husband died ten years ago she has been selling agricultural products such as fertilizer, vegetable seeds, cereal seeds and maize in Mankessim.

Mercy wants to use her loan to buy more bags of fertilizer to meet her customers demand as the farming season is very near. 

She is a member of the group called Stewards.  Members agree to be mutually responsible for each others loans.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and maize for the farming season

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a widow and a mother of six children. She is forty four years old and has been selling empty barrels and plastic containers for twenty years. The empty barrels and plastic containers are used to store water in many Ghanaian homes for cooking and drinking.  
Elizabeth wants to use her loan to buy more empty barrels and plastic containers as the raining season has started and customers will need them to harvest rain water for use.
She is a member of the group called Stewards. The group members agree to be mutually responsible for the loans of their peers.

loans.use: to purchase more empty barrels and plastic containers

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is thirty-six years old and a mother of one child who is currently in school. She has been selling gari (milled and roasted cassava) for the past five years in Mankessim. She buys the gari from Tamale in the Northern part of Ghana.

Sarah wants to use her new loan to buy more bags of gari to prevent price hikes and to reduce her frequent travels to the north. It takes twelve hours to travel to the north.

She is a member of the group called Stewards. Members guarantee for each other, which serves as social collateral in repaying the loan.

In the photograph, Sarah selling gari in the market.

loans.use: To buy more bags of gari.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a mother of three children. Two of her children are currently in school. She has been selling baby products, such as dresses, diapers, sandals, and cream, in Mankessim for twenty years.

The demand for children’s products is very high, so Elizabeth wants to use her loan to buy more baby products to sell.

She is a member of the group called Kindness. Members use peer pressure on as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more baby products to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is fifty years old and a mother of four children. She is married and has two grandchildren. She prepares and sells local dishes, such as fufu, rice balls, banku, rice, and ampesie, in the family house for the nine years.

Elizabeth wants to use her loan to buy soft drinks and foods like plantain, fresh yams, bags of rice, and vegetables, to cook for school children and her dear customers in Ajumako.

She is a member of the group called Tree of Life. Members of the group exert peer pressure as social collateral to repay the loan.

In the photo, Elizabeth is dishing out food.

loans.use: To buy more foods like cassava, plantain, cocoyam, fresh yams, and bags of rice.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Gisèle

texts.fr:
She was a retailer from the start, located along a path in the N'VENAMEDE district in Cotonou. Today, Ms. Gisèle A. A. is doing business in one of the SYNAPOSTEL shops. She was born on January 20, 1973 in Cotonou. Married to a clothier, she is the mother of three children. For six years, she has been buying sacks of corn, rice, beans, and voandzu (similar to peanuts), and other goods that she sells retail. She is on her fourth loan at Alidé and is credited with good ethics.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Au départ revendeuse au bord de l'une des voies du quartier N'VENAMEDE à COTONOU, dame A. A. Gisèle exerce aujourd'hui son activité dans l'une des boutiques du SYNAPOSTEL. Elle est née le 20/01/1973 à Cotonou. Mariée à un couturier , elle est mère de 03 enfants. Depuis 06 ans, elle achète des sacs de maïs, de riz, de haricot, de voandzu et autres qu'elle revend au détail. Elle est à son 4ème prêt chez Alidé et se trouve crédité d'une bonne moralité.

loans.use: To buy twelve sacks of corn, each 120 kg

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with four children. She is forty-three years old and all of her children are in school. She has been selling groceries in her community for the past fifteen years.

Josephine has a low working capital, so she wants to use her new loan to buy more products and more varieties of products, such as skimmed milk, bags of sugar, tins of fish, bags of rice, and body creams.

She is a member of the group called Maranatha. Members use peer pressure as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, cartons of body creams, cartons of tin fish, etc.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a peasant farmer, a husband, and a father of two children. He is fifty-six years old and has been selling second-hand clothes for the past two years in his village. He farms in the morning and sells clothing in the afternoon.

Joseph wants to use his new loan to buy bails of second-hand clothes to sell. He can use the profit to save some money for his children’s education and also to register for National Health Insurance.

He is a member of the group called Tree of Life. The group members guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

In the photo, Joseph had just returned from the farm.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is twenty-five years old and a mother of one child. She sells both fresh and fried yams in her village, and has done so for the past five years. She travels to Takyiman, in the northern part of Ghana, to buy the fresh yams and then resells them to people who needs them. She also fries some for children to buy.

Diana has run out of stock, so she wants to use her new loan to buy more tubers of fresh yams from Takyiman to avoid price hikes and for the lean season.

She is member of the group called Humility. Group members use peer pressure as social collateral to repay the loan.

In the photo, Diana standing in front of her store.

loans.use: To buy more tubers of fresh yams.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Reine

texts.fr:
Reine M. is 32 years old and has been residing in the SURULERE district for 10 years already. She is married and the mother of three children, one of whom she supports. A very serious individual when it comes to business, she buys sacks of corn wholesale and sells them retail. Parallel to this business, she has rented a store, where she sells various household items, such as sacks of rice, various canned goods, pasta, and common consumables. Because of her young age, she is a fairly energetic individual and dedicated to the success of her business. With an unfailing strictness in repayments, she comes to request her fourth loan at Alidé in order to respond better to the expectations of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

M. Reine a 32 ans et réside dans le quartier SURULERE il y a 10 ans déjà. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants dont l'un est à sa charge. Très sérieuse dans les affaires, elle achète des sacs maïs auprès des grossistes qu'elle revend au détail. Parallèlement à cette activité, elle a loué un magasin où elle revend divers produits de ménage à savoir: sacs de riz, diverses boîtes de conserves, des pattes alimentaires et biens de consommation courante. Son jeune âge fait d'elle une femme assez dynamiques et dévouée à la réussite de son activité. D'une rigueur sans faille dans le remboursement, elle vient solliciter son 04 ème prêt à Alidé pour mieux répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy five 25-kg sacks of rice and five of corn

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is forty-six years old and the mother of two children. She bakes in the morning and cook yams in the afternoon. She is able to sustain her business, because the working capital needed for baking is very low.

Patience wants to use her new loan to buy more bags of flour and fresh tubers of yam. This will enable her expand her business

.

She is a member of the group called Maranatha. Members guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of flour, bags of sugar and tubers of fresh yams.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is forty years old and the mother of nine children. All of the children are in school. She has sold palm kernel oil, palm oil, and fried fish in her community for twenty years.

Life has been very challenging, so she decided to fry and sell fish in addition to the oils She responded to the demand from her people in her town. Florence wants to use her new loan to buy more fish and more palm fruits to prepare the oils.

She is a member of the group called Nananom ("Royals"). Members of the group guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more palm fruits to prepare oils and mroe frozen fish.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Mrs. Matilde F. R. is married and originally from the town of Condega. She has two sons. One whom she still supports since he's currently in school. She makes tortillas out of her home.

She starts making tortillas at the crack of dawn every day to later sell them to her loyal customers in the town of Condega in Nicaragua. In order to make the tortillas, you need to purchase the basic ingredients. This is why Señora F. is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to be able to purchase the basic material needed to make delicious tortillas from her home.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Matilde F. R., casada y del municipio de Condega, tiene dos hijos a su cargo, uno de ellos en edad estudiantil al cual tiene la obligación de mantener y suplir todas las necesidades que este presente. Esta dama se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas en su propia casa de habitación

Desde muy temprano todos los días inicia su trabajo de elaboración de estas deliciosas tortillas que vende a sus fieles clientes en el municipio de Condega en Nicaragua. Para llevar a cabo esta actividad es de suma necesidad la adquisición de la materia prima para la elaboración. Por este motivo es que la señora F. acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito oportuno que le permita adquirir la materia prima para así elaborar las deliciosas tortillas que comercializa en su local de habitación.

loans.use: To purchase basic ingredients to make tortillas

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is seventy-five years old. She a widow with three children and three grandchildren. She has been selling charcoal, palm oil and palm kernel oil for ten years.

Victoria wants to use her new loan to buy more oils and charcoal, because the demand for her products are high.

She is a member of the group called Maranatha. Group members use peer pressure as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more oil and charcoal.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: María Simeona

texts.es:
Maria Simeona M. is originally from the town of Condega in Nicaragua. She started selling delicious food dishes out of her home about 15 years ago. She's a great cook with a growing clientele.

In order to make her delicious food dishes, Señora Simeona buys the best quality ingredients. Due to financial difficulties at this time, she's requesting a loan from Ceprodel to be able to purchase the basic ingredients to prepare food dishes and to continue with her business and great customer service. It's important to note that she has been able to paid on time 4 previous loans which she paid in full per agreement established between both parties.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Maria Simeona M. es originaria del municipio de Condega en Nicaragua. Desde hace 15 años se dedica al negocio de la venta de comida en su sector de habitación siendo ella una excelentísima cocinera de la cual muchos de sus clientes prefieren por su estilo de elaborar los alimentos.

Para lograr elaborar cada uno de los deliciosos platillos, la señora Simeona requiere de la compra de los ingredientes para la preparación. Es por esta razón que a pesar de su difícil situación económica, busca apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan obtener su materia prima y continuar con su negocio brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes. Es necesario destacar que actualmente ella posee un total de 4 créditos con Ceprodel pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido por ambas partes.

loans.use: To purchase basic ingredients to prepare food dishes

loans.name: Rosa Iliana

texts.en:
Rosa Iliana is twenty-eight years old, and she and her husband have a six-year-old son and a newborn daughter. Rosa Iliana works in a store, selling silver jewelry, and her husband works as a mechanic for a company.

Rosa Iliana explains that her salary and her husband’s are just not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. She is requesting a loan to buy a collection of silver earrings, bracelets and necklaces to sell to the women of her community. Rosa has a lot of experience selling these goods, and she knows the needs of the customers. She says that it’s always an asset to know a lot of people and to be well-liked in one’s community.

Rosa Iliana hopes she’ll have the loan before long so that she can start her new business and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: purchase of silver jewelry in order to start up a new small business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Emma Yahaira

texts.en:
Emma Yahaira is a thirty-year-old entrepreneur who is working to contribute to the education of the children in the Itabo community of San Cristobal.

Emma has been the owner and principal of a primary school for three years. Currently, she receives 32 pupils, and 4 professors are teaching classes in the school.

The entrepreneur has requested a loan to buy more school furniture in order to allow the professors to teach their classes in a very good atmosphere.

loans.use: Purchase of school furniture for a primary school

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Glenny Mariela

texts.en:
Glenny Mariela is a young entrepreneur and mother of a newborn daughter. Glenny owns and operates an Internet Center in the Itabo community of San Cristobal. The entrepreneur humbly explains that her center just has three computers for the customers. Nonetheless, she plans to use her loan to buy some used computers in order to increase the quality of the service she offers to her customers.

Glenny Mariela says she’ll keep working hard in order to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase of used computers for an Internet Center

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Santos Vidal

texts.es:
Mr. Santos is very well-respected in his place of employment at the Ministry of Education, where he has worked for many years as a security guard. His wife is a merchant, and they have three grown children.

One of Mr. Santos’ wishes is to finish building his home, so he and his family can live there with the dignity merited by all the family’s hard work.

He is seeking this loan to replace his roof, to ensure that during the coming winter season they will be without leaks and moisture within the house.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Santos es una persona muy respetada en su lugar de trabajo, lleva muchos años trabajando en el Ministerio de Educación como guarda de seguridad. Su esposa es comerciante y tienen 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad. Uno de los anhelos de don Santos es terminar de construir su casa de habitación, para que él y su familia puedan tener una vivienda digna, merecedora de todo el esfuerzo del trabajo de su familia. Este préstamos lo está solicitando para cambiar el techo de su casa y de esa manera asegurarse que en el invierno inmediato no tendrán problemas de goteras, ni humedad en su casa.

loans.use: Replace the roof of his house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Hortensia

texts.es:
Hortensia D. is a persevering woman and a fighter who has made a great effort to help her children get ahead. Her and her husband work hard to support themselves, as well as to continue to help their children with their needs even though they are now grown and married.

Hortensia’s husband works in construction, and she devotes herself to the sale of perfumes and cosmetics. She started her business originally with the intention of helping her husband with their household expenses and, slowly, her sales activities grew.

These days, her dream is to build up her inventory to reach new levels of sales. Mrs. D. seeks a loan to invest in her business and offer better products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Hortensia D. es una señora muy perseverante y luchadora, ha trabajado mucho para sacar adelante a todos sus hijos, ella y su esposo trabajan para solventar sus necesidades y a la vez apoyar a sus hijos que aunque ya están casados siempre se preocupan en ayudarlos en sus necesidades. El esposo de doña Hortensia es albañil y ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes y cosméticos; inició su negocio con la intención de ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa y poco a poco se fue dedicando cada vez más al comercio. Hoy en día uno de sus grandes sueños es reforzar su inventario y alcanzar mejores niveles de venta para obtener mayores utilidades. La Sra. D. esta solicitando un préstamo para invertirlos en su negocio y ofrecer mejores productos a sus clientes

loans.use: Purchase perfumes and cosmetics for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Victoria's Group

texts.es:
Maria, Ninfa and Maruja have been members of the Santa Rita Communal Bank for 10, 8 and 4 years, respectively.

Maria is 42 years old, married, and has 6 children. She sells fruit from her bicycle cart each day; her husband is a locksmith.

Ninfa is 40 years old, married, and has 8 children, 6 of whom live with her. Ninfa sells traditional Peruvian food in a traditional market and on a bicycle cart. She also travels to regional markets to sell fruit, and brings back cereals and tubers to sell in the city of Ayacucho.

Maruja is 42 years old and married with 4 children. Maruja travels to markets where she buys fruit, young animals, cheeses, and other items, which she sells in the Plaza Grau market. Maruja also raises guinea pigs at home.

Maria, Ninfa and Maruja need loans of 600, 800 and 800 soles, respectively, which they will spend on grapes, bananas, apples, oranges, rice, oil, pasta, potatoes, guinea pigs, wheat, barley and iron.

Maria, Ninfa and Maruja's dreams are for their children to become working professionals, to build a house, and to own a store, land, and a new business.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Maria, Ninfa y Maruja pertenecen al Banco Comunal Santa Rita hace 10, 8, 4 años respectivamente.

Maria es casada, tiene 42 años y 6 hijos, Maria venD. frutas ambulatoriamente en un triciclo, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además su esposo tiene un taller D. cerrajería.

Por otro lado Ninfa es casada, tiene 40 años y 8 hijos D. los cuales 6 viven con ella, Ninfa venD. comida típica en la feria D. platos típicos y ambulantemente en un triciclo. Además Ninfa viaja a las ferias D. la región donD. venD. frutas y D. las feria trae tubérculos y cereales que venD. en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Mientras que Maruja es casada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Maruja viaja a las ferias donD. compra cereales, animales menores, quesos, productos que venD. en el mercado Playa Grau. Además Maruja D. dedica a la crianza D. cuy en su casa.

Maria, Ninfa y Maruja necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 800 soles, 800 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. uva, plátano, manzana, naranja, arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideo, papa, cuy, trigo, cebada y fierros.

Los sueños D. Maria, Ninfa y Maruja son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener una tienda, un terreno, construir su casa y tener un nuevo negocio.

loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables, grains and guinea pigs

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Mr. Francisco Javier C. is 47 years old and he's been married to Mrs. Margarita Navarro for over 27 years. They live in their own home in a neighborhood that is far away from the city - about 12 kilometers. They have all household needs covered. It is also worthed to mention that they have three sons - two are enrolled in the neighborhood's public school and the oldest is married and has a family.

Francisco is the owner of a convenience store that has been in business for more than 4 years and it is located in his own home. His wife and children help run it. It should also be mentioned that Mr. Francisco work as a security guard for Proseguir. He has been with that company for more than 12 years and the income generated there is very important to cover family expenses.

This is a tight-knit family that struggle and support each other in order to pay all the family's expenses and cover the boys' ongoing school costs; therefore, they need help from their family.

The credit line requested will be used to expand his commercial location. Currently, it sits in his home and it is too small to comfortably accommodate customers and to adequately fit the merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

El Señor Francisco Javier C. de 47 años de edad está casado hace mas de de 27 años con la señora Margarita Navarro, ellos viven en casa propia en un barrio que esta retirado de la ciudad, aproximadamente 12 kilómetros, y cuentan con todas las necesidades básicas para el hogar. Cabe mencionar que tienen tres hijos de las cuales dos de ellos son menores de edad y van al colegio público de la zona y el mayor ya es casado y tiene su familia.

Francisco es propietario de una despensa que funciona hace más de 4 años y esta ubicado en su propio domicilio particular y que es atendida por su señora y por sus hijos. Cabe destacar que el Señor Francisco a parte trabaja como guardia de seguridad en la Empresa Prosegur con una antigüedad de 12 años y un ingreso mensual importante para los gastos del hogar.

Se trata de una familia muy unida y sacrificada que se ayudan mutuamente para así poder solventar todos los gastos de la casa y así poder pagar el estudio de sus dos hijos que están en etapa de colegio y necesitan el apoyo de la familia.

El crédito que solicita el cliente servirá para la ampliación del local comercial por que esta dentro de la casa y le resulta muy pequeño el espacio y quiere tener mejor comodidad para sus clientes y espacio para sus mercaderías.

loans.use: Expand business location.

loans.name: Miriam's Group

texts.es:
Miriam, Karina, and Elisa have belonged to the Santa Rita Communal Bank for 2 years, 8 months, and 4 months, respectively.

Miriam is 24 years old, married and has 3 children. Miriam sells different items depending on demand; for example, she sells crafts during Holy Week and fireworks for Christmas. Miriam also sells grains in bulk to markets and has an Internet cafe in the city of Huanta.

Karina is 22 years old and lives with her partner. The couple sells clothing in the "April 12th Market" and also travels to different regional fairs.

Elisa is also 22, lives with her partner and has a 3-year-old daughter. Elisa has a cafe on the campus of the Local University. She also has a car, which her partner uses as a taxi. Elisa travels to regional fairs, where she sells ceviche (raw fish cured in lemon).

Miriam, Karina and Elisa need loans of 1000 soles, 400 soles, and 1400 soles, respectively. The money will be spent to buy upholstry, polo shirts, jackets, pants and to make car payments.

Miriam, Karina and Elisa dream that their children will become working professionals, of getting married, and of owning their own homes, businesses and bulk goods stores.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Miriam, Karina y Elisa pertenecen al Banco Comunal Santa Rita hace 2 años, 8 meses, 4 meses respectivamente.

Miriam es casada, tiene 24 años y 3 hijos, Miriam vende diferentes productos dependiendo de la demanda, como artesanía en semana santa, cuetecillos en navidad, entre otros productos. También Miriam vende cereales por mayor a los mercados. Además Miriam tiene cabinas de Internet en la ciudad de Huanta.

Por otro lado Karina es conviviente y tiene 22 años, Karina junto a su esposo venden ropa en el mercado 12 de abril y también viajan a las diferentes ferias de la región.

Mientras que Elisa es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 1 hija de 3 años, Elisa tiene un cafetín en una facultad de la Universidad Local. También tiene un carro con lo cual trabaja su esposo haciendo taxi. Además Elisa viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región donde vende Cebiche (comida preparada con pescado y limón).

Miriam, Karina y Elisa necesitan un préstamo de 1000 soles, 400 soles, 1400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de tapices, polos, casacas, pantalones y para comprar su carro (parte del pago).

Los sueños de Miriam, Karina y Elisa son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener casa propia, una tienda de venta por mayor, un negocio propio y casarse.

loans.use: Purchase upholstry, polo shirts, jackets, pants and make car payments

loans.name: Ana Maria's Group

texts.es:
Ana Maria and Vitma have belonged to the Florecer Communal Bank for 8 months and 11 years, respectively.

Ana Maria is 37 years old and separated with four children. Ana Maria has a small cafe in the Father of Miracles school, where she sells sweets and food. Ana Maria also sells "salchipapas" (a traditional sausage and french fry dish) at night out of her home.

Vitma is 30 years old and separated with an 11-year-old son. Vitma sells clothing and shoes in the Vilcas Huamán market. She buys her wares in the city of Lima.

Ana Maria and Vitma need loans of 600 and 1000 soles, respectively, to be spent on cookies, candy, soda, soda, oil, rice, pants, shoes and sneakers.

Ana Maria and Vitma dream that their children will be working professionals, of having their own homes, of having bigger businesses and of owning a minimarket.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Ana Maria y Vitma pertenecen al Banco Comunal Florecer hace 8 meses y 11 años respectivamente.

Ana Maria es separada, tiene 37 años y 4 hijos, Ana Maria tiene un cafetín en el colegio Señor de los Milagros, donde vende golosinas y comida. Además Ana Maria vende salchipapas por las noches en la puerta de su casa.

Mientras que Vitma es separada, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo de 11 años, Vitma vende ropa y calzados en la feria de Vilcas Huamán, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.

Ana Maria y Vitma necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas, caramelos, gaseosas, aceite, arroz, casacas, pantalones, zapatillas, zapatos.

Los sueños de Ana Maria y Vitma son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener casa propia, un negocio más grande y un minimarket.

loans.use: Puchase cookies, candy, soda, oil, rice, jackets, pants, sneakers and shoes.

loans.name: Rosa's Group

texts.es:
Yovana, Justina, and Rosa have belonged to the Paradise Community Bank for 2, 1 and 5 years, respectively.

Yovana is 23 years old, lives with her partner and son, and is expecting her second child. She is not working at the moment because of the pregnancy; her husband is a driver with a transport company.

Justina is 22 years old and lives with her partner and daughter. Justina and her brother have a computer center. With the loan, Justina will buy a glass display counter to sell candy.

Rosa is 36 years old, married, and has six children. Rosa travels to a local market to buy cheese, grains and young animals, which she sells out of her home in the city of Ayacucho.

Yovana, Justina and Rosa need loans of 450 soles, 900 soles, and 600 soles, respectively. The money will be spent to buy cookies, candies, a display counter and sheep. Yovana will also invest in the purchase of school supplies for her son.

Yovana, Justina, and Rosa dream of owning their own businesses, expanding their businesses, sending their children to school and owning their own homes.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Yovana, Justina y Rosa pertenecen al Banco Comunal Paraíso hace 2, 1, 5 años respectivamente.

Yovana es conviviente, tiene 23 años, 1 hijo y esta esperando su segundo hijo, Yovana por su estado no esta realizando ninguna actividad, mientras que su esposo trabaja como conductor en una empresa de transporte.

Por otro lado Justina es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 1 hija, Justina junto a su hermano tienen un centro de computo. Justina con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado comprar una vitrina para vender golosinas.

Mientras que Rosa es casada, tiene 36 años y 6 hijos, Rosa viaja a las ferias de la región donde compra queso, cereales y animales menores, que vende de casa en casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Yovana, Justina y Rosa necesitan préstamos de 450 soles, 900 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas, caramelos, vitrina, queso, ovejas y Yovana invertirá en la compra de los útiles de su hijo.

Los sueños de Yovana, Justina y Rosa son tener un negocio propio, ampliar sus negocios, que sus hijos estudien y tener casa propia.

loans.use: Purchase cookies, candy, a display counter, cheese, sheep and chldren's school supplies.

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
Mrs. Genara A. is 58 years old and she has been married to an argentine citizen, Ernesto Veron, for over 30 years. They have lived in their own house in Barrio Pacu Cua for a long time and the only have one 24 year-old daughter who is about to graduate from a private law school in their country.

The credit applicant owns a convenience store that is situated in her home and has been open for over 22 years. Her husband helps her run the store that has accumulated a large amount of loyal customers throughout the years.

Mrs. Genara and her husband's dream is that their daughter graduates from college - this is her last and final year. They hope she will become an excellent professional and form her own family.

The credit requested is for the purchase of school material such as, notebooks, pencils, erasers, books and other items that were offered to her and that would allow her to yield a good profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Genara Ávalos de 58 años de edad está hace mas de 30 años con el señor Ernesto Veron de nacionalidad Argentina, viven en casa propia en el Barrio Pacu Cua hace mucho tiempo y tiene una sola hija de 24 años que esta estudiando y culminando la Carrera de Derecho en una universidad privada del país.

La cliente es propietaria de una despensa y mercería que esta ubicado en su propio domicilio particular que funciona hace mas de 22 años y que es atendida por ella su marido, cuenta con buena clientela formada que trabajan con ello hace años.

El sueño de Genara y su marido es lograr que su hija culmine sus estudios ya que este es el último año de la carrera la que está cursando, esperan que sea una excelente profesional y forme su propia familia.

El crédito que solicita el cliente es para la compra de artículos escolares como cuadernos, lápices, borradores, libros entre otras cosas que le han ofrecido a un buen precio y que le permitirá tener un buen margen de ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase of school material such as, notebooks, pencils, erasers, books and others.

loans.name: Deysi's Group

texts.es:
Nancy, Deysi and Olinda have been members of the Trigales Communal Bank for one year.

Nancy is 25 years old and single. She has had a dry goods store for the past four years. Nancy also studied nursing. With the loan, she plans to buy a public telephone.

Deysi is 24 years old and lives with her partner and son. Deysi sells underwear for cash and on credit.

Olinda is 25 years old, lives with her partner and has two children. Olinda sells cosmetics on credit through catalogs.

Nancy, Deysi and Olinda need loans of 1250 soles, 450 soles, and 1000 soles, respectively, to invest in buying rice, oil, pasta, underwear, perfume, creams, deodorant and a public telephone.

The three women's dreams are to have a career, specialize, expand their business, own a clothing store and send their children to school.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer.

Nancy, Deysi y Olinda pertenecen al Banco Comunal Trigales hace 1 año.

Nancy es soltera y tiene 25 años, Nancy tiene una tienda de abarrotes, actividad que realiza hace 4 años. Además Nancy estudió enfermería. Con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado comprar un teléfono público.

Por otro lado Deysi es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, Deysi vende ropas interiores al crédito y cobra diariamente.

Mientras que Olinda es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Olinda vende cosméticos por catálogos, sus ventas son al crédito.

Nancy, Deysi y Olinda necesitan préstamos de 1250 soles, 450 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, fideo, ropas interiores, perfumes, cremas, desodorantes y un teléfono público.

Los sueños de Nancy, Deysi y Olinda son ejercer su carrera, especializarse, agrandar su negocio, tener una tienda de ropa y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Nancy, Deysi  y Olinda necesitan préstamos de 1250  soles, 450 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, fideo, ropas interiores, perfumes, cremas, desodorantes y un teléfono público.

loans.name: Gloria Lourdes' Group

texts.es:
Francisca, Demetria and Gloria have belonged to the Community Bank November 28th for 2, 1, and 2 years, respectively. The members are from the district of Acosvinchos, which is an hour from the city of Ayacucho.

Francisca is married, 32 years old and has three children. Together with her husband, Francisca repairs footwear and also sells shoes and slippers.

Demetria is living with her partner, is 31 years old and has four children. Demetria sells food on Sundays in the market in her district. With a loan she will be able to start selling groceries in her home.

Gloria is a single mother, 36 years old and has two children. Gloria sells ‘salchipollos,’ a typical fast food dish consisting of chicken and French fries, from her house every day at night. In addition, Gloria travels every fifteen days to the markets where she buys cheese that she sells in the city of Ayacucho.

Francisca, Demetria and Gloria need loans of 900 soles, 600 soles, and 1500 soles to be used to buy shoes, slippers, rice, sugar, oil, potatoes, chicken, cheese and seasonings.

The dreams of Francisca, Demetria and Gloria are that their businesses become bigger and their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Helen C. Smith , Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca, Demetria, Gloria pertenecen al Banco Comunal 28 de noviembre hace 2, 1, 2 años respectivamente. Las socias son del Distrito de Acosvinchos que queda a 1 hora de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Francisca es casada, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Francisca junto a su esposo tienen su renovadora de calzados y también venden zapatos, zapatillas.

Por otro lado Demetria es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 4 hijos, Demetria vende comida los días domingos en la feria de su distrito. Con el préstamo que obtendrá comenzará a vender abarrotes en su casa.

Mientras que Gloria es madre soltera, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Gloria vende salchipollos en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días por las noches. Además Gloria viaja cada 15 días a las ferias donde compra queso y lo vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Francisca, Demetria, Gloria necesitan préstamos de 900 soles, 600 soles, 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatos, zapatillas, arroz, azúcar, aceite, papa, pollo, queso y condimentos.

Los sueños de Francisca, Demetria, Gloria son que sus negocios sean más grandes y sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Francisca, Demetria and Gloria need loans of 900 soles, 600 soles and 1500 soles, money that will be used to buy shoes, slippers , rice, sugar, oil, potatoes, chicken, cheese and seasonings and spices.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44151

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela is 26 years old, she lives with her significant other and have two kids ages 4 and 2. In some years, her older son will be attending school. For this reason, Graciela is already saving money.

Graciela proudly shares with us that she has her own house which she was able to get from her sacrifices and hard work. At first, was extremely difficult to find a steady job and financial stability. But throughout the years she's been able to improve her life.

Graciela currently owns a pantry where she sells foods for every day consumption: meats, breads, flour, oils, dairy products, yerba mate, among others. The business gives her good revenues, Graciela is great at managing money. Her business is one of the few ones in the area that offer a wide variety of goods.

Tanslated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Graciela tiene 26 años, vive en pareja y tiene dos hijos, uno de 4 años y otro de 2 años, el próximo años su hijo mayor ya irá a la escuela por lo que Graciela ya tiene unos ahorros preparados para sus estudio.

Graciela cuenta orgullosa que ya posee su casa propia que pudo adquirir hace unos años gracias al sacrificio de su pareja y ella. En principio le costo mucho obtener un trabajo fijo y estabilidad económica, pero con los años logró ir superando cada obstáculo para poder salir adelante.

Graciela posee hoy día una despensa en donde se dedica a la venta de insumos y comestibles para el consumo diario como ser: carnes, panificados, harina, aceite, lácteos, yerba mate, entre otros. El negocio le deja muy buenas ganancias, además de que Graciela es muy buena administradora de su negocio y de su familia. Su negocio es uno de los pocos comercios mejor surtido de la zona.

loans.use: Purchase of meats and drinks

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocío has belonged to the Community Bank November 28th for two years. Rocío lives in the district of Acosvinchos, which is one hour from the city of Ayacucho.

Rocío is married, 31 years old and has three children. Together with her spouse, Rocío manufactures handicraft tiles, which she sells through distributors. Rocío also has a small grocery store in her house. In addition, Rocío travels to markets where she sells fruits and buys grains that are sold afterwards in the market of Nery García.

Rocío needs a loan of 2000 soles, money that will be used to purchase firewood, coal, grains and to pay laborers.

The dreams of Rocío are that her children finish their studies, she has a house in the city of Ayacucho and that her businesses grow.

Translated from Spanish by Helen C. Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

Rocío pertenece al Banco Comunal 28 de noviembre hace 2 años, Rocío vive en el Distrito de Acosvinchos que esta a 1 hora de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Rocío es casada, tiene 31 años y 3 hijos, Rocío junto a su esposo fabrican tejas artesanales, sus ventas lo realizan a intermediarios. También Rocío tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Además Rocío viaja a las ferias donde vende frutas y en las feria compra cereales que son vendidos posteriormente en el mercado Nery García.

Rocío necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña, carbón, cereales y para el pago de los peones.

Los sueños de Rocío son que sus hijos terminen sus estudios, tener una casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho y que sus negocios crezcan.

loans.use: Rocío needs a loan of 2000 soles, money that will be used to buy firewood, coal, grains and to pay laborers

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44153

loans.name: Mario José

texts.es:
The sale of firewood and charcoal is the occupation of Mario José V., who is married with three small children who need his support to mature and get ahead in life. His wife is a homemaker.

To start his business, Mario had to sell a small plot of land that he owned. One of his greatest dreams is to increase his sales to one day have a prosperous business that permits him and his family to improve their standard of living and have a little more financial stability.

He hopes in the future to be able to educate his children so they will have better career opportunities. Mario needs the loan to build a wall in the back part of his house to be able to live more securely and prevent theft.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de leña y carbón es el oficio del Sr. Mario José V., el es casado, tiene 3 hijos pequeños que necesitan de su apoyo para formarse y salir adelante en la vida. Su esposa se dedica al quehacer diario de la casa. Don Mario para iniciarse en este negocio tuvo que vender un pequeño solar que poseía , uno de sus grandes sueños es incrementar sus niveles de venta y así lograr tener un día un negocio próspero que permita que él y su familia puedan mejorar su nivel de vida y tener un poco más de estabilidad económica. Espera en un futuro educar a sus hijos para que estos tengan mejores oportunidades de trabajo. Don Mario necesita el préstamo para construir un muro en la parte trasera de su casa y de esa manera asegurarla, para evitarse robos.

loans.use: Build a wall at the rear of the house for added security.

loans.name: Carmen's Group

texts.es:
Carmen, Paulina and Teofila belong to the Community Bank November 28th and have been members for two years. The members are from the District of Acosvinchos, which is an hour from the city of Ayacucho.

Carmen lives with her partner, is 31 years old and has five children, of which three live with her. Camen sells food in a market in her district. In addition, she sells fruits from a mobile cart.

Paulina is married, 36 years old and has five children. Paulina sells pork in her district.

Teofila is married, 48 years old and has ten children, of which four live with her. Teofila makes handicraft tiles.

Carmen, Paulina and Teofila need loans of 450 soles, 600 soles, 750 soles, money that will be used to buy cookies, candies, fruits, pork and to pay the laborers.

The dreams of Carmen, Paulina and Teofila are to educate their children, build good houses and have bigger businesses that produce mO. tiles.

Translated from Spanish by Helen C.Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmen, Paulina y Teofila pertenecen al Banco Comunal 28 D. noviembre hace 2 años respectivamente. Las socias son del Distrito D. Acosvinchos que queda a 1 hora D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Carmen es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 5 hijos D. los cuales 3 viven con ella, Carmen venD. comida en el mercado D. su distrito. Además venD. frutas D. manera ambulatoria.

Por otro lado Paulina es casada, tiene 36 años y 5 hijos, Paulina venD. carne D. cerdo en su distrito.

Mientras que Teofila es casada, tiene 48 años y 10 hijos D. los cuales 4 viven con ella, Teofila se dedica a la fabricación D. tejas artesanales.

Carmen, Paulina y Teofila necesitan préstamos D. 450 soles, 600 soles, 750 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. galletas, caramelos, frutas, cerdo y para el pago D. los peones.

Los sueños D. Carmen, Paulina y Teofila son educar a sus hijos, construir una casa buena, su negocio sea más granD. y producir más tejas.

loans.use: Carmen, Paulina and Teofila need loans of 450 soles, 600 soles and 750 soles, money that will be used to buy cookies, candies, fruits, pork and to pay laborers.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44155

loans.name: Raquel Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mrs. Raquel del Socorro A. dedicates herself to food preparation in an eatery owned by her brother-in-law. She is, even today, working arduously to slowly make improvements to her home.

Her husband also works and, from Costa Rica, helps her out financially toward these upgrades with the hope of providing their children with a more decent dwelling. Raquel’s goal is to improve her family’s standard of living and, currently, she has three school-aged children who she hopes to help get ahead in life.

She needs a loan to replace the roof on their house to ensure that the following winter their living quarters will not experience problems with leaks, their clothes won’t get damp and they don’t encounter moisture within the home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Raquel del Socorro A. se dedica a la elaboración de comida en una comidería propiedad de su cuñado, ella hasta hoy ha trabajado duro y arduamente para ir acondicionando su casa poco a poco. Su esposo también trabaja y desde Costa Rica le ayuda económicamente para realizarle mejoras a su casa y de esa manera lograr que sus hijos tengan una vivienda digna. Doña Raquel tiene como meta mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, ella actualmente tiene 3 niños que están en edad escolar y a pesar de su difícil situación espera que sus hijos salgan adelante. Ella requiere un crédito para cambiar el techo de su casa y de esa manera asegurarse que para el próximo invierno su vivienda no tendrá problemas de goteras, su ropa no se humedecerá y no tendrá más el problema humedad dentro de su hogar.

loans.use: Replace the roof on her house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Ms. Maria is 25 years old and she lives with her parents and brothers. She owns a convenience store located next to her house which she runs along with her 35 year-old sister, Rosa.

This business has been in existence for over a year at the same location. Maria and her sister are hairdressers and, besides the convenience store, they also own a small hair parlor. They take turns serving their customers whom, at many times, are exclusive clients that want to be served by Maria or her sister.

Maria wishes to continue her graduate studies, and that is why she keeps working hard and saving money so she will have enough to pay for an education. She is aware that a college degree will bring about better opportunities in life.

Maria has received a merchandise purchase offer at a very good price. She wishes to obtain a credit line that would allow her to buy this merchandise pack which includes: flour, olive oil, canned goods, household items among others.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

La señorita Maria tiene 25 años, vive en casa de sus padres, junto con sus dos hermanos, ella posee una despensa al lado de su casa la cual la administra con su hermana Rosa quien tiene 35 años.

Este negocio lleva más de un año de funcionamiento en dicho lugar, además de la despensa, María y su hermana son peluqueras, por lo que además de la tienda poseen una pequeña peluquería la cual se turnan para atender, en muchos casos ellas ya poseen clientas exclusivas que desean ser atendidas por María o por su hermana.

Maria desea seguir estudiando y cursar una carrera universitaria, para lo que ella se sacrifica día a día trabajando y ahorrando para obtener los rubros suficientes para sus estudios, ella sabe que un titulo universitario le brindará mayores oportunidades en la vida.

María ha recibido una buena propuesta de compra de mercaderías a un buen precio, por lo que ella esta muy deseosa de adquirir un crédito con el que podrá comprar este lote de mercaderías que incluye: harina, aceite, productos enlatados, artículos para el hogar, entre otras cosas.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as, flour, olive oil, canned goods, household items and others.

loans.name: Carlos Adolfo

texts.es:
Carlos Adolfo H. D. is a merchant who for some time has sold clothing in the Ruberto Huembes Market, one of the most well-known and visited in the capital city. He started his business delivering on order, and now has his own store in the market. He has two people helping him tend to customer needs, and he hopes in the future to improve his business and provide a better service. Carlos is 57 years old, single, and has one 20 year old son.

One of his aspirations is to grow his enterprise so he can continue helping his son prepare himself for better future prospects. With the loan, Carlos hopes to invest in his enterprise and this way be able to enhance his inventory with new merchandise to offer at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Carlos Adolfo H. D. es un pequeño comerciante dedicado desde hace mucho a la venta de ropa en el Mercado Roberto Huembes, inició su negocio colocando mercadería por encargo, este mercado es uno de los más conocidos en nuestra capital y por supuesto uno de los más visitados. El Sr. H. actualmente tiene su tienda en dicho mercado, cuenta con dos personas encargadas de atender a los clientes, espera en un futuro ampliar su negocio y brindar una mejor atención. Don Carlos es una persona de 57 años, soltero, tiene solamente un hijo de 20 años. Una de sus aspiraciones es lograr que su negocio pueda crecer y de esa manera poder continuar ayudando a su hijo a prepararse para que este tenga un mejor porvenir. Con el préstamo don Carlos espera invertirlos en su negocio y de esa manera surtir su negocio con nueva mercadería que será ofertada en dicho mercado.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to supply his business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: La Paz Group

texts.es:
The Community Bank “La Paz,” or Peace, is a bank that began recently with 24 members. The members are from the community of Yanama in the district of Carmen Alto, which is 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. The great majority of this group is maD. up of people who migrated from the different provinces of the district onto these lands.

The members are engaged in different businesses, such as the sale of groceries, clothes, cheeses, foods, fruits, firewood, drinks and small animals.

The members need different amounts of loans; some of the amounts are 300 soles or 600 soles, adding up a total of 12,000 soles of loans in the Community Bank.

The loans will be used for the purchase of rice, noodles, oil, sugar, beer, soft drinks, eucalyptus trees, animals, cheeses, polos, sweaters, fruits and firewood.

The dreams of the members are that their businesses prosper, they have a good house and their children have a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Helen C. Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco Comunal “La Paz” es un banco que recién inicia con 24 socios. Los socios son provenientes D. la comunidad D. Yanama, distrito D. Carmen Alto, que esta a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Esta comunidad esta integrado en gran mayoría por personas que migraron D. diferentes provincias del departamento y que invadieron estas tierras.

Los socios realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes, ropa, quesos, comidas, frutas, leña, bebidas, animales menores.

Los socios necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total D. 12,000 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. arroz, fideo, aceite, azúcar, cerveza, gaseosas, árboles D. eucalipto, animales, quesos, polos, chompas, frutas y leña.

Los sueños D. los socios es que sus negocios prosperen, tener una buena casa y que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.

loans.use: The loans will be used to buy rice, noodles, oil, sugar, beer, soft drinks, eucalyptus trees, animals, cheeses, polos, sweaters, fruits and firewood.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther is a member of Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, and is located at Av. Micaela Bastidas S/N, in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 23 years old and has one son. Her husband works measuring wood. Esther previously received a loan of $100 and invested it in a business selling brooms.

She still woks at this business, and gets up very early in the morning to prepare her brooms, which she manufactures at home, and also do keep up with her housework.

With this next loan of $450, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy broomsticks, fibres and blocks.

Esther is very happy, saying that the loans she receives from Manuela Ramos are a great help in enabling her to be more independent and care for her son better.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Esther pertenece al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, ubicado en la Av. Micaela Bastidas S/N, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 23 años es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo es cubicador (quien mide la madera). Esther con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de escobas.

En la actualidad continua con su negocio, se levanta muy temprano para confeccionar sus escobas ya que ella misma las elabora en su casa y lo alterna con las labores domesticas de su hogar.

Con este préstamo recibido de S/. 1,100, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará palos para escoba, fibras, tacos.

Esther se siente muy bien, dice que es una gran ayuda los prestamos que recibe de Manuela Ramos por que la hacen ser mas independiente y puede darle lo mejor a su hijo.

loans.use: To buy broomsticks, fibres and other goods for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: compra de mercaderías para la venta.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria is a member of the Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, and is located at Jr Elmer Fauceet 753 in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 40 years old and has three children. Her husband is a merchant.

She has a shop, where she also works, and used profits to purchase a motorcycle with the aim of increasing the family income. Her husband does the motorcycle runs, while Gloria tends to the shop with her children.

With this loan of $925, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy food supplies, such as rice, sugar, milk, soap, detergent, oil, bread, eggs, shampoo, preserved food etc. One part of the loan will also be earmarked for maintaining the motorcycle.

Gloria says that the support she receives from Manuela Ramos is a great help, enabling her to save, to make purchases, to care better for her children and to continue looking ahead.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

En la actualidad continua con su bodega y con las ganancias obtenidas compro un motocarro para aumentar mas los ingresos en su familia, su esposo es quien maneja el motocarro mientras Gloria con la ayuda de sus hijos atienden su bodega.

Con este préstamo recibido de S/. 2,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará abarrotes como: arroz, azúcar, leche, jabón, detergente, aceite, pan, huevos, champú, conservas, etc, y una parte de su préstamo destino al mantenimiento de su motocarro.

Gloria dice que la ayuda que recibe de Manuela Ramos es un buen apoyo y le permite ahorrar para poder comprar otras cosas y darle lo mejor a sus hijos y seguir adelante sin mirar atrás.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria is a young entrepreneur. She is 32, married and the mother of three children - the oldest being a 16 years old girl and two boys aged 12 and 2 years old. The girl and the oldest boy are attending school and they are distinguished students due to their sense of responsibility and good grades.

They have lived in their own home for over ten years. They were able to own this house thanks to her effort and her husband dedication to succeed in life and provide a good education for their children. Her husband sells different kinds of merchandise in the city's local market, while Maria sells men's and women's clothing through orders.

Since Encarnacion borders the city of Posadas, Argentina, her main customers belong to the neighboring country. They place the orders and she takes the merchandise to them in either small or large quantities.

Maria says that profits have helped her save and cover family's expenses, that is the reason she constantly wishes to increase merchandise stock so that she can fulfill the orders placed by her growing clientele. This time she is requesting a credit line in order to purchase more merchandise such as, jeans pants, skirts, t-shirts, blouses, socks, shoes and others.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Maria es una joven mujer emprendedora de 32 años, casada y madre de tres hijos, la mayor de 16 años y dos varones de 12 y 2 años. Los hijos mayores ya van al colegio, y se destacan por su responsabilidad y buenas calificaciones.

Ellos viven en su casa propia hace mas de 10 años, casa que pudieron adquirir gracias al esfuerzo de ella y su marido que lucha día a día junto a ella para salir adelante y darle la mejor educación a sus hijos. Su marido se dedica a la venta de distintos tipos de mercaderías en el mercado municipal de la ciudad, mientras que María se dedica a la venta de ropas para damas y caballeros bajo pedido. Ya que la ciudad de Encarnación limita con la ciudad de Posadas – Argentina, sus principales clientes son del vecino país, ya que ellos le realizan los pedidos y ella los lleva para venderlos ya se en poca o en grandes cantidades.

María dice que sus ganancias la han ayudado bastante a ahorrar y con los gastos de la familia, es por eso que constantemente ella desea ampliar su stock de mercaderías de modo a abastecer los pedidos de su creciente clientela. Hoy día ella esta solicitando un crédito con el que podrá comprar mercaderías como jeans, faldas, camisas, remeras, ropa para otoño, medias, algunos calzados, entre otros.

loans.use: Purchase clothing for retail.

loans.name: Jessenia Melina

texts.es:
Jessenia belongs to the "Ricardo Palma" lending group, located at 735 Elmer Faucett Street, in the district of Calleria and the department of Ucayali. She is 30 years old and has one child. Her husband works independently. With her first loan of 300 Soles from Manuela Ramos, Jessenia decided to invest in a writing and copy shop business.

With the profits made from that first loan, she invested in the purchase of four computers to rent as part of an internet cafe. With the help of her children, Jessenia manages both the business and her domestic chores.

With this loan of 2500 Soles, to be paid over five months, she will purchase school supplies, a photocopier, and other goods such as paper and ink for her store.

Jessenia says that the loans from Manuela Ramos help women that want to get ahead.

Translated by Daniel Kahn, Kiva staff

La señora Jessenia pertenece al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, ubicado en el Jr. Elmer Faucett 735, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo es trabajador independiente. Jessenia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en el negocio de redacción de documentos (tipeos).

En la actualidad con las ganancias obtenidas invirtió en las compra de 4 computadoras para alquiler de cabinas de Internet, con la ayuda de sus hijos atienen el negocio y se reparten las tareas domesticas de su hogar.

Con este préstamo recibido de S/. 2,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará útiles escolares, una maquina fotocopiadora, y insumos como papel, tinta, etc, para su negocio.

Jessenia dice que los prestamos de Manuela Ramos apoyan a las mujeres que quieren sobresalir

loans.use: For the purchase of school supplies and other materials

loans.name: Socorro Felicidad's Group

texts.es:
Felicidad, Socorro and Eduarda have belonged to the Community Bank “Nueva Era” for 8, 7, and 3 years respectively.

Felicidad is married, 68 years old and has two daughters. She has a store where she sells groceries, vegetables and clothes, located in the district of Quinua, one hour from the city of Ayacucho. Socorro is married, 35 years old and has two daughters. Socorro sells clothes on credit to friends and relatives. She also sells cosmetics through catalogues.

Eduarda is married, 45 years old and has three children. Eduarda goes to the Huanta market where she buys small animals, selling them in the district of Quinua. She also makes clay crafts. Felicidad, Socorro and Eduarda need loans of 1000 soles, 1000 soles and 300 soles respectively, money for the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, oil, snacks, creams, perfume, clothes and guinea pig. The dreams of Felicidad, Socorro and Eduarda are that their businesses prosper, they have stable jobs and their children are professionals.

Translated from Spanish] by Helen C. Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

Felicidad, Socorro y Eduarda pertenecen al Banco Comunal Nueva Era hace 8, 7, 3 años respectivamente.

Felicidad es casada, tiene 68 años y 2 hijas, Felicidad tiene una bodega donD. venD., abarrotes, verduras, ropa, esta ubicado en el distrito D. Quinua que esta a 1 hora D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Por otro lado Socorro es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijas, Felicidad venD. ropa a crédito a amigos y familiares. Además venD. cosméticos por catálogos.

Mientras que Eduarda es casada, tiene 45 años y 3 hijos, Eduarda viaja a la feria D. Huanta donD. compra animales menores y lo venD. en el Distrito D. Quinua. Además realiza artesanías en arcilla.

Felicidad, Socorro y Eduarda necesitan préstamos D. 1000 soles, 1000 soles, 300 soles respectivamente, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, golosinas, cremas, perfumes, ropa y cuy.

Los sueños D. Felicidad, Socorro y Eduarda son que sus negocios prosperen, tener un trabajo estable y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Felicidad, Socorro and Eduarda need loans of 1000 soles, 1000 soles and 300 soles respectively, money for the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, oil, snacks, creams, perfume, clothes and guinea pig

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 44165

loans.name: Merina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Merina belongs to the Santa Rosa de Lima communal bank, located in the San Juan Bautista settlement, lot 28, of the Calleria district of the Ucayali province. She is 63 years old and the mother of 3 children. Her husband is a merchant. With the first loan of ~$110 she received from Manuela Ramos, Merina decided to invest in the sale of clothing.

Currently, she continues selling clothing and also sells pre-paid cell phone cards. She gets up very early to prepare breakfast for her husband and children; she prepares lunch and takes it to her children at school, and in the afternoon, she sells her clothing and phone cards.

With this $375 loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy more clothing such as t-shirts, dress shirts, pants, skirts, etc. and more cell phone cards.

Merina would like to rent a store where she can offer her products and she hopes to do so through the loans offered by Manuela Ramos. Her desires and enthusiasm help her to move forward everyday.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Merina pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Rosa de Lima, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano San Juan Bautista Lt. 28, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 63 años es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Merina con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de ropa. En la actualidad continua con su negocio de venta de ropa, y también vende tarjetas telefónicas para celulares, se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y esposo, prepara el almuerzo lleva a sus hijos a la escuela y por la tardes se dedica a vender sus prendas y las tarjetas telefónicas. Con este préstamo recibido de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará ropa como: polos, camisas, pantalones, faldas, etc., y tarjetas para celulares claro y movistar. Merina esta pensando en alquilar un local para poder ofrecer sus productos, y espera lograrlo con los prestamos que le brinda Manuela Ramos, con las ganas, el entusiasmo que tiene la hace salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of additional clothing to sell

loans.name: Dominga Del Socorro

texts.es:
Dominga is a secondary school teacher in Managua. She is single and, to this day, she has taken it upon herself to support her mother with all her needs. She is a responsible and very hard-working woman, with high moral principles that have brought about her pursuit of a career in education.

Dominga has 20 years of experience in teaching, a profession that she hopes to continue to devote herself to because it gives her much joy to know she is helping to shape the professionals of the future. She considers this a great responsibility.

With a loan, she hopes to build a room in her house so she can have a better place in which to work and rest.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Dominga es profesora de secundaria de un Instituto de Managua, es soltera, hasta el día de hoy siempre se ha encargado de apoyar a su mamá en todas sus necesidades. Es una mujer responsable y muy trabajadora, con principios morales muy altos que son los que le permiten desempeñar esta carrera como es la de educar. Doña Dominga tiene 20 años de trabajar en la docencia, espera seguir laborando en este ramo, ya que a ella esta profesión le llena porque siente que esta formando a los futuros profesionales del mañana; por tanto considera que tiene una gran responsabilidad a cargo. Con el préstamo la señora espera construir un cuarto en su casa que tenga buenas condiciones para trabajar y descansar.

loans.use: Build a bedroom in her house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Francisco José

texts.es:
Francisco is a person who has always devoted himself to working in factories in the area of production. One of his dreams is to improve the living conditions within his own home, allowing his children to live in a more dignified manner.

He has two children, both of whom are in school, who he hopes to see get ahead and forge a better future.

The loan that Francisco seeks would be for the installation of bathroom/sanitary facilities in his house. This would provide for more privacy as well as a more sanitary existence for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Francisco es una persona que se ha dedicado por siempre a trabajar en fábricas en el área de producción, uno de sus sueños es lograr mejorar las condiciones de vida de su hogar y de esa manera conseguir que sus hijos vivan dignamente dentro de su casa. El tiene dos hijos ambos estudiantes y cuenta con que los dos muchachos saldrán adelante para forjarse un mejor futuro en la vida. El préstamo que esta solicitando don Francisco es para invertirlo en la instalación de servicios higiénicos en su casa. Esto permitirá a sus familiares contar con un lugar donde ellos puedan hacer sus necesidades fisiológicas y en esa medida logrará que su hogar cuente con mejores condiciones sanitarias.

loans.use: Purchase and installation of sanitary facilities for the home.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Micaela belongs to the Ricardo Palma communal bank, located at 420 Ricardo Palma St., in the Calleria district of the Ucayali province. She is 71 years old and the widowed mother of 6 children. With the first loan of ~$110 that Micaela received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in a business sewing sheets and bedspreads.

Currently, she still sews and now has more customers. Due to the fine finishing touches she puts on her products, her earnings have increased. Her children support her in everything she does and are very proud of her.

With this $375 loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy different colored fabrics, threads, silk lace, elastics, etc.

Micaela feels great because she is working hard and she feels very active.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Micaela pertenece al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, ubicado en el Jr. Ricardo Palma 420, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 71 años es madre D. 6 hijos, es viuda. Micaela con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la costura D. sabanas y cubrecamas. En la actualidad sigue cociendo, ahora cuenta con mas cliente, por el buen acabo D. sus confecciones sus ganancias han aumentado, sus hijos siempre la apoyan en todo, y están muy orgullosos D. ella. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará telas D. diferentes colores, hilos, blondas, elástico, etc. Micaela se siente muy bien por que esta trabajando y se siente muy activa y eso la hace sentir bien.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, thread, etc. for her business

loans.name: Niza

texts.es:
Niza belongs to the Ricardo Palma communal bank, located on 349 Cesar Calvo D. Araujo St., in the Calleria district of the Ucayali province. She is 61 years old and the mother of 6 children. Her husband works for a company, but his income is insufficient to cover their daily household costs; that is why Niza used the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of ~$110 to invest in a small store.

Currently, her store has grown and now she sells more products and some clothing goods. Her children help her with attending to clients in the store and in carrying out the household chores, and in the afternoons, she leaves the store to buy the products that she needs.

With this $750 loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy groceries like rice, sugar, milk, soap, detergent, vegetable oil, bread, eggs, toiletries, etc.

Niza feels like a fulfilled woman; she is very hard-working and enjoys being active. She puts all her energy into pushing forward for the good of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Niza pertenece al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, ubicado en el Jr. Cesar Calvo D. Araujo 349, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 61 años es madre D. 6 hijos, su esposo trabaja en una compañía, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Niza con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad su bodega ha crecido ahora venD. mas productos y un poco D. pasamanería, la atención D. su bodega y las tareas domesticas las realiza paralelamente cuenta con la ayuda D. sus hijos, y en las tardes sale a comprar los productos que le faltan. Con este préstamo recibido D. S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche, jabón, detergente, aceite, pan, huevos, artículos D. tocador, etc. Niza se siente una mujer realizada es muy trabajadora le gusta estar activa y pone todo su empeño en seguir adelante por el bien D. sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.es:
Norma Luz belongs to the Santa Rosa de Lima communal bank, located on Universitaria Avenue, Block A, Lot 27, in the Yarinacocha district, of the Ucayali province. She is 63 years old, the married mother of 3 children, and her husband is a merchant.

Currently, she continues running her general store and has expanded it even more. Her children help her to attend to the store and to do the household chores, and when they can, they enjoy taking walks together to have some pleasant times as a family.

With the $750 loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy one large sack of rice, one of sugar, a box of milk, one box of vegetable oil, two packages of noodles, one bag of detergent, and two boxes of canned food.

Norma feels great about how her business is growing and, in the future, she plans to buy clothing decoration products to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Norma Luz pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Rosa de Lima, ubicado en el Av. Universitaria Mz. A Lt. 27, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 63 años es madre de 3 hijos, es casada su esposo es comerciante. En la actualidad continua con su bodega pero la ha ampliado mas, con la ayuda de sus hijos atienden la bodega y se reparten las tareas domesticas, y cuando pueden salen a pasear para pasar momentos gratos en familia. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 caja de leche, 1 caja de aceite, 2 paquetes de fideos, 1 bolsa de detergentes, 2 cajas de conservas. Norma se siente muy bien, como su negocio esta creciendo piensa mas adelante comprar artículos de pasamanería .

loans.use: Purchase of additional merchandise for her business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa belongs to the Santa Rosa D. Lima communal bank, located in the San Juan Bautista settlement, Block C, Lot 18, in the Calleria district of the Ucayali province. She is 39 years old, the mother of 4 children, and is separated from her husband. With the first loan Rosa received from Manuela Ramos of ~$110, she invested in a small store.

Currently, she continues running her store and it has grown significantly and is well stocked. Her children help her to attend to the store and to do the household chores.

With the $750 loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy one large sack of rice, one of sugar, a box of milk, a box of vegetable oil, two packs of noodles, soda pop, and candy.

All the effort she puts forth is in order to give the best she can to her kids and to offer them a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Rosa D. Lima, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano. San Juan Bautista Mz. C Lt. 18, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 39 años es madre D. 4 hijos, es separada. Rosa con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad continua con su bodega que ahora ha crecido y esta muy surtida con la ayuda D. sus hijos la atienD. y se reparten las tareas domesticas. Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 1 saco D. arroz, 1 saco D. azúcar, 1 caja D. leche, 1 caja D. aceite, 2 paquetes D. fideos, gaseosa, golosinas. Todo el esfuerzo que hace es para darle lo mejor a sus hijos y brindarles una buena educación.

loans.use: Purchase of additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura belongs to the communal bank Ricardo Palma, located on 839 Elmer Faucett St., in the Calleria district of the Ucayali province. She is 59 years old and the mother of 6 children. Her husband is retired, but his pension does not cover the daily household costs; that is why Rosaura used the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of ~$110 to invest in merchandise to sell.

Currently, she continues with her business; she gets up very early to finish her household chores, and in the afternoon, she leaves her home to sell merchandise in various neighborhoods of the city.

With this $375 loan, which she will pay back in 5 months, she will buy merchandise like t-shirts, dresses, skirts, dress shirts, pants, etc. for men, women, and children.
