Mwanamboto is a fish seller with a business she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 7am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.  She now hopes for a loan of $650 to buy more fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling fish, charcoal and firewood.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Ferdinanda's Neema Group

texts.en: Ferdinanda is 27 years old and is a single woman. Ferdinanda is also a soft drink seller, and has been working in this business since 2007. Everyday, she works from 7am to 7pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.  She now hopes for a loan of $400 to buy more  items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Viana and Rehema, who have cloth selling businesses.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en: Mwajuma is 35 years old and is a married woman with three children. Mwajuma is also a coconut seller through a business she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.  She now hopes for a loan of $150 to buy more coconuts  for her business.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru:
Bahodur Homirzoev lives in Shahrinav region of Tajikistan. He is 32 years old, married and has 2 children. To provide for his family Bahodur has been managing his own business for the last 6 years. He owns a cafe where he makes kebobs and bakes sambusas (fried pastry with meat filling). Recently the prices for flour have been rising and Bahodur wants to buy a large batch of flour so that he can keep his food prices low despite the rising flour costs. This will help him keep his regular customers and attract new ones. But he needs money to be able to purchase such a large batch of flour. That is why Bahodur has planned to take out a loan of 450 dollars which he wants to pay back in the next 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Холмирзоев Баходур Проживает в районе Шахринау. Ему 32 года. Баходур женат и имеет 2 детей. Для того , чтобы обеспечить свою семью клиент занимается бизнесом. Имеет свое дело.Имеет столовую ,где готовит шашлыки и выпекает самбусу. Занимается этим видом бизнеса Баходур уже 6 лет. В связи с увеличением цен на муку ему необходимо закупить и запастись данным видом сырья, для того чтобы сохранить цены на предлагаемую продукцию. Это поможет клиенту сохранить постоянных клиентов и привлечь новых. Для этого ему нужны деньги. И поэтому он запланировал получить кредит в размере 450 долларов. Погасить кредит он сможет в течение 9 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Zakati

texts.en: Zakati is a married woman with four children.  Zakati also owns a small domestics shop, which she started in 1996. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.  She now hopes for a loan of $150 to buy more household items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more household items for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Mahbuba R. lives in the city of Vahdat in Tajikistan. She is 30 years old, widowed and has 2 children. She is the sole bread winner for her family. Mahbuba has to work a lot to be able to support her children. She rents a stall at the local market where she sells children's clothing. Mahbuba is currently planning to expand her inventory and the variety of goods she offers for sale. This will help increase her profits and attract new clients to her stall with unique goods she has to offer. To finance this expansion Mahbuba is planning to take out a loan of 600 US dollars and pay pack the money in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Рахмонова Махбуба проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 30 лет . У нее 2 детей , но муж умер. Поэтому является единственным кормильцем семьи. Ей приходится много работать , чтобы обеспечить детей. Махбуба занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку на районом рынке, где продает детскую одежду. Сейчас клиентка запланировала увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет увеличить доход , а так же привлечь новых клиентов ввозом нового ассортимента. Для этого Махбуба хочет получить кредит в размере 600 долларов США. А погаситькредит клиентка сможет в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Expanding inventory

loans.name: Dativa's Awali Group

texts.en: Dativa  is a married woman with 3 children.  She is also a cloth seller through a business she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 7am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $265 from her sales.  She now hopes for a loan of $425 to buy more cloth for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mawkema and Asha, who have businesses in cloth sales and soft drinks sales.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.ru:
Abdurasul Toshimirov lives in Tursun-zoda. He is married and has 4 children. He has a professional degree as an engineer. Since Abdurasul is currently cannot find work as an engineer, he has been earning his living as a salesman. He rents a stall at the local market where he sells spare parts. Abdurasul has been maintaining his business for the last three years. His business is the sole source of income for his family and it also supports the local community by providing them with spare parts without the need to travel outside of their region. Abdurasul is currently planning to increase his inventory and the variety of goods he offers for sale. This will allow him to better supply the market and will increase his profits. To finance this expansion Abdurasul has turned to us for a loan. He is planning to take out a loan of 1025 US dollars and pay pack the money in the next 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Тошмиров Абдурасул житель города Турсун-заде. Женат , имеет 4 детей. Имеет средне-техническое образование. По специальности инженер. Но так как у Абдурасула нет постоянного места работы , он занимается бизнесом. На рынке города имеет торговую точку , на которой торгует запчастями .Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 3 года. Его бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Кроме того он помогает населению , обеспечивая их необходимым товаром. При этом им не приходится выезжать за покупками за приделы их местности. Клиент на данный момент хочет увеличить товарооборот и ассортимент товара. Этим он сможет увеличить предложение на рынке , а так же увеличить собственный доход. Поэтому он обратился к нам за кредитом. Планирует получить кредит в размере 1025 долларов США, а погасить кредит сможет в течение 9 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru:
Gulsara B. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 52 and married with three children. She has a secondary school education. Gulsara has a business to support her family. She has a trading stall at the market where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been in business for 18 years. With the coming season, she needs to buy new goods. To increase her sales volume, Gulsara needs financial assistance. She decided to apply for a loan of 600 US dollars. This will help her increase the assortment of goods and meet the demands of the local population. Gulsara plans to repay her loan within nine months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Баротова Гульсара проживает в городе Турсун-Заде.Возраст 52 года, замужем и имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Чтобы обеспечить семью Гульсара занялась торговлей. На данный момент имеет торговую точку на рынке , где продает фрукты и овощи. . Занимается торговлей уже 18 лет. С приходом нового сезона для торговли необходимо закупить новый товар. А для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот ей необходима финансовая помощь. Поэтому она решила получить кредит в размере 600 долларов США. Это поможет увеличить ассортимент и удовлетворить спрос населения. Погасить кредит Гульсара планирует в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Fatuma's Nafasi Group

texts.en: Fatuma is 30 years old and is a married woman with three children. Fatuma is a cloth seller through a business she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 9am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.  She now hopes for a loan of $725 to buy more cloth for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing cloth sales, charcoal and firewood sales and food sales.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business.

loans.name: Bisiti

texts.en: Bisiti is 21 years old and is married. Bisiti is a cloth seller, having started her business in 2006. She decided to start her business because it would allow her to learn about commercial practices.  Everyday, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.  She now hopes for a loan of $150 to buy more cloth for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Jokha

texts.en: Jokha is  a married woman with 3 children, ages 18,17, and 20 years old. Jokha is a chicken seller, she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $200 from her sales.  She now hopes for a loan of $150 to buy more chicken for her business.

loans.use: To buy more chickens.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is 30 years old and is married with 3 children, ages 14, 12 and 4 years old. Fatuma owns a small general store, which she started in 2002. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from sales. She now hopes for a loan of $175 to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Semeni's Ujinga Basi Group

texts.en: Semeni is 22 years old and married.  Semeni owns a small cloth and grocery shop, which she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $75 from her sales.  Semeni now hopes for a loan of $275 to buy more cloth and grocery items for her business. She will also share this loan with her subgroup member Rukia, who has a business dealing in cloth sales.

loans.use: To buy more shop and grocery item for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Sedina

texts.en:
Sedina was born in 1973 and she lives together with her husband in a small village near the town of Gračanica. Her husband works as a policeman. His monthly salary is 700 KM (about US$ 560). He has a full-time job. They have two children, 9 and 14 years old, and both of them are going to primary school.

This is Sedina's second loan at MCO WWI. Sedina will use this loan in the amount of US$ 975 to buy a cow. Her wish is to improve the living standard of her family with additional money that she will earn by selling milk and milk products.

loans.use: To buy a cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 22 years old and is a single  woman. She owns a small shop which holds different comodities like sugar, cooking oil, kerosine, flour, etc.  She started this business in 2005, and she works everyday from 7am to 6pm and earns a monthly profit of about $110. She now hopes for a loan of $175 to buy more items for her shop.

loans.use: To buy  more items.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is22 years old and is single woman. Elizabeth owns a small shop which hold different comodities like sugar, cooking oil, kerosine, flour and etc, which she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her shop.

loans.use: To buy  more items for her shop.

loans.name: Sina's Jiendeleze Group

texts.en: Sina is 28 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 10 and 6 years old.  Sina is cloth seller, and has been working in this field since 2002. Everyday, she works from 7:30am to 6:30pm and earns a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.  Sina now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth which she will distribute and sell. She will also share this loan with her subgroup member Saluna, who is another shop owner.

loans.use: To buy more cloth.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Emira

texts.en:
Emira is a 58-year-old woman from Donja Orahovica, a small village near the town of Gračanica. She is married and her husband has a full-time job in a shopping mall. His monthly income is 400 KM (about US$ 320). They live alone and this is her second loan through MCO WWI.

Emira intends to use this loan in the amount of US$ 500 for buying compost for her agriculture work. Her wish is to improve her monthly income and their living standard generally.

loans.use: To buy compost for her fields

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mwanaulu

texts.en:
Mwanaulu is 42 years old and is married with 3 children, ages 15, 6, and 1. Mwanaulu is a charcoal and firewood seller; she started her business in 2005. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina E. is a chop- bar operator and a trader. She is married and has 5 children. She travels to a neighboring town to buy food items like yam, maize, millet etc in large quantities for sale. Business is doing very well but her major problem is the cost of transportation which is consuming her capital.

She is requesting $1025 as additional capital to reduce the burden of transportation costs on her limited capital.

loans.use: As additional capital to reduce the burden of transportation costs.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44269

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 7 bales of second-hand shoes

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi M.  is a seamstress and a trader. She sells lining and clothing materials. She is married and has 2 children. Business is doing well and she is helping her husband meet the financial needs of the family. She wishes to improve upon her business but she has financial limitations.

She is requesting $1025 as additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44271

loans.name: Elizabeth's Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 27 years old and is single with 1 child, age 1. Elizabeth owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2007. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Mwanahawa, who has a business dealing in charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles M. is a trader who deals in the sale of second hand clothing. He travels to Accra to buy the goods for sale. He is not yet married. He is focused on developing himself and expanding his business.

He is requesting $1025 as additional capital to enable him to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to enable him to buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Elenor Atta

texts.en:
Elenor Atta M. is a seller of pantries and provisions. She is a single parent of 1 child. She is working very hard to improve her income in order to take care of her child. She wants to increase sales but lacks enough capital.

She is requesting a loan of $1025 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44274

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of  ingredients and rent an enclosed  place to run his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase Materials

loans.name: Annet Kaweesi's Group

texts.en:
Annet is the leader of the group of five. She lost two of the original members and was joined by other two whose group disintegrated. She is 23 years of age and married with four children. They are aged 10, 7, 5, and 2 years old. Three are all in school. She had never accessed credit until she joined MCDT. The community she lives in is urban within a slum low-lying area.

The main challenge is she works in an open space and sometimes during the rainy season the area floods and the fast running water takes away her stock. In the hot season she has to bear the brunt of the sun.  There is ready market for her business.

Her benefits include being able to take her children to school and contributing to household expenditures. She has over the years acquired a refrigerator, a calf and goat.

She plans to acquire a plot of land to build a house.

Annet is paying her fourth loan.

loans.use: Increasing her stock of charcoal, food and grocery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase building materials like cement ,ballast,sand etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Acquire a public pay phone and also increase her stock.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a forty-year-old married father of five children. His wife works as a seamstress. He has been selling auto parts of different kinds for over fifteen years. He will use the loan proceeds to purchase more clutch disks and pressure plates from Korea. In Ghana there are no auto parts stores, but there is a high demand for parts as taxis are the main transportation option. His stand operates in an area of Accra called Abossey-Okai that is a conglomeration of hundreds of entrepreneurs who each sell specific auto parts.

In addition to using the loan to support his business, he wants to use the loan to support the operation of his tro-tro. A tro-tro is a van converted into a small bus. Eric is a member of the lending group Respect. The lending group works as a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure repayment.

loans.use: Eric would like to buy more clutch disks and pressure plates to sell.

loans.name: Vicky Najjeba's Group

texts.en:
Vicky is the leader of a group of four members. Vicky is 49 years of age and is a single mother with five children. They are ages 28, 27, 24, 23, and 18 years old. Two are in school and the rest are working. The community she lives in is urban within a slum low-lying area.

Her main challenges are selling in the open spaces in different markets, but walking around in order to sell her stock has proven to yield more profits.  There is a ready market for her business in the flooded surroundings after the rainy season.

Her benefits include being able to take her children to school, fending for her family, paying rent and acquiring saucepans, plates, ladles and others items for her outside catering business.

She has plans to start rearing livestock for commercial purposes in her rural home.

She has successfully paid back 4 MCDT loans.

loans.use: To increase her stock of used clothing and purchase more tools for her catering business

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is the thirty-six year old married father of one son. His wife works as a hairdresser. He has been selling auto parts of different kinds for over ten years. He will use the loan proceeds to purchase more clutch disks and pressure plates from Germany and Italy. In Ghana there are no auto parts stores, but there is a high demand for parts as the taxi networks are the main transportation option. His stand operates in an area of Accra called Abossey-Okai that is a conglomeration of hundreds of entrepreneurs who each sell specific auto parts.

Albert is a member of the lending group Respect. The lending group works as a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure repayment.

loans.use: Albert would like to buy more clutch disks and pressure plates to sell.

loans.name: Maxwell

texts.en:
Maxwell is the thirty-eight year old married father of three children. His wife also sells auto parts and is in the same trust group. Maxwell has been selling auto parts of different kinds for over eleven years. He will use the loan proceeds to purchase more clutch disks and pressure plates from Canada, Korea and the UK. In Ghana there are no auto parts stores, but there is a high demand for parts as the taxi networks are the main transportation option. His stand operates in an area of Accra called Abossey-Okai that is a conglomeration of hundreds of entrepreneurs who each sell specific auto parts.

Maxwell is a member of the lending group Respect. The lending group works as a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure repayment.

loans.use: Maxwell would like to buy more clutch disks and pressure plates to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Increase stock and utensils in her food cooking business.

loans.name: Issac

texts.en:
Isaac is the thirty-six year old married father of a three year old daughter. His wife sells ice cream treats. He will use the loan proceeds to purchase more clutch disks and pressure plates from Germany and Italy. In Ghana there are no auto parts stores, but there is a high demand for parts as the taxi networks are the main transportation option. His stand operates in an area of Accra called Abossey-Okai that is a conglomeration of hundreds of entrepreneurs who each sell specific auto parts.

Isaac hopes that he is able to increase his sales volume and can set aside more money to prepare for his daughter’s school fees. Isaac is a member of the lending group Respect. The lending group works as a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure repayment.

loans.use: Isaac would like to buy more clutch disks and pressure plates to sell.

loans.name: Liliana Rocio

texts.es:
A few months ago, I began to build a room at the back of my home. Currently, I am only missing a concrete roof in order to be able to use the new addition. I am a single mother and was able to finish the room only with much effort. I have future plans to add another room on the second floor, but this will have to wait until some later time. For now, I am eager to finish the roof on the room that is almost completed. I am asking for $1,200USD to add the concrete roof to the new room.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

“Hace algunos meses empecé la construcción de un cuarto atrás de mi vivienda, ahora solo me falta el techo de concreto para poder habitar ese cuarto yo soy madre soltera y con mucho esfuerzo logre terminar ese cuarto, tengo planes de hacer otro en la parte de arriba de mi casa pero tendrá que ser después, por ahora me urge ponerle el techo al cuarto que ya tengo listo”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para poner el techo de concreto a un cuarto en mi vivienda.

loans.use: Construction of a concrete roof.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is the thirty-four year old married father of a three year old son. His wife is a hairdresser. He has been selling auto parts of different kinds for over twelve years. He will use the loan proceeds to purchase more clutch disks and pressure plates from Korea and Canada. In Ghana there are no auto parts stores, but there is a high demand for parts as the taxi networks are the main transportation option. His stand operates in an area of Accra called Abossey-Okai that is a conglomeration of hundreds of entrepreneurs who each sell specific auto parts.

Evans hopes that he is able to increase his sales volume and can set aside more money to prepare for his sonr’s school fees. Evans is a member of the lending group Respect. The lending group works as a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure repayment.

loans.use: Evans would like to buy more clutch disks and pressure plates to sell.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is the thirty-two year old married operator of a small auto parts stand. He has been selling auto parts of different kinds for over nine years. He will use the loan proceeds to purchase more clutch disks and pressure plates from Korea and Holland. In Ghana there are no auto parts stores, but there is a high demand for parts as the taxi networks are the main transportation option. His stand operates in an area of Accra called Abossey-Okai that is a conglomeration of hundreds of entrepreneurs who each sell specific auto parts.

Edward also plans on using the proceeds of his business to help operate his taxi car. The taxi car is driven by his friend. Edward is a member of the lending group Respect. The lending group works as a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure repayment.

loans.use: Edward would like to buy more clutch disks and pressure plates to sell.

loans.name: Serunjogi Resty`s Group

texts.en:
Resty is 40 years of age and married with four children. They are aged 19, 17,13 and 12 years old. All her children are in school.
The community she lives in is semi-urban. It is a low-lying area, which is vulnerable to flooding during the rainy season. One of the challenges she faces is using the waterlogged roads and the poor sanitation during the wet season.
She has recently taken a loan for Shillings 1,000,000/= .She used the loan for increasing her stock, paid school dues and opened an eating-place.
She has managed to take her children to school because of MCDT loans. She is also able to get the basic needs to her family. She has also built a two-roomed house in which she plans to open a wholesale shop for essential commodities in her area of residence.
Resty has successfully paid back over ten MCDT loans over six years.

loans.use: Increase her stock.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
The land on which my house stands contains only an outhouse. Adding a bathroom inside my home would require a substantial capital investment, given that I have to install plumbing which costs more than I am able to pay. Now, I have some savings which is why I am seeking $700USD to be able to pay to have the bathroom in my house so my family is more comfortable and we all can have better sanitary conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

“En el terreno donde esta mi vivienda tenemos un baño de pozo, para poner el baño dentro de mi casa tenia que hacer una inversión muy fuerte de capital ya que tengo que meter la tubería y eso era mucho dinero para mis posibilidades, ahora tengo un ahorro y es por eso que les solicito la cantidad de $ 700.00 dlls para completar ese pago y poder tener el baño dentro de mi vivienda y darle a mi familia más comodidad y sobre todo más higiene.

loans.use: Construction of a bathroom.

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
Just a few months ago, I finished building a room in my house which is currently only missing the installation of a tile floor. My husband and I have worked very hard to be able to expand our house, given that we started with the purchase of the land and have to date been able to build two rooms which can now be lived in. We will continue to work for a better quality of life. I seek $900USD to be able to install a tile floor in my home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace algunos meses termine la construcción de un cuarto en mi vivienda ahora solo me falta poner el vitropiso, mi esposo y yo hemos trabajado mucho para poder hacer nuestra casa más grande, ya que empezamos comprando un terreno y hasta ahora hemos logrado hacer 2 cuartos los cuales ya podemos habitar, seguiremos trabajando para tener una mejor calidad de vida”. Solicito $ 900.00 dlls para poner vitropiso en mi vivienda.

loans.use: Install tile flooring.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a forty-year-old married father of a three-year-old son. His wife is a seamstress. Eric has been selling auto parts of different kinds for over twelve years. He will use the loan proceeds to purchase more clutch disks and pressure plates from Canada and Korea. In Ghana there are no auto parts stores, but there is a high demand for parts as the taxi networks are the main transportation option. His stand operates in an area of Accra called Abossey-Okai that is a conglomeration of hundreds of entrepreneurs who each sell specific auto parts.

Eric hopes the loan proceeds help him increase his sales volume and profits so that he can continue saving for his son’s school fees.

Eric is a member of the lending group Respect. The lending group works as a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure repayment.

loans.use: Eric would like to buy more clutch disks and pressure plates for his store.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is the twenty-nine year old operator of a small auto parts store. David has been selling auto parts of different kinds for over eight years. He will use the loan proceeds to purchase more clutch disks and pressure plates from Japan, Korea and Germany. In Ghana there are no auto parts stores, but there is a high demand for parts as the taxi networks are the main transportation option. His stand operates in an area of Accra called Abossey-Okai that is a conglomeration of hundreds of entrepreneurs who each sell specific auto parts.

David hopes the loan proceeds help him increase his sales volume and profits so that he can buy his own store or rent a store. Currently, he travels with all of his products to his stand everyday. With a permanent space, he could store his products overnight.

David is a member of the lending group Respect. The lending group works as a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure repayment.

loans.use: David would like to buy more clutch disks and pressure plates for his auto parts store.

loans.name: Hazaia

texts.en:
Hazaia is the mother of four children, who are all in school. She has been buying and retailing groundnuts for the past ten years. Hazaia buys her nuts from Savlugu (northern part of Ghana) and it takes about twelve hours to arrive back to the village. She wants to use her loan to buy more bags of groundnuts to reduce her frequent trips to Savlugu.

Hazaia is a member of the group called One People. Members use peer pressure on themselves as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: Hazaia would like to buy more bags of groundnuts.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 44295

loans.name: Ishola

texts.fr:
Born around 1963 in SEME in the OUEME valley, Mrs. ishola A. is married and has 7 children. From her youth, Mrs. Ishola A. has worked in the distribution of pagne cloth and various types of goods such as pharmaceutical products, jewelry, and so on. But after several years in this business, she left the sector because her expectations were not met. She had to restart from scratch and began to engage in a different business, which was the sale of ready-made meals. She was thus able to save a little money to start a business selling plastic goods, a trade she learned beforehand from her mother-in-law when she was still young. Settled in HLACOMEY in a populous area of COTONOU, where she runs her business, she won over the hearts of the people very quickly by meeting an increasingly growing demand. She is thus asking for this loan to respond to this demand and especially to enlarge her business domain.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers les années 1963 à SEME dans la vallée de l’OUEME, dame A. Ishola est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Dès son jeune âge dame A. Ishola avait exercer dans le domaine de la distribution de pagne et diverses sortes d’articles tels que les produits pharmaceutiques, les bijoux et autres. Mais après quelques années passées dans ce domaine, elle a quitté ce secteur parce que le résultat escompté n’était pas au rendez vous. Elle a dû recommencer à zéro en commençant par exercer un autre type d’activité qu’est la vente de repas prêt à manger. Elle a donc épargné un peu d’argent pour se lancer dans le commerce des plastiques qu’elle a appris auparavant auprès de sa belle mère pendant qu'elle était encore tout petite. Installée à HLACOMEY dans un quartier populaire de COTONOU, où elle exerce cet activité, elle a gagné en peu de temps le cœur de sa population suscitant une demande de plus en plus croissante. Elle sollicite alors ce prêt pour répondre à cette demande et surtout élargir son domaine d’activité.

loans.use: To buy different types of plastic goods

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Mr. Pablo Fernández lives in his own home in the area of Pasankeri, on the east side of the city of La Paz with his wife, Rosa Álvarez and his 2 children. Mr. F. is a public transit chauffeur and his wife sells vegetables in a local market. With a previous Kiva loan, they were able to build a bathroom with shower in their home, for the family to use. The loan solicited will be used to refurbish the floor of the patio that is currenlty made of exposed brick. This is the 2nd time they apply for a loan. Their credit history is in good standing which qualifies them for a new loan.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Pablo Fernández vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa la señora Rosa Álvarez y sus dos hijos, el señor Pablo es chofer de transporte público y su esposa vende verduras en un mercado de la zona. Con el crédito otorgado anteriormente a través de Kiva, realizó la construcción de un baño con ducha en su vivienda que ahora la usa su familia. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la refacción del piso del patio de su domicilio que se encuentra solo empedrado (es decir, con piedra solamente). Esta es la segunda ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To refurbish the floor of the patio.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Mr. Luis A. Cordón lives alone in his own home in Alto Miraflores, north of the city of La Paz. He’s a locksmith, working independently for particular clients in the city of La Paz.

With a past loan, he was able to construct the initial walls of a room. The loan solicited will be used to finish construction and detail on said room, which will eventually become his bedroom. He currently sleeps at his sister’s place. This is the 6th time he applies for a loan. His loan credit history classifies him as a favourable candidate for a loan.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Luís A. Cordón vive solo en casa propia. en la zona de Alto Miraflores ladera norte de la Ciudad de La Paz. El señor Luís es cerrajero, trabajando independientemente para personas particulares en la ciudad de La Paz.

Con el crédito otorgado anteriormente realizo la construcción en obra gruesa de una habitación. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción en obra fina y acabado de dicha habitación de ladrillo que será su dormitorio, ya que actualmente vive en una habitación prestada por su hermana Esta es la sexta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To finish the construction and detail of a room, which will eventually become his bedroom

loans.name: Candida Del Socorro

texts.es:
In the municipality of South San Rafael in the city of Managua, Mrs. Candida Q. has been selling food items and personal products in her grocery store for the last 3 years.

She’s married and has the responsibility of raising her 2 children, supporting them in their studies and offering them the highest quality of life that she can possibly manage. Ceprodel has been an important supporter of her business in the past, and has given her previous loans to buy products. She is soliciting another loan to acquire products for her store, in order to continue providing for her children.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Candida Q. desde hace tres años se dedica al negocio de pulpería vendiendo todo tipo de productos tales como comestibles y personales.

Actualmente es casada y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus dos hijos brindándole los estudios y un mejor nivel de vida en el que se puedan desarrollar. Ceprodel ha sido un punto importante en su negocio debido a que ha apoyado a la señora Nubia por medio de créditos que le han permitido adquirir sus productos para comercializarlos. Una vez mas ella necesita financiamiento para la adquisición de los productos para así continuar con el mantenimiento de sus hijos que tanto necesitan de ella.

loans.use: To buy products for her store.

loans.name: Nubia Del Carmen

texts.es:
For three years Nubia C. has worked in a small convenience store in San Rafael, Managua. Over the years, and through investing, she has stocked the store with large quantities of products.

Nubia is very hardworking. Through great sacrifice she has managed better her economic situation and provide her children with the education they deserve.

CEPRODEL has played an important role in her business. They have given Nubia loans which have helped her acquire and sell her merchandise. Once again Nubia requests a loan to continue improving her business and, through improvement, better provide for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein and Perla Mendoza.

En el municipio de San Rafael en Managua, la señora Nubia C. desde hace 3 años se dedica al negocio de pulpería el cual a través de los años ha venido surtiendo hasta mejorar su negocio invirtiendo en mayores cantidades de productos.

Es una dama muy esforzada que gracias a sus grandes sacrificios en su negocio ha logrado mejorar su situación económica y brindarles a sus hijos sus estudios que estos se merecen.

Ceprodel ha jugado un papel importante en su negocio debido a que la ha beneficiado con créditos que le han servido de mucho beneficio para adquirir su mercadería y así venderla en su local de habitación.Hoy en dia una vez mas acude para obtener el credito y de esta manera mejorar su negocio y por ende las condiciones de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Elbia Patricia

texts.es:
With much effort, Elbia R. has excelled in her business. She runs a general store in the municipality of South San Rafael of the city of Managua. She’s a married mother of 2 school-aged children of whom she’s very proud for being good students at their school.

Elbia finds herself in a situation where she is in urgent need of acquiring merchandise to sell. This is why she has looked for support from Ceprodel to obtain a loan which will allow her to buy merchandise she can sell, in order to continue taking care of her children and the house.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elbia R. con mucho esfuerzo se ha destacado en su negocio de pulpería en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur de la ciudad de Managua. Es una madre casada y con dos hijos en edad escolar el cual se siente orgullosa por ser muy bueno alumnos en su colegio.

Una de las necesidades que atraviesa la señora Elbia es la urgencia de la adquisición de la mercadería para la venta, es por este motivo que ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito oportuno que le permita adquirir sus productos para así comercializarlos y de esta manera continuar con la manutención de su hogar y de sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Luisa Ivania

texts.es:
Luisa E. is a bread maker. She has her own bakery in her house in the municipality of San Rafael in the city of Managua. With experience has come success in this business. She’s been able to succeed by diversifying her products. She makes white bread, sweet bread, buns and pastries.

Luisa E.’s immediate need is to acquire basic ingredients to continue baking bread. This is why she’s looking for support from Ceprodel, to obtain credit that will allow her to buy the ingredients she needs and continue her bakery business at home.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer,

El negocio al que se dedica la señora Luisa E. es a la elaboración de pan teniendo su propia panadería en su casa de habitación en el municipio de San Rafael en Managua. Con mucha experiencia en este negocio, ha logrado salir adelante diversificando sus productos tales como pan simple, pan dulce, picos, reposterías y bolillos.

La necesidad atravesada por la dama Luisa Espìnoza es la inmediata urgencia de adquirir la materia prima para llevar a cabo la elaboración del pan. Es por esto que busca apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita adquirir el pan y de esta manera salir adelante en su negocio que atiende en su casa de habitación.

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr:
Born in COTONOU on 27 March 1979, Mrs. Alice Z. is married to Paul ZANNOULO, a private chauffeur. She is the mother of 2 children. A hairdresser by profession, she has a hair salon where she runs her business. She is also a retailer of wigs, cosmetics, and other goods. Mrs. Alice Z. obtains her supplies from LOME in TOGO. Currently she is facing serious difficulties in supplying herself, so she is asking for her fourth loan in order to boost her business and to satisfy the demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à COTONOU le 27 mars 1979, dame Z. Alice est mariée à ZANNOULO Paul, un conducteur de voiture personnelle. Elle est mère de 2 enfants. Coiffeuse de profession, elle a un salon de coiffure où elle mène son activité. Elle est également une revendeuse de mèches, de produits cosmétiques et autres. Dame Z. Alice s’approvisionne à LOME au TOGO . Actuellement elle éprouve de sérieuses difficultés dans l’approvisionnement de ses produits ce pour quoi elle sollicite son quatrième prêt afin de relancer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy 5 boxes of tresses, 10 boxes of cosmetics, and various kinds of pagne cloth

loans.name: Josefa Seneyda

texts.es:
The business of making and selling tortillas is a tough job that requires much dedication because one works in high temperatures which can, to a certain point, damage one’s health. Nevertheless, Josefa makes tortillas all day, every day in order to sell them from her home.

Josefa’s immediate need is to urgently acquire basic ingredients, like corn and firewood to make the tortillas. For this reason, she is asking for support from Ceprodel to obtain the necessary credit that will allow her to acquire these ingredients, so she can sell her tortillas without any problems.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de la elaboración y venta de tortillas es una labor muy fuerte que requiere de mucha dedicación por el motivo de que se trabaja a altas temperaturas que hasta cierto punto daña la salud de algunas personas. No obstante, la señora Josefa se dedica a este negocio elaborando tortillas todos los días con el propósito de comercializarlas en su casa de habitación.

La necesidad que hoy en día atraviesa la señora Josefa es la urgencia de adquirir su materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas como lo es el maíz y la leña. Por esta razón es que ella acuda a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario que le permita adquirir sus productos para así comercializarlos sin ningún problema.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for tortillas.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: La Fe Group

texts.en:
Clemencia lives with her three children (ages: 14, 12, and 4) in a small community on the eastern peninsuL. of the Dominican Republic. Right now she sells clothing, but she wants to use this loan in order to buy more shirts, blouses, and jeans to sell and she also wants to add some curtains and interior decorations to her small business. In the future she wants to continue working in order to overcome the difficulties in her life. Clemencia told us that she enjoys studying in her free time, but usually she doesn't have much time to do that.

10 of the women in this bank have taken out a previous loan with Esperanza, but 5 of them are applying for loans for the first time! We are very excited for this group, and we want to thank all the Kiva lenders that make this possible. God Bless!

loans.use: To buy clothes and interior decorations for her business

loans.name: Amélie

texts.fr:
Born on 5 January 1970 in EKPE in the south of BENIN, Mrs. Amélie A. is married to Emmanuel KOUTON. She is the mother of 3 children (Djerry is 13, Kamayolle is 8, and Krismel is 5). All her children are studying, and are in the care of their parents. Having lived in COTONOU for more than 20 years, Mrs. Amélie A. is a seamstress by profession, but at the same time also has a job selling haberdashery products in YENAWA, a populous area of COTONOU. She obtains her supplies most notably from the large neighbour to the east, NIGERIA, and also from TOGO. Since the quarter is close to the largest market in BENIN, the neighbouring population, specifically the seamstresses, come in large numbers to buy from her. The massive demand for these products leads her to ask for her fourth loan, in order to respond to the expectations of her clientele.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 5 janvier 1970 à EKPE  au sud du BENIN, dame A. Amélie est mariée à KOUTON Emmanuel. Elle est mère de 3 enfants ( Djerry 13ans, Kamayolle 8ans et Krismel 5ans). Tous ses enfants sont scolarisés et sont à la charge de leur deux géniteurs. Installée à COTONOU depuis plus de 20 ans, dame A. Amélie est couturière de profession mais elle mène parallèlement à sa profession  la vente de produits de mercerie à YENAWA un quartier populaire de COTONOU. Elle s’approvisionne notamment chez le grand voisin de l’EST, le NIGERIA  mais aussi au TOGO. Le quartier étant proche du plus grand marché du BENIN, les populations environnantes précisement les couturières viennent massivement acheter chez elle. La demande massive d’autres produits l’amène à solliciter son quatrième crédit afin de répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy 2 boxes of phoenix thread, 60 rolls of poplin, and other sewing supplies

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is the mother of five children, who are all currently in school. She has been buying and selling rice, beans and groundnuts for the past twenty two years. Salamatu travels twelve hours to buy her products from the Northern part of Ghana. She wants to use her new loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of beans and bags of groundnuts.

Salamatu is a member of the group called “Shie Allah” (meaning except God). Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: Salamatu would like to buy more bags of groundnuts.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty is forty two years old and the mother of three children, who are all currently in school. She has sold second (used) clothing for the past five years. Gifty buys her clothes from Accra and resells them in her community. She wants to use her loan to buy more bails of used clothing from Accra.

She is a member of the group called “Awurade Aye” (meaning God has done it). Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral in repaying the loan.

loans.use: GIfty would like to buy more bails of second hand clothes to resell.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 44308

loans.name: Sadatu

texts.en:
Sadatu is forty two years old and the mother of two children, who are currently in school. She prepares and sells “Tuo Zaafi” (a local dish prepared from maize and cassava flour). It is a popular food in the Northern Regions of Ghana and also a delicacy for most Ghanaians. Sadatu wants to use her loan to buy more bags of maize, assorted meat, dry fish, vegetables, spices, etc. to prepare her food.

She is a member of the group called “Baa Meyi” (meaning no one is bigger than God). Members use group guarantee principle on members to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: Sadatu would like to buy more bags of maize, assorted meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Oumou Khairy

texts.fr:
Oumou Khairy D., age 51, takes care of seven children. She is the treasurer of the TP Takku Liguèye village bank in Kolda where she plays a very important role. Oumou sells palm oil, honey, and peanut butter. She would like to include the sale of chicken meat. With the profits of the previous cycle, she bought chicks and constructed a place to shelter them. She is requesting this 18th loan to continue her business and to buy feed for the chicks. This loan will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Oumou Khairy D., 51 ans, 07 enfants en charge est la trésorière du banc villageois TP Takku Liguèye à Kolda ou elle joue un rôle très important. Oumou vend de l’huile de palme du miel et de la patte d’arachide, elle voudrait y associer la vente de poulets de chaire. Avec les bénéfices du cycle précédent elle a acheté des poussins et a construit un locale pour les abriter. Elle sollicite ce 18ème prêt pour continuer son activité et acheter des aliments pour les poussins. Ce prêt sera remboursé au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy honey, palm oil, peanut butter, and chicken feed

loans.name: Djoureatou

texts.fr:
Born around 1972 in PARAKOU in the north of BENIN, Mrs. Djouréatou O. A. is married to Sama O., a second-hand clothes seller, and has 2 children. She has lived for more than a decade in COTONOU, the economic capital of BENIN, where she runs her business selling ready-made food in one of the most populous areas of COTONOU. For a little while now, she has been facing difficulties in obtaining the supplies needed in the preparation of her meals. Thus, she is asking for this loan to respond to the expectations of her clientele, since demand is becoming increasingly higher.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers les années 1972 à PARAKOU dans le nord du BENIN, dame O. A. Djouréatou est mariée à O. Sama revendeur de friperie et mère de 2 enfants. Elle s’est installée depuis plus d’une dizaine d’années à COTONOU dans la capitale économique du BENIN où elle exerce son activité de vente de repas prêt à manger dans l'un des quartiers les plus populaires de COTONOU. Depuis un certain temps, elle éprouve des difficultés dans l’approvisionnement des produits entrant dans la préparation du repas. Pour cela elle sollicite ce crédit pour répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle car la demande devient de plus en plus forte.

loans.use: To buy 2 bags of manioc flour (GARI) and 5 boxes of fish

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is thirty seven years old and a mother of three children. All her children are in school. She has been selling groceries like body lotion, canned drinks, tin fish, assorted biscuits, assorted candies, etc.

She wants to use her loan to buy more boxes of assorted biscuits, cartons of soft drinks, etc to expand her operations.

Victoria is a member of the group called “Baa Meyi” (meaning no one is bigger than God). Members exert peer pressure on themselves as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more groceries like assorted biscuits, assorted candies, boxes of tin fish, etc.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Aminata S. is married and takes care of seven children. She is a member of the TP Takku Liguèye village bank in Kolda. She buys fruit at the weekly market in order to sell them in Kolda, and she makes clothing from dyed cotton damask. The clothing will be sold on credit for a duration of one month. She wants to built up her investment capital. The income earned from her commerce enables her to improve her family's living conditions. She is requesting this 13th loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

AMINATA S., mariée, 07 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois TP Takku Liguèye à Kolda. Elle achète les fruits au niveau des marchés hebdomadaire pour les vendre à Kolda et confectionne des habits teintés avec le bazin. Les habits seront vendus à crédit pour une durée de un mois. Elle veut renforcer son capital d’investissement. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille Aminata sollicite ce 13ème prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy fruit, egg cartons, damask, and supplies for a table-top stall

loans.name: Celina

texts.es:
Celina H. P. is a member of the Comunal Bank Carmen Cabrejos, which is located on the street Jr. Guido Bonzano, No. 180, in the district of Calleria in the state Ucayali. Celina is 56 years old and a mother of two children.

The first loan which Celina received from “Manuela Ramos” was S/.300 ($120). Celina invested this sum in groceries and other merchandise.

Since the first loan Celina has expanded her business into a small grocery store. Celina awakes every morning at 7:00 AM in order to prepare breakfast for her husband and children. Afterwards, Celina attends to the clients of her grocery store until 7:00 PM.

With the currently requested loan of S/. 1,000 ($375), which will be repaid in 5 months, Celina will purchase 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 1 box of eggs, etc.

Celina is very proud of herself. She is confident that she has managed to better her life through her personal conviction and need provide for her family. She is also grateful for the assistance that “Manuela Ramos” has provided her and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein and Perla Mendoza.

La señora Celina pertenece al Banco Comunal Carmen Cabrejos, ubicado en el Jr Guido Bonzano No 180, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 56 años y es madre de 2 hijos. Celina con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de abarrotes. En la actualidad ella cuenta con una bodega, se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su espos, luego se dedica a la atención de su bodega hasta las 7 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 caja de huevos, 1 caja de leche, etc. Celina esta muy feliz, por que esta convencida que salió adelante por convicción propia viendo las necesidades de su familia ahora esta orgullosa de ella misma y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama is a mother of two children. She is forty two years old and she has been roasting and selling ground nuts for the past eight years. She travels to the northern part of Ghana to buy the nuts and then travels back to the south (Tema) to sell. Mariama wants to use her loan to buy more bags of groundnuts to reduce her frequent travels to the north and also to avoid price hikes.

She is a member of the group called “Baa Meyi” (meaning no one is bigger than God). Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: Mariama would like to buy more bags of groundnuts.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 44315

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha G. V. is a member of the Communal Bank Indo America which is located in on the street Jr Fitscarral No. 246, in the district of Calleria in the stated Ucayali. Bertha is 42 years old and a mother of nine children, and her husband as chauffer.

The first loan which Bertha received from “Manuela Ramos” was S/.1,400 ($525) . Bertha invested this sum in a moto-taxi.

Bertha awakes every morning at 7:00 AM in order to prepare breakfast for her husband and children. She then spends the rest of the day doing house work and other chores.

With the currently requested loan of S/.1,400 ($525), which will be repaid in 6 months, Bertha will pay for the maintenance her motor-taxi and buy an additional motor/taxi.

Bertha is very happy that she is able to help with the expenses of the home and support her children as needed. She is grateful for the assistance that “Manuela Ramos” has given to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein and Perla Mendoza.

La señora Bertha pertenece al Banco Comunal Indo América, ubicado en el Jr Fitscarral No 246-A, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años y es madre de 9 hijos, su esposo es chofer. Bertha con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en la compra de un motocarro.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un motocarro, se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, de allí se dedica a los que haceres de su hogar.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,400, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, pago para el mantenimiento mecánico de su motocarro y para la inicial de otro.

Bertha esta muy contenta, por que puede apoyar en los gastos familiares como también a sus hijos cuando ellos lo necesitan, y esto le hace estar llena de orgullo, ella esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio

loans.use: Maintenance of her current moto'taxi and purchase on an additional moto-taxi.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 44316

loans.name: Adita

texts.es:
Adita is a member of Las Azucenas (White Lillies) 2 Community Bank, which is located at Mz C Lt 13 in the Fernando Belaunde Ferry subdivision in the district of Yarina Cocha, in the state of Ucayali. She is 39 years old and has one child. Adita invested her first loan of 300 soles from Manuela Ramos in a small food store.

She currently gets up at 7:00 in the morning to make breakfast for her children. She then starts preparing food which she sells from 5:00-10:00 pm.

With this loan of 1,200 soles (approximately $450), which will be paid back in four months, Adita plans to purchase a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, chicken, beef, fish, vegetables and soft drinks.

Adita is very happy to have formed a solidarity group with her community bank, which always supports activities for strengthening ties of friendship and companionship.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

La señora Adita pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas 2, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano Fernando Belaunde Ferry Mz C Lt 13, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años y es madre de 1 hijo. Adita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de comida.

En la actualidad se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, luego se dedica a la preparación de sus comidas para venderlos a partir de las 5 pm hasta las 10 pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, carnes de pollo, res, pescado, verduras, gaseosas.

Adita se siente muy feliz por que formo un grupo solidario con su banco comunal y siempre realizan actividades para fortalezar mas sus lazo de amistad y compañerismo

loans.use: Purchase of additional supplies for preparing food for sale

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.es:
Leopoldo G. is originally from the district of San Rafael in Managua. He owns a bakery which provides him with enough income to take care of his family composed of his wife and a young son who currently goes to a nearby school.

With a lot of effort and sacrifices, he has been able to support his family through the income he makes from the bakery. Currently, he's unable to purchase the main ingredients to make bread. This is the main reason why Ceprodel, the lending institution, has approved him to get a loan so that he can purchase the main ingredients for his bakery and an electric generator in case of power failure in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

El caballero Leopoldo G. es originario del municipio de San Rafael en Managua dedicándose al negocio de panadería con el cual debe mantener su hogar que consta de su esposa y su pequeño hijo que actualmente estudia en un colegio cercano a su localidad.

Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado llevar el sustento a su hogar por medio de la panadería sin embargo la necesidad que hoy en día atraviesa esta caballero es la adquisición de la materia prima para la elaboración del pan. Es por esta razón que Ceprodel le ha apoyado con créditos que le han permitido comprar su materia prima y a la vez le ha permitido adquirir una planta eléctrica para usarla en momentos que la energía falle.

loans.use: To purchase main ingredients to run a bakery and an electric generator

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria is a member of the Indo America Community Bank which is located at Mz JLt 36, in the Pedro Portillo subdivision of the District of Calleria, in the state of Ucayali. She is 42 years old and has four children. Her husband is a chauffeur. Gloria invested her first loan of 300 soles from Manuela Ramos in a small bodega (grocery store), which she now owns.

Gloria gets up at 6:00 in the morning to make breakfast for her children and husband and then turns to running the bodega, where she works until 8:00 in the evening.

With this loan of 3,000 soles (approximately $1,125), which will be paid back in six months, Gloria plans to buy a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, noodles, oil, eggs, a box of milk, and a box of soap, etc.

Gloria is very happy to be able to make her dreams come true. She has greater self-esteem and also is able to support her children’s studies. She also helps out with household expenses and is very thankful to Manuela Ramos for the support it has provided to her business.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

La señora Gloria pertenece al Banco Comunal Indo América, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano Pedro Portillo, Mz J Lt 36, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es chofer. Gloria con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con una bodega de venta de abarrotes, se levanta a las 6 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, luego se dedica a su bodega y la atiende hasta las 8 pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, fideos, aceite, huevo, 1 caja de leche, 1 caja de jabón, etc.

Gloria esta muy contenta, por que puede hacer sus sueños realidad, aprendió a valerse por si misma y además puede apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios, también aporta a los gastos familiares y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of additional merchandise for sale in bodega

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Mrs Clara is a member of Las Azucenas 2 Community Bank, located at Av. Bellavista Cdra. 9, Calleria District, Ucayali State. She is 47 years old and has three grown-up children. Using the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for approximately $110, she opened a small barbershop. At present, she has a beauty salon, which she runs with the help of her children. She works as a hairdresser herself from 8 am to 6.00 pm. With this loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she plans to purchase various salon products such as haircolor, shampoos, hairsprays, combs, scissors, etc.

Clara is very glad as she feels she is very much supported by Manuela Ramos, and that her salon attracts more customers everyday and her business profit is increasing steadily.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Clara pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas 2, ubicado en el Av. Bellavista Cdra. 9, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 47 años y es madre de 3 hijos mayores de edad. Clara con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña peluquería. En la actualidad tiene un salón de belleza, que atiende con la ayuda de sus hijos, ella atiende su peluqueria desede las 8 am. Hasta las 6.00 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará materiales para ondulación, tintes, champús, lacas, peines, tijeras, capas, etc. Clara esta feliz por que se siente muy apoyada por Manuela Ramos, y su negocio tiene cada día mas clientes y sus ganancias se esta incrementando.

loans.use: Purchase of various products for the business

loans.name: Moulikatou

texts.fr:
Born on 26 January 1969 in PORTO NOVO, the political capital of BENIN, Mrs. Moulikatou B. is married to Nicaise KOUBIYA and has 7 children, of whom 4 are twins. Miracle de Dieu, a 3-year old in nursery school and Fréjus, a 12-year old in his final year of junior high school, are also in her care. Very experienced in the sale of jewelry and shoes thanks to having engaged in this business for more than 10 years, Mrs. Moulikatou BALOUGON obtains her goods notably from NIGERIA, GHANA, and especially from the importers of products from DUBAI, and re-sells them in DANTOKPA in the largest market in BENIN. The competition is not too harsh, but she lacks the means to complete her shop display to better satisfy her clientele. Thus, she is asking for this loan in order to satisfy her regular customers by providing them with high quality products. Her daily sales total 25000 francs, and she is on her fourth loan.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 26 janvier 1969 à PORTO NOVO dans la capitale politique du BENIN, dame B. Moulikatou est mariée à KOUBIYA Nicaise et mère de 7 enfants dont 4 jumeaux. Miracle de Dieu, 3ans en classe de maternelle et Fréjus, 12ans en classe de troisième sont à sa charge. Très expérimentée dans la vente de bijoux et chaussures parce qu'exerçant cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans, dame B. Moulikatou s’approvisionne notamment au NIGERIA, GHANA et surtout chez les importateurs des produits de DUBAÏ et les revend à DANTOKPA dans le plus grand marché du BENIN. La concurrence n’est pas trop rude mais elle manque de moyen pour complèter son étalage histoire de satisfaire au mieux sa clientèle. Pour cela elle sollicite ce prêt pour satisfaire ses clients habituels en leur fournissant des produits de bonne qualité. Son chiffre d’affaire journalier est de 25000 francs et elle est à son quatrième crédit.

loans.use: To buy 4 dozen jewels and 1 box of shoes

loans.name: Hadhe Clarice

texts.es:
Mrs Hadhe is a member of the Carmen Cabrejos Community Bank, located at Carmen Jr. Cabrejos No. 656, Calleria District, Ucayali State. She is 37 years old, married, and has three children. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for approximately $110, Hadhe started a business recharging fire extinguishers. At present, in addition to recharging them, she sells fire extinguishers.

Hadhe gets up at 7 am every morning to prepare breakfast for her husband and children. She then spends the rest of the day, until 8 pm, running her business. With this loan, which will be repaid in 5 months, Hadhe is planning to buy 10 fire extinguishers and 10 bags of powder extinguishers to sell to her retail customers.

Hadhe is very happy and very proud of the fact that single-mindedly she went ahead with her plans to look after her family and she is very grateful for the support Manuela Ramos provides for her business.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Hadhe pertenece al Banco Comunal Carmen Cabrejos, ubicado en el Jr Carmen Cabrejos No 656, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años, es madre de 3 hijos. Hadhe. Con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de recarga de extintores. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta y recarga de extintores, se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo y de allí se dedica a la atención de su negocio hasta las 8 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 10 extintores y 10 sacos de polvo para extintores. Hadhe esta muy contenta, por que esta convencida que salió adelante por convicción propia viendo las necesidades de su familia ahora esta orgullosa de ella misma y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of 10 fire extinguishers and 10 bags of powder extinguishers for retail sales

loans.name: Greta

texts.es:
Mrs Greta is a member of the Indo American Community Bank, located at Jr. Fitscarral No. 246, Calleria District, Ucayali State. She is 69 years old, married, and has six children. Her husband is a retired teacher.

With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for approximately $110, Greta started a business letting rooms. Currently, she buys and sells various products in addition to letting rooms. Greta gets up at 7 am to prepare breakfast. Afterwards, she works until 5 pm selling her merchandise. With this loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, Greta plans to buy mattresses, bed sheets, and larger quantities of merchandise such as perfumes, candies, etc.

Greta is very glad that not being near her children has not prevented her from working, helping her husband, and succeeding in improving her life. She is very grateful for the support Manuela Ramos provides for her business.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Greta pertenece al Banco Comunal Indo América, ubicado en el Jr Fitscarral No 246, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 69 años es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo es profesor jubilado. Greta con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de alquiler de cuartos. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de compra y venta de mercadería y de alquiler de cuartos, se levanta a las 7 am para preparar su desayuno y de su esposo, luego se dedica a la venta de su mercadera hasta las 5 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: colchones, sabanas y mayor cantidad de mercadería, perfumes, golosinas, etc. Greta esta muy feliz, ya que a pesar de no vivir cerca de sus hijos no es impedimento para no poder trabajar y salir adelante y ayudar a su esposo, ella esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of goods and materials for the business

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44323

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Mrs Jenny is a member of the Las Azucenas 2 Community Bank, located at 132 Jr Mariano Melgar, Calleria District, Ucayali State. She is 46 years old and has two children. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) of approximately $110, Jenny opened a small soda fountain counter. She gets up at 7 am to prepare breakfast for her children, and then she opens her soda fountain counter and serves customers until 8 pm.

With this loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, Jenny plans to buy 5 crates of soda, one soda gas pump, and also to improve the décor of her premises.

Jenny is very proud of the fact that she works and is an independent woman, thanks to Manuela Ramos support.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Jenny pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas 2, ubicado en el Jr Mariano Melgar 132, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 46 años y es madre de 2 hijos. Jenny con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña fuente de soda. En la actualidad se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, luego abre su fuente de soda para esperar la llegada de sus clientes, hasta las 8 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 5 cajas de gaseosa, 1 surtidora y también mejorara su local, etc. Jenny esta muy orgullosa, ya que le permite trabajar y ser una mujer independiente gracias al apoyo de Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for soda fountain counter

loans.name: Iris Rocio

texts.es:
Mrs Iris is a member of the Carmen Cabrejos Community Bank, located at Jr. Cahuide No. 410, Calleria District, Ucayali State. She is 35 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is a soldier. Iris invested the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) of approximately $110 in a business buying and selling merchandise. At present, she works for herself buying and selling merchandise. She gets up at 7 am to prepare breakfast for her husband and children and afterwards she is busy selling her merchandise until 6 pm.

With this loan, which will be repaid in 5 months, Iris plans to buy clothing for men, women, and children, rings, bracelets, earrings, etc. to sell to her customers.

Iris is very happy that thanks to her effort, she has less worry, can help her children with their homework, and is able to make a contribution to her family. She is very grateful for the support that Manuela Ramos provides for her business.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Iris pertenece al Banco Comunal Carmen Cabrejos, ubicado en el Jr. Cahuide No 410, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es militar. Iris con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de compra y venta de mercadería. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de compra y venta de mercadería, se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo y de allí se dedica a la venta de su mercadería hasta las 6 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: ropas para damas caballeros y niños, sortijas, pulseras, aretes, etc. Iris esta muy alegre, por que gracias a su esfuerzo puede estar mas tranquila, puede poyar a sus hijos en sus estudio y también puede aportar en su hogar,esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of more stock for retail sales

loans.name: Barrio El Calvario Ii Group

texts.es:
Within this communal bank, one can find determined women with the entrepreneurial spirit very typical of businesswomen from the coast of Guatemala. All of the women belonging to this bank have a least two businesses.

They invest the money borrowed in different economic ventures like breeding bulls and pigs and selling chicken, vegetables, baked goods and other foods. The also sell firewood, cosmetics and heliconia leaves (used to make tamales).

It was impressive to see the entire group of women so decided about how they would be using the money that they were borrowing. Norma M. commented that she was going to use a part of her loan to sell cosmetics while the other part would be invested in fruit to sell in the market. Juana S. said that as soon as she received her loan, she was going to purchase 300 kg of chicken to sell in the market. María P., like the large majority of the group, was going to buy 150 bunches of heliconia leaves to then sell to distributors. While the women sell one bunch of leaves for seven quetzals, a distributor can sell in the cities for double the price. María P. was going to invest her money in her tortilla business and in the purchase of firewood.

When asked why they like to work with Friendship Bridge, the women said that it was primarily because it gives them a chance to save money. The inability to save is one of the reasons people can’t get out of poverty. Additionally, they said that the low interest and the timeframe the institution offered for repaying the loans help them with their businesses. Also, working under the bank’s methodology is something they like very much.

The women believe that within the Barrio El Calvario Communal Bank they are all equal. Not only that, but there is a lot of communication and understanding within the communal bank. It seems that working with Friendship Bridge has changed their lives. They are very grateful to the institution and to those who invest in them through Kiva because people have believed in them. They are sure that they will not let us down. That’s why helping this and many other groups of women is important, because one gives them a chance and a ray of hope.

Translated form Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Dentro de este banco comunal uno puede encontrar mujeres corajudas y con una visión empresarial muy característica de las empresarias de la costa de Guatemala. Todas las clientas dentro de este banco tienen dos negocios como mínimo.

Ellas invierten su crédito en distintas actividades económicas, tales como la crianza de toros y cerdos, venta de pollo, venta de comidas, venta de verduras, venta de leña, venta ambulante de cosméticos, panadería y la venta de hojas de mashan (las cuales son usadas para envolver los tamales).

Fue impresionante ver a todo un grupo de mujeres tan decididas en que utilizar el préstamos que se les iba a otorgar. Norma M., comentó que ella iba a usar parte de su préstamo para la venta de cosméticos que los iba a vender de manera ambulante, mientras que la otra parte la iba a invertir en la compra de fruta para venderla en el mercado. Juana S., dijo que a penas recibía su préstamo lo iba a invertir en la compra de tres quintales de pollos destazados para su venta en el mercado.
