María P., como la gran mayoría del grupo, iba a comprar 150 racimos de hojas de mashan para luego venderlo a los intermediaros. Ellas venden un racimo a siete quetzales, mientras que un intermediario puede llegar a venderlo en las ciudades por el doble del precio. María P., va a invertir su crédito en su tortilleria y en la compra de leña.

Cuando se les pregunto porque les gusta trabajar con Friendship Bridge ellas comentaron que era primordialmente porque les daba un espacio para ahorrar. La falta de capacidad de ahorrar es uno de los motivos por los cuales las personas no pueden salir de la pobreza. Adicionalmente, dijeron que los bajos intereses y el plazo que les ofrecía la institución las ayudaba con su negocio. También, trabajar bajo metodología de bancos comunales les gusta mucho.

Las señoras opinan que dentro del banco comunal Barrio el Calvario todas son iguales. No solo eso, sino que hay mucha comunicación y comprensión dentro del banco comunal. Al parecer trabajar con Friendship Bridge les ha cambiado la vida. Ellas agradecen mucho a la institución y a las personas que invierten en ellas desde Kiva por que confiaron en ellas y están seguras de no nos van a defraudar. Es por eso que seguir apoyando a este y a muchos gruP. de mujeres es importante, ya que uno les da un respiro y una luz de esperanza.

loans.use: Breeding bulls and pigs; sale of chicken, vegetables, baked goods and other foods; sale of firewood, cosmetics and heliconia leaves

loans.name: Yaovi Hyacinthe

texts.fr:
Mr. Yaovi Hyacinthe E. was born April 5, 1984 in Tsévié, a town located about 35 kilometers outside of Lomé. A Bachelor, he works with his younger brother in a repair shop that they opened in Lomé in 2005. He purchases spare parts and then resells them to mechanics and motorcycle drivers. His first loan was for 300,000 FCFA which helped him to stock rims and Honda motorcycle tires. After paying back his first loan, Mr. E. is asking for a second loan of 400,000 FCFA in order to purchase 25 more tires, 10 Yamaha exhaust pipes, 2 containers of batteries, one container of rear-view mirrors and one container of helmets.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Monsieur E. Yaovi Hyacinthe est né le 05 avril 1984 à Tsévié, ville située à 35 km de Lomé. Célibataire, il travaille avec son petit frère dans sa boutique de pièces détachées qu’il a ouverte à Lomé depuis 2005. Son activité consiste à acheter les pièces détachées des engins à deux (2) roues et les revendre ,aux mécaniciens et conducteurs de motos. Le premier crédit qu’il a obtenu en 2007 d’un montant de 300.000 FCFA lui a permis de faire le stock de jantes et de pneus de moto de marque HONDA. Après avoir bien remboursé son premier crédit, Monsieur E. Yaovi Hyacinthe sollicite encore un crédit de 400.000 FCFA pour acquérir vingt cinq (25) pneus et dix (10) échappements de marque YAMAHA, deux (2) cartons de batteries, un (1) carton de rétroviseur et un (1) carton de casque.

loans.use: To purchase tires and exhaust pipes.

loans.name: Adjelé

texts.fr:
Born October 12, 1956 in Lomé, Madame Adjelé A. is married and the mother of seven children. Currently, she only takes care of three these, one who is now in University and two others who attend college. She has been a vender of pearls in the great market of Lomé since 1976. Her customers come from Benin, Nigeria and Ghana. With her business, Mrs. A. has been able to construct her own home. Continually presented with competition by others who enter into the pearl trade, she needs to find ways to remain competitive. This is difficult with her limited stock. In order to improve this, she is asking for a loan of 500,000 FCFA in order to purchase one container of pearls. With her new stock, she will be able to improve her sales.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née le 12 octobre 1956 à Lomé, Madame A. Adjelé est mariée et mère de sept (7) enfants. Présentement, elle assure la charge de trois (3) enfants, un à l’université de Lomé et les deux autres au collège. Elle est revendeuse de perles au grand marché de Lomé depuis 1976. Ses clients potentiels viennent du Bénin, du Nigeria et du Ghana. Avec ce commerce, Madame A. Adjelé a fait une énorme réalisation qu’est la construction de sa maison. Compte tenu de la multiplication du nombre de personnes qui entrent dans l’exercice de ce commerce, elle n’arrive pas à faire des recettes qu’elle faisait par le passé ; ceci à cause de la limite de son stock. Pour reconquérir ses clients, elle sollicite un crédit de 500.000 FCFA pour acquérir un (1) carton de perles. Ainsi avec le nouveau stock, elle pourra améliorer ses recettes.

loans.use: To purchase pearls.

loans.name: Bienaventuradas I Group

texts.es:
The meetings of the Bienaventuradas Communal Bank are exceptionally festive. The women have been working together for many years and that greatly helps the consolidation and integration of the group.

The disbursal took place during an intense but typical rainstorm in the district of Maza. Despite the rain, one could hear the unsurpassable laughter. During the meeting, the group was interviewed. The women told me that the majority works reselling used clothing and breeding animals. It seems that in this part of Guatemala, raising bulls, pigs and chickens is very profitable, especially during the holiday seasons. The women are very satisfied with their credit and for that reason have been requesting a loan from the institution for more than three years.

The women are not only grateful to Friendship Bridge for the financial help lent to them, but also for the educational assistance. They told me that the information about women’s preventive health and the use of herbal medicines provided by the Bacilia credit agency was very helpful. Also, the women feel that the knowledge gained about women’s rights and inter-family violence was very valuable for some members of the group.

Programs like Friendship Bridge that offer easily accessible credit to clients who live in rural areas, in addition to education about health and women’s rights, are important to the development of Guatemala. This is because for many years the poor, especially women, have been discriminated against by the system. These institutions give them a chance to grow as individuals. Through Kiva, you are also contributing to the development of the country and giving them an opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Las reuniones del banco comunal Bienaventuradas son excepcionalmente alegres. Las mujeres han venido trabajando juntas desde hace ya muchos años y eso ayuda mucho a la consolidación he integración del grupo.

El desembolso se llevó acabo durante una intensa, pero típica, lluvia en el cantón Maza. A pesar de la lluvia uno podía escuchar las risas inigualables. Durante dicha reunión procedí a entrevistar al grupo. Las compañeras me contaron que la gran mayoría de ellas trabaja en el negocio de reventa de ropa y la crianza de animales. Al parecer en esa área de Guatemala la crianza de toros, cerdos y pollos es M. rentable, especialmente en épocas festivas. Las mujeres están M. contentas con su crédito, es por eso que han venido solicitando un préstamo a la institución por más de tres años.

Las mujeres no solo están contentas con Friendship Bridge por el servicio financiero que se les presta, sino por el educacional también. Ellas me comentaron que las capacitaciones impartidas por la agente de crédito Bacilia, de salud preventiva de la mujer y la utilización de plantas medicinales fueron M. provechosas. Asimismo, las clientas consideraron que la capacitación sobre derechos de la mujer y violencia intrafamiliar fue de mucho valor para algunas integrantes del grupo.

Programas como Friendship Bridge que otorgan créditos cómodos a clientas que viven en áreas rurales y capacitaciones en salud y derechos de la mujer son M. importantes para el desarrollo de Guatemala. Esto se debe a que por muchos años los pobres, especialmente las mujeres, han sido marginalizados por el sistema y estas instituciones les brindan oportunidades para salir adelante. Por medio de Kiva tú también estas cooperando con el desarrollo del país contribuye a darles esta oportunidad.

loans.use: Sale of used clothing and animal breeding

loans.name: Bienaventuradas Ii Group

texts.es:
The women that belong to the Bienaventuradas group have two characteristics that make one believe that they will do well with the loan that you’re going to give them: assuredness and confidence in themselves and in their respective businesses which they stress to be so important.

The disbursal took place in the garage of an old house. An old pickup truck, on which the children were swinging, was parked inside. The women were seated on typical plastic benches that they had just brought from the church. All of the women are faithful followers of the churches within Santo Tomás la Unión.

In this group the majority of the women invest their loans in breeding animals and in the resale of both typical and American clothing. You can also find some that invest the money in cases of thread to make beautiful, embroidered blouses that are typical in the region. Others have convenience stores where they sell the products in high demand by the townspeople. With their loan they buy beans, rice and soap along with various other products.

The women think that working under the communal bank’s methodology is very positive because, even though they live in the same community, they don’t know each other that well. Because of Friendship Bridge, they know many more women that live close by, but not only do they know them, they work together and cooperate with each other. This creates an interpersonal bond that’s very strong among the group members. They also believe that due to the training and interaction, many women lose their shyness when speaking in public and their self esteem is raised. By believing in these women, through Kiva, you are aiding in their development. Keep doing it!

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Las mujeres que pertenecen al grupo Bienaventuradas 2 tienen características que a uno lo hacen confiar que a ellas les va a ir bien con el préstamo que se les va a otorgar. La seguridad y confianza en ellas mismas y sus respectivos negocios que ellas irradian es importante.

El desembolso se llevo acabo en el garaje de una casa antigua. Un pick-up viejo, en el cual los niños se estaban columpiando, estaba estacionado dentro de él. Las mujeres estaban sentadas en los típicos banquitos de plástico que los acababan de traer de la iglesia. Todas ellas son fieles seguidoras de las iglesias dentro de Santo Tomás la Unión.

En este grupo la mayoría de mujeres invierten su préstamo en la crianza de animales y reventa de ropa típica y americana. También se puede encontrar clientas que inviertan su préstamo en la compra de cajas de hilo para elaborar bellos bordados en las blusas típicas. Otras tienen tiendas de conveniencia donde ellas venden los productos que son altamente demandados por las personas de la aldea. Con su préstamo ellas comprar fréjoles, arroz, jabón, entre otros varios productos.

Las clientas piensan que trabajar bajo la metodología de bancos comunales es muy positivo ya que las mujeres, a pesar de que viven dentro de la misma comunidad, no se conocen bien. Consecuentemente, a través de Friendship Bridge ellas conocen a muchas más mujeres que viven cerca de ellas, y no solo las conocen sino es que trabajan y cooperan seguido. Esto crea un lazo interpersonal muy fuerte entre las integrantes del grupo. Además ellas creen que por medio de las capacitaciones y la convivencia muchas mujeres pierden la timidez de hablar en público y su auto estima incrementa. Al apostar por estas mujeres, por medio de Kiva, tú estas ayudando al desarrollo de estas mujeres. Siguelo haciendo!

loans.use: Sale of both typical and imported clothing; animal breeding

loans.name: Abla Laurence

texts.fr:
Madame Abla Laurence A. was born July 21, 1970 in Lomé. She is married and the mother of two. She is a hair stylist. She began her own salon called <> in 2002 in the district of Agoè in Lomé. She also sells hair extensions and cosmetic products. The high quality of the hair extensions and wigs she offers and the talent she possesses truly show off her professional skill. Her first loan of 300,000 FCFA will help her to purchase more hair extensions that she does not currently have in the salon. She would also like to purchase 150 sachets of the brand of hair extensions called Lora Bred, along with 30 new wigs.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Madame A. Abla Laurence est née le 21 juillet 1970 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la coiffure. Elle a crée son salon qu’elle nomme « COIFFURE LAURENCE » depuis l’année 2002 dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Elle vend également des mèches et des produits cosmétiques. La qualité des mèches qu’elle offre et le talent qu’elle utilise font d’elle une coiffeuse professionnelle. Le premier crédit d’un montant de 300.000 FCFA qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir les types de mèches dont elle ne dispose pas dans son salon. Ainsi elle désire acheter 150 sachets de mèches de type outré et Lora Bred et 30 perruques.

loans.use: To purchase locks of hair (hair extensions) and wigs.

loans.name: Afiwa Togneogna

texts.fr:
At 45 years old, Madame Afiwa Togneogna A. is married and the mother of 5 children. In 1998 she began to sell cereals in the market Adidogomé in Lomé. She buys corn, millet, peanuts and beans from the most far-flung farms of the city. She then sells a portion of these purchases on wholesale and sells the rest herself. She is asking for her first loan of 450,000 FCFA to purchase 10 sacks of corn and 6 sacks of millet. With her new stock, she will be able to improve her sales and make a maximum profit.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Agée de 45 ans, Madame A. Afiwa Togneogna est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. En 1998 elle a commencé par exercer le commerce de céréales dans le marché d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Son activité consiste à acheter du maïs, du mil, d’arachide et du haricot dans les fermes les plus reculées de Lomé. Elle vend une partie de ses achats en gros et procède à la vente en détail du reste. Elle sollicite pour la première fois un crédit de 450.000 FCFA pour acheter dix (10) sacs de maïs et six (6) sacs de mil. Avec ce nouveau stock, elle pourra améliorer ses ventes et tirer un maximum de bénéfice.

loans.use: To stock corn and millet

loans.name: Fe En Marcha Group

texts.en:
Claudia lives in Samana, in the eastern part of the Dominican Republic. She has raised three wonderful children (ages: 25, 22, and 20) and now focuses on her small “colmado” business, which provides much needed necessities to her community. She wants to use this loan to buy more rice, beans, sugar, bread, and milk for her store. When Claudia has free time, she enjoys going to church and talking with the other women in her community.

This will be Claudia’s 5th loan with Esperanza, and we hope that more women in her community will follow her example. On behalf of these women and Esperanza, thank you for your support and generosity!

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, milk, sugar, and bread

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr:
Mr. N. is a tree grower who has a lot of experience in buying and selling flowers and more specifically dwarf baobabs.

These plants are destined for the landscaping of green spaces and are more often put to use by innkeepers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur N. est abroculteur qui a une grande experience dans l'achat et la vente de fleurs et plus particulierement des baobabs nains.

Ces plantes sont destinées à l'aménagement des espaces verts et plus souvent utilisées par les hoteliers.

loans.use: Commerce in dwarf baobabs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for UIMCEC, a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Mr. Komi A. was born April 19, 1980 in Kouvé, in the district of Yoto. He is a sculptor and is married to Mrs. Abla Occansey, who is a seamstress. He began working as a sculptor in 1999 in Lomé. He bought tree trunks from the town Kpalimé and in certain other villages where the wood is plentiful and then brought it back to Lome. His customers all come from this town and from the interior of Togo, but above all they are foreigners and tourists. To keep his business going, he needs a loan of 450, 000 FCFA in order to purchase 100 feet of teak and 150 tree trunks in order to finish work for two complete lounges-sitting rooms.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Monsieur A. Komi est né le 19 avril 1980 à Kouvé dans la préfecture de Yoto. Il est un sculpteur et s’est marié à Mademoiselle OCCANSEY Abla qui est une couturière. Il a commencé son activité de sculpture en 1999 à Lomé. Il achète les troncs d’arbre à Kpalimé et dans certains villages ou le bois abonde et revient faire la sculpture à Lomé. Ses clients potentiels viennent de Lomé, de l’intérieur du Togo et surtout de l’étranger (Les touristes). Pour mener à bien son activité, Monsieur A. Komi sollicite un crédit de 450.000 FCFA pour acquérir 100 pieds de teck et 150 troncs d’iroko pour la fabrication de deux salons complets.

loans.use: To purchase 100 feet of teak.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Madame Ablavi A. was born April 27, 1976 in Lomé. She is married and the mother of two children. Since the age of 9, she has accompanied her mother to market to sell traditional style skirts. Starting in 1985, she took a liking to the craft and began to sell clothes on her own. Currently, she sells traditional style skirts and cooking utensils and sells them in the market Adidogomé as well as throughout the neighborhoods, on average a 12 kilometer stroll everyday. Her first loan is for 350,000 FCFA , which will allow her to purchase 15 more traditional style skirts of decent quality.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Madame A. Ablavi est née le 27 avril 1976 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Depuis l’âge de 9 ans elle accompagne sa mère au marché pour vendre les pagnes. C’est depuis cette année (1985) qu’elle a pris goût du commerce et a commencé par vendre pour son propre compte. Actuellement elle vend des pagnes et des ustensiles de cuisines dans le marché d’Adidogomé les jours de marchés et se promène les autres jours dans le quartier et parcours en moyenne 12 km par jour. Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite d’une valeur de 350.000 FCFA lui permettra d’acheter 15 pièces de pagnes de qualité intermédiaire.

loans.use: To purchase 15 traditional style cloths.

loans.name: Métanyire Manawa

texts.fr:
At 52 years old, Mr. Métanyire Manawa T. is the married father of three. He has a large store (ETS Dieu Seul Suffit) in which he sells traditional style skirts, shoes, fabrics, suitcases, plates, plastic buckets and iceboxes. He opened his store in 2002. With the revenue, he has been able to take care of his family. Currently, he has a small side project raising chickens for their meat and eggs. To complete this project, he is asking for a loan of 450.00 FCFA to purchase 100 chicks to raise and to make an enclosure for them of 16m squared.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Agé de 52 ans, Monsieur T. Métanyire Manawa est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Il dispose d’un grand magasin (ETS DIEU SEUL SUFFIT) dans lequel il vend les pagnes, les chaussures, les tissus, les valises, les assiettes, les seaux en plastique et les glacières. Il a ouvert ce magasin depuis 2002. Le revenu de ce commerce lui a permis de couvrir les charges de sa famille. Actuellement, il a un projet d’élevage des poulet de chairs et des pondeuses. Pour la réalisation de ce projet, il sollicite un premier crédit de 450.000 FCFA pour acheter 100 poussins et le reste faire un enclos d’une superficie de 16m².

loans.use: To purchase 100 chicks to raise.

loans.name: Victoire Pétria

texts.fr:
Madame Victoire Petrina K. was born on December 21, 1965 in Notse, a town located 100 kilometers from Lome. She is a widow and the mother of two children. She works selling locks of hair (hair extensions) and wigs in her neighborhood and in the Adidogomé market. Ever since her husband passed away, she has been the sole care taker of her two children. Her first loan was for 100,000 FCFA, which she used to improve her purchasing power from her suppliers. Her third loan was for 300,000 FCFA which helped her to purchase a carton of hair extensions and a carton of wigs.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Madame K. Victoire Pétrina est née le 21 décembre 1965 à Notsè, ville située à 100 Km de Lomé. Elle est veuve avec deux (2) enfants. Son activité principale est la vente de mèches et de perruques dans le quartier et dans le marché d’Adidogomé. Depuis que son mari est décédé, elle assure seule la charge de ses deux enfants. Les premier et deuxième crédits de 100.000 FCFA qu’elle a obtenus lui ont permis de renforcer son pouvoir d’achat vis-à-vis de ses fournisseurs. Le troisième crédit qu’elle sollicite d’un montant de 300.000 FCFA lui permettra d’acheter un carton de mèche et un carton de perruques

loans.use: To purchase locks of hair and wigs

loans.name: Akouvi Bijou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akouvi Bijou A. was born on November 12, 1959 in Agoè-Nyivé, which is located 12 kilometers from Lomé. She is married and the mother of one child. Her primary business venture is selling charcoal. Her husband works as a driver and helps her with transporting the sacks of charcoal. Mrs. Akouvi Bijou A. started up her charcoal business in 1997 and has regular sources she buys from. She sells wholesale and retail, according to the deliveries she receives.

This first loan that she is requesting in the amount of US$ 500 will allow her to purchase 22 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Akouvi Bijou est née le 12 novembre 1959 à Agoè-Nyivé, localité située à 12 km de Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle a pour activité principale le commerce de charbon de bois. Son mari qui est un chauffeur l’aide dans le transport de sacs de charbon. Madame A. Akouvi Bijou a démarré cette activité depuis 1997 et a des fournisseurs réguliers. Elle vend en gros et en détail selon les livraisons qu’elle a reçues.

Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite d’une valeur de 200.000 FCFA lui permettra acheter 22 sacs de charbon de bois.

loans.use:
Purchase of 22 sacks of charcoal

Achat de 22 sacs de charbons

loans.name: Florence

texts.fr:
Mrs. Florence P. was born on December 31, 1963 in Agou-kébo, which is located 110 kilometers from Lomé. She is a widow and is presently supporting two children. She has eye problems and has to wear glasses. She has opened a little shop where she sells generic medicines in the Tokoin Doumasséssé area in Lomé. In view of the demand for mineral water in her neighborhood, she would like to begin selling it. For this purpose, she is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 375 in order to buy 10 cartons of bottles and 100 bags of mineral water to meet the demand of her neighborhood clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame P. Florence est née le 31 décembre 1963 à Agou-kébo, localité située à 110 km de Lomé. Elle est veuve et supporte actuellement deux (2) enfants. Elle a des problèmes d’yeux et a l’habitude de porter les lunettes. Elle a ouvert une boutique de vente de produits génériques (médicaments) dans le quartier de Tokoin Doumasséssé à Lomé. Compte tenue de la demande en eau minérale dans le quartier, elle désire débuter ce commerce avec une somme de 150.000 FCFA qu’elle sollicite pour l’achat de dix (10) cartons de bouteille et 100 sachets d’eau minérale pour servir les consommateurs de son quartier.

loans.use:
Purchase of 100 bags of mineral water

Achat de 100 sachets d'eau minérale

loans.name: Hoja De Amistad Group

texts.en:
Tania lives with her husband and three children (ages: 16, 14, and 12) in the town of Samana. She is the proud owner of “Salon de Belleza” and she plans on using this loan for shampoo, conditioner, dye, and brushes. When she is not working at the salon she loves to draw, visit with her friends, and in the future she hopes to have a bigger home for her and her family. She is a very energetic and bright woman, and is determined to see her children have a better life than her own.

These 10 women are eagerly awaiting this loan and can’t wait to put it to good use. Thank you to Kiva lenders for your continued support and generosity!

loans.use: Materials for a beauty salon

loans.name: Lili

texts.es:
Mrs. Lili is a member of the Indo American Community Bank, located at Av. Amazon, Lt. F Block 20, Calleria District, Ucayali State. She is 43 years old, married, and has eight children. Her husband is a trader.

With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) of approximately $110, Lili started a business selling food. At present, she has a restaurant. She gets up at 6 am to go to the market and buy the ingredients for preparing the dishes that she sells from noon to 2 pm. With this loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, Lili plans to buy: 1 large sack of rice, 1 large sack of sugar, noodles, oil, etc.

Lili is very glad that she can support her children with their studies as well as contribute to the household expenses. She is very grateful for the support Manuela Ramos provides for her business.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Lili pertenece al Banco Comunal Indo América, ubicado en la Av. Amazonas, Mz F Lt 20, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años y es madre de 8 hijos, su esposo es comerciante Lili con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de comida. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un restaurante, se levanta a las 6 am para ir al mercado y comprar sus productos para preparar sus comidas que los vende desde el medio día hasta las 2 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, fideos, aceite, etc. Lili esta muy feliz y satisfecha, por que puede apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y también aporta a los gastos familiares y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for the preparation of restaurant food

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Señora Juana belongs to the communal bank of Indo America located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She's 50 years old with 2 children. Her husband is a salesman. With the first loan Juana received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to open up a little food/snack stand where she sells all sorts of food and refreshments.

She continues in this business. She begans her day at 7:00 in the morning to prepare breakfast for her family and she then prepares her delicious dishes to later sell them.

With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase rice, sugar, chicken and fish.

Juana is very happy because she's very successful at what she does and now she's a hard-working independent woman who can take care of herself and her family. She's very thankful for all the support Manuela Ramos has given her.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal Indo América, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano Pedro Portillo, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 50 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Juana con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de jugos y comidas. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de comida, se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo y de allí se dedica a la preparación de sus comidas para luego venderlas. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 caja de gaseosa, pollos, pescado, etc. Juana esta muy alegre, por que aprendió a salir adelante aun cuando se le habían cerrado las puertas para trabajar, ahora ella es una mujer trabajadora e independiente con su negocio, puede apoyar a su familia y esto le enorgullece y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase basic ingredients to make delicious dishes

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44343

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Señora Manuela belongs to the communal bank of Carmen Cabrejos located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She's 46 years old with 2 children. Her husband is a professor. With the first loan Manuela received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to open up a small convenience store.

She continues in this business. She begans her day at 7:00 in the morning to prepare breakfast for her family and she then services her store until 8:00 in the evening.

With this loan, which she will repay within 5 months, she will purchase rice, sugar, eggs and milk

Manuela is very happy because she's able to provide for her children thanks to her job and she feels realized as a woman because she can take care of herself. She's very thankful for all the support Manuela Ramos has given her.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Manuela pertenece al Banco Comunal Carmen Cabrejos, ubicado en el Jr Malecón Hoyada Mz 116 Lt 15, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 46 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es profesor. Manuela con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad ella cuenta con una bodega, se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo y de allí se dedica a la atención de su bodega hasta las 8 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 caja de huevos, 1 caja de leche, etc. Manuela esta muy satisfecha, por que esta viendo a sus hijos crecer con el apoyo que gracias a su trabajo ha logrado y también se siente realizada como mujer por que aprendió a trabajar y salir adelante y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her convenience store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Loisi

texts.es:
Señora Loisi belongs to the communal bank of Carmen Cabrejos located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She's 36 years old with 4 children. Her husband is a chauffer. With the first loan Loisi received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to purchase and sell all sorts of merchandise to sell.

She continues in this business. She begans her day at 7:00 in the morning to prepare breakfast for her family and then she sells her merchandise until 5:00 in the evening.

With this loan, which she will repay within 5 months, she will purchase clothes for men, women and children, shoes, etc.

Loisi is very happy because she can now work independently and make as much money as she wants. She can also take care of her family. She's very thankful for all the support Manuela Ramos has given her.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Loisi pertenece al Banco Comunal Carmen Cabrejos, ubicado en el Jr Adolfo Morey No 667, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 36 años y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es chofer. Loisi con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de compra y venta de mercadería. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de compra y venta de mercadería, se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo luego se dedica a la venta de su mercadería hasta las 5 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: ropas para damas caballeros y niños, zapatos, etc. Loisi esta muy feliz, por que ahora puede trabajar de manera independiente y sus ganancias dependen de ella misma y ahora puede sustentar los gastos de su familia y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to sell  such as clothes, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Marbelita

texts.es:
Señora Maribelita belongs to the communal bank called Las Azucenas located in the district of Yarina Cocha in Ucayali. She's 43 years old and a mother of 3 children. Her husband is a carpenter. With the first loan Maribelita obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invested by selling ice cream.

She continues in this business but she now makes a huge and wide variety of ice cream that she has obtained the help from her children who sell them in the city.

With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she will purchase Jell-O, sugar, sticks, small bags and milk.

Maribelita is very happy to be able to work and be independent. This way she's able to help her family financially.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maribelita pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas 2, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano. Ucayali Mz. D Lt. 17, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años y es madre de 3 hijos mayores de edad, su esposo es maderero. Maribelita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de chupetes y gelatinas. En la actualidad ella continúa con la venta de chupetes y gelatinas pero en mayores cantidades, con la ayuda de sus hijos preparan sus productos y salen a vender por la ciudad. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 10 Kg. de gelatina, 1 saco de azúcar, esencias, bolsitas, palitos, 1 caja de leche. Maribelita se siente muy bien por que puede trabajar y ser una mujer independiente y de esta manera apoya a su familia en los gastos económicos.

loans.use: To purchase basic ingredients to make ice-cream

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
Señora Maria belongs to the comunal bank called Carmen Cabrejos located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She's 63 years old and a mother of 4 children. Her husband is a retired teacher. With the first loan Maria received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to have her own business by selling cosmetics.

She continues to sell cosmetics. Her day begans about 7:00 in the mornig to prepare breakfast for her family and she then solely concentrates in selling her cosmetics until about 6:00 in the evening.

With this loan, which she will repay within 5 months, she will purchase lipsticks, nail polishes, etc. Maria is very happy and proud of herself for been able to take care of herself and her family. She's very thankful for all the support she receives for her business from Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal Carmen Cabrejos, ubicado en el Jr Cahuide No 568, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 63 años y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es jubilado de educación. Maria con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de cosméticos. En la actualidad ella cuenta sigue con su mismo negocio de venta de cosméticos, se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo y de allí se dedica a la venta de sus cosméticos hasta las 6 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: labiales, rubores, esmaltes para uñas, etc. Maria esta muy contenta y orgullosa, por que ha hecho realidad su sueño de poder trabajar y depender de ella misma, ahora puede apoyar en los gastos de su familia y esto le enorgullece y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Marllory

texts.es:
Señora Marllory belongs to the communal bank called Comunal Indo America located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She's 25 years old and she has one son. Her husband is a salesman. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, Marllory decided to open up her own business making and selling Mapachos (which are cigarettes used for medicinal purposes).

She's currently making and selling Mapachos for home remedies. She starts her day at 7:00 in the morning to prepare breakfast for her family and then she solely concentrates on making Mapachos until 10:00 in the evening.

With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase tabbaco, etc. Marllory is very happy because she's now able to provide for her family and this makes her very proud. She's very thankful for all the support she gets from Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Marllory pertenece al Banco Comunal Indo América, ubicado en el Jr Asentamiento Humano Barrio Unido, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 25 años y es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo es comerciante. Marllory con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de preparación y venta de mapachos. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de preparación de cigarros mapachos esto para las curaciones caseras del lugar, se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de su hijo y de su esposo, luego se dedica a la preparación de sus cigarros mapacho hasta las 10 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: cigarros artesanales, 1 ciento de mazorcas de tabaco, etc. Marllory esta muy feliz, por que puede apoyar en los gastos familiares esto le hace estar llena de orgullo, ella esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make cigarettes called Mapachos which are used for medicinal purposes

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)
Correction due to overpayment for business 44348

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza belongs to the comunal bank “Carmen Cabrejos”, which is located in the Calleria district in the department of Ucayali. Shi is 43 years old and is the mother of 5 children. Her husband works in wood. With the first S/. 300.00 loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, Maritza decided to invest in a business of buying and selling merchandise.

She gets up at 7:00 am to prepare breakfast for her children and husband. After that, she spends the rest of the day until 4:00pm selling her merchandise.

With this loan of S/. 2,000.00, which will be paid back in 5 months, she will buy: clothing for women, men, and children, rings, bracelets, earrings, purses, wallets, handkerchiefs, shoes, jewelry, towels, ties, and Thermoses, etc.

Maritza is very content. She feels that she is an independent woman and her earnings allow her to help support her family. She is very grateful for the support that Manuela Ramos provides for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maritza pertenece al Banco Comunal Carmen Cabrejos, ubicado en el Jr Cahuide No 410, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años y es madre de 5 hijos, su esposo trabaja en la madera. Maritza con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en el negocio de compra y venta de mercadería. En la actualidad ella sigue con su mismo negocio de compra y venta de mercadería, se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo y de allí se dedica a la venta de su mercadería hasta las 4 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: ropas para damas caballeros y niños, sortijas, pulseras, aretes, carteras, billeteras, pañuelos, zapatos, joyas, toallitas, corbatas, ternos etc. Maritza esta muy contenta, por que esta se siente una mujer independiente y sus ganancias de penden de ella misma permitiéndole apoyar a su familia y también puede aportar en su hogar y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: With this loan she will buy more merchandise

loans.name: Relia

texts.es:
Relia belongs to the “Carmen Cabrejos” comunal bank, which is located in the Calleria district in the department of Ucayali. She is 50 years old and is the mother of 4 children. Her husband is a mechanic. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest S/. 300.00 in a business selling replacement parts for large motors.

She gets up at 7am to prepare breakfast for her children and her husband. After that, she spends the rest of the day selling the motor parts until 6pm.

With this loan of S/. 2,000.00, which will be paid in 5 months, she will buy a variety of replacement parts and accessories for large motors.

Relia is very happy because no she can work independently and her earnings depend on her. Now she can help with the family expenses and she is very grateful for the help that Manueal Ramos provides for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Relia pertenece al Banco Comunal Carmen Cabrejos, ubicado en el Jr Espinar No 648, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 50 años y es madre D. 4 hijos, su esposo es mecánico. Relia con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio D. venta D. repuestos D. motores grandes. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio D. venta D. repuestos D. motores grandes, se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno D. sus hijos y D. su esposo y D. allí se dedica a la venta D. sus piezas mecánicas hasta las 6 pm. Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: diversos tipos D. piezas y accesorios para motores mayores. Relia esta muy feliz, por que ahora pueD. trabajar D. manera independiente y sus ganancias dependen D. ella misma y ahora pueD. sustentar los gastos D. su familia y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: With this loan she will buy a variety of replacement parts for large motors

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy belongs to the “Carmen Cabrejos” communal bank, which is located in the district of Calleria, in the deparment of Ucayali. She is 43 years old and is the mother of 4 children, but her earnings are not sufficient to cover the family expenses. With the first S/. 300.00 loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, Nancy decided to invest in a business of buying and selling various merchandise.

She rises at 7:00am to prepare breakfast for her children and her husband. She then sells her merchandise until 6:00pm.

With this loan of S/. 1300.00, which will be paid back in 5 months, she will buy: clothing for women, men, and children, rings, bracelets, earrings, purses, wallets, handkerchiefs, shoes, etc.

Nancy is very happy because she is helping her family to get ahead, as a result of her own hard work and perseverance. This allows her to help her children with their studies and she is very proud of herself because she is able to help out with the family expenses. She is very grateful for the support that Manuela Ramos provides to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nancy pertenece al Banco Comunal Carmen Cabrejos, ubicado en el Jr Cahuide No 528, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años,es madre de 4 hijos, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuenta no le alcanza para los gastos familiares. Nancy con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de compra y venta de mercadería. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de compra y venta de mercadería, se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, luego se dedica a la venta de su mercadería hasta las 6 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1300, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: ropas para damas caballeros y niños, sortijas, pulseras, aretes, carteras, billeteras, pañuelos, zapatos, etc. Nancy esta muy feliz, por que esta sacando a delante a su familia a base de esfuerzo y perseverancia y esto le permite ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios pues también esta muy orgullosa de si misma y también puede aportar en su hogar y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Unidas Venceremos Group

texts.en:
Clara lives with her two children (ages: 20 and 18) in the small town of Samana. This will be her 5th loan with Esperanza, and with this money she has opened her own store selling clothes and jewelry. She wants to use this next loan to buy more chains, earrings, rings, pants, shirts, and blouses in order to continue expanding her small shop. Clara told us that her favorite foods are rice and beans and her favorite pastime is playing dominos with her friends. Her goal for the future is to continue saving money through Esperanza’s voluntary savings program.

On behalf of these 5 entrepreneurs and Esperanza, we would like to thank you for your encouragement and support! We can watch together as this loan changes these entrepreneurs over the next six months. God Bless!

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Reyna Amanda

texts.es:
Reyna belongs to the “Las Azucenas 2” comunal bank, which is located in the district of Calleria, in the department of Ucayali. She is 49 years old and is the mother of three grown children. Her husband is a vendor. With the first loan of S/. 300.00 that she received from Manuela Ramos, Reyna decided to invest in a small grocery store.

She rises every morning at 7:00am to make breakfast for her children and her husband. She then opens her store and tends it until 8pm.

With this loan of S/.1000.00, which will be paid back in 4 months, she will buy: 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, milk, soap, noodles, etc. Reyna is very happy because with the help of Manuela Ramos, she is able to work independently and help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Reyna pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas 2, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano. 11 de Julio Psj. Fraternidad 189, Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49 años y es madre de 3 hijos mayores de edad, su esposo es comerciante. Reyna con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, luego abre su bodega para atenderla hasta las 8 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, leche, jabón, fideos, etc. Reyna esta muy feliz, ya que gracias al apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos puede trabajar de manera independiente y ayudar a su familia.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her small grocery store

loans.name: Neria

texts.es:
Neria belongs to the “Las Azucenas 2” comunal bank, which is located in the district of Calleria, in the department of Ucayali. She is 42 years old and is the mother of 4 children. With the first loan of S/. 300.00 that she received from Manuela Ramos, Reyna decided to invest in a business selling food.

She rises every morning at 7:00am to make breakfast for her children and her husband. She then prepares the foods that she makes and sells them.

With this loan of S/. 1,200.00, which will be paid back in 4 months, she will buy: 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, basic food ingredients, beef, fish, vegetables, and soft drinks.

Neria is very happy with her loan from Manuela Ramos. Thanks to them, she happily spends her days with her children at her side.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Adita pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas 2, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano Fernando Belaunde Ferry S/N del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años y es madre de 4 hijos. Neria con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de comida(Juanes). En la actualidad se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, luego se dedica a la preparación de sus comidas para venderlos y salir a vender sus comidas. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, víveres, res, pescado, verduras, gaseosas. Neria se siente muy bien con el préstamo de Manuela Ramos gracias a ellos pasa días felices a lado de sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for the prepartion of the foods she makes

loans.name: Teresa Mercedes

texts.es:
Teresa belongs to the the “Las Azucenas 2” comunal bank, wich is located in the district of Calleria, in the department of Ucayali. She is 51 years old and is the mother of five grown children. Her husband is electrician. With the first loan of S/. 300.00 that she received from Manuela Ramos, Reyna decided to invest in a business selling food.

In the afternoon she sells items from a menu, and in the evening she sells salchipapa (a dish maD. with potatoes and sausage). With her children’s help, they prepare the foods and share in the housekeeping duties.

With this loan of S/. 1,400.00, which will be paid back in 4 months, she will buy: a cart from which to sell the salchipapas, soft drinks, and other ingredients for her foods.

Teresa is very happy and she is grateful to Manuela Ramos because it is of great support to her and has taught her many values.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Teresa pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas 2, ubicado en el Jr. Contamina 183, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 51 años y es madre D. 5 hijos mayores D. edad, su esposo es electricista. Teresa con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta D. comida. En la actualidad en las tardes venD. menú y en las noches salchipapas, con la ayuda D. sus hijos se dedican a la preparación D. sus comidas y se reparten las tareas domesticas del hogar. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,400 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: un carrito salchipapero, gaseosas, y víveres para sus comidas. Teresa esta muy contenta, Le agradece a Manuela Ramos por que es un gran apoyo para ella y le enseña muchos valores.

loans.use: To buy a food vending cart and ingredients for the foods she makes

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Terresa belongs to the communal bank Indo America, located at Jr TARAPACA, Number 899, in the district of Calleria and in the department of Ucayali. She is 41 years old and has two children. Her husband is also a merchant. With the first loan that Teresa received from Manuel Ramos for 300 Soles she invested in her business of selling cellular devices.

Presently she depends on the income from this business. Everyday, she wakes up at 6 in the morning so that she can prepare breakfast for her two kids and her husband. From there she goes to her business and works until 8:00 pm

With the loan of 1,400 Soles, which will be paid back in 6 months, she will use the money to buy cell phones, chargers, cases, etc.

Teresa is very happy because with her hard-work and perseverance she is achieving all of her goals. As a mother and a woman she is source of pride for her family. She is very grateful for the support that Manuela Ramos has given to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Gabe of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Teresa pertenece al Banco Comunal Indo América, ubicado en el Jr Tarapacá No 899, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Teresa con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de celulares.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de celulares, se levanta a las 6 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, de allí se dedica a la venta de sus celulares hasta las 8 pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,400, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: celulares, cargadores, envolturas para celulares, etc.

Teresa esta muy contenta, ya que con decisión y perseverancia esta logrando objetivos muy importantes como madre y como mujer es un orgullo para su familia, ella esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Buy cell phones to sell.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 44356

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara is a member of the communal bank Las Azucenas 2, located in the Asentamiento Humano, Union de damnificados Mz. C Lt. 8, of the Yarina Cocha district, Departamento de Uyacali. She is 42 years old and mother to three children. Her husband is an electrician. She decided to use the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, in the amount of S/. 300, to set up a small hardware store.

Currently she still has the hardware store but also sells clothing and shoes. She wakes up very early to take care of her children and take them to school. She then tends to her store.

She plans to use this loan, in the amount of S/.1,400 and that will be paid in 4 months, to purchase: nails, iron reinforcing rods, tubes/pipes, corrugated iron, clothing and shoes. Sara is very happy about the loans and the support she has received, thanks to them she is getting ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Sara pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas 2, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano.Unión de Damnificados Mz. C Lt. 8, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es técnico electricista. Sara con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña ferretería.

En la actualidad ella continúa con una ferretería y también se dedica a la venta de ropas y zapatos, se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus hijos llevarlos a la escuela, y luego se dedica a atender su negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,400 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: clavos, fierros, tubos, calaminas, y ropa y zapatos. Sara se siente muy feliz los prestamos les han brindado mucha apoyo y gracias a ellos esta saliendo adelante.

loans.use: She will use the loan to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana Isabel P. P., a member of the communal bank “Alonso Ugarte”, lives in the region and province of San Martín, located in the district de Tarapoto. She runs her business out of her home, which is located at 239 Jirón Alfonso Ugarte. She sells snack foods, treats and soft drinks. She also sells different types of meats, like sausage and jerky, in the Market #2 of her city.

She began her business by selling sausages with her aunt in the Market #2 in a small stand. Little by little, her sales have increased and her client base has grown. Now she has expanded her business and she works independently. Also, she began selling soft drinks, treats and snack foods out of her own home. She is very happy with what she has accomplished and she wants to continue to be successful so that she can give her children the best future possible.

With a loan on 3,000 Soles, which she will repay in 6 payments, she will buy pigs to raise for the preparation of her products. She will also purchase soft drinks, and mineral water in bulk, various types of cookies and different types of sweets to sell.

She is 28 years and has two small children. She is a very responsible and hard-working woman. Her desire to get ahead and to help her husband in raising their children has motivated her to become a small business owner. In the future she hope to start a restaurant that sells Creole and International food.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Ana Isabel P. P., es socia del Banco Comunal “Alfonso Ugarte”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa situado en el Jirón Alfonso Ugarte Nº 239, tiene venta de golosinas, bebidas gasificadas y en mercado Nº 2 de la misma ciudad vende cecina, chorizo y relleno de cerdo.

Se inicio vendiendo rellenos en el mercado N° 2, en un pequeño puesto de ventas junto a su tía y poco a poco fueron creciendo las ventas y el reconocimiento, ahora amplio su negocio a la venta de cecina y chorizo de cerdo y lo hace sola, además implemento la venta de golosinas y bebidas gasificadas en su propia casa y se siente bien, contenta de lo que ha logrado y sigue logrando para dar a sus hijos un mejor futuro.

Con el préstamo de S/. 3000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará cerdos para la preparación de sus productos, también bebidas gasificadas en paquetes, agua mineral en paquetes, galletas variados sabores en paquetes, y golosinas diversas.

Ella tiene 28 años de edad, con dos hijos pequeños, es una mujer muy responsable, decidida, sus deseos de salir adelante y apoyar a su esposo en la educación de sus hijos la han impulsado a desarrollarse como pequeña empresaria, posteriormente piensa poner un restaurante de comida criolla e internacional.

loans.use: Pigs to raise for the preparation of her products.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Patricia Milagros

texts.es:
Mrs. Patricia Milagros V. R. D. M. is part of the communal bank “Alfonso Ugarte”. She lives in the region San Martin, province of San Martin, district Morales. Her address is 250 Highway Oasis. She lives in the neighborhood Huayco where she also runs her restaurant, the business to which she dedicates her time.

The opportunity to have a loan through the communal bank has allowed her and her husband to invest in her business and it has grown as the number of her customers keeps increasing.

With a loan of 3,000.00 Soles, which will be paid back in 6 months, she will invest in remodeling in her restaurant. She wants to add a playground for kids with a sliD. and swings.

Mrs. Patricia is 38 years of age, she lives with her husband and her 3 children, and everyone depends on her. She has the support of her husband who works with her at the restaurant. Together they work hard to attend their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Patricia Milagros V. Ríos D. M. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Alfonso Ugarte” vive en la Región San Martí, provincia D. San Martín, distrito D. Morales, su domicilio está ubicado en la Carretera Oasis Nº 250 Barrio Huayco donD. también funciona su Restaurante Recreo, negocio al que se dedica.

La oportunidad D. un préstamo en el Banco Comunal le permitió desarrollar junto a su esposo este negocio e implementarlo cada vez más D. acuerdo a la exigencia D. sus clientes.

Con el crédito recibido por S/. 3,000.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, se implementará la infraestructura con juegos D. esparcimiento para niños, como por ejemplo columpios, toboganes y otros.

La señora Patricia tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos y todos dependen D. ella, tiene el apoyo D. su esposo y trabajan coordinadamente en la atención al cliente en el negocio.

loans.use: Buy playground equipment for the kids.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44359

loans.name: Giovana Del Pilar

texts.es:
Señora Giovanna del Pilar P. I. is a member of the community bank "Alfonso Ugarte." She lives in the region of San Martín in the province of San Martín in the district of Tarapato. Her home is located at Jr. Jiménez Pimentel Nº 501, where she serves menú (a set meal of the day) every day.

The loans from Manuela have allowed her to improve her business, and now her clients have increased to the point where she needs to improve it further.

With the loan for 500 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will buy pans and pots and plates, so that she can offer a greater variety on her menu due to the demand of her clients.

Señora Giovanna is 24 years old. She doesn't have any kids yet, and her husband works from home at another business, and with the help of her mother-in-law, she attends to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Giovanna del Pilar P. I. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Alfonso Ugarte” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Jiménez Pimentel Nº 501 donde también vende menú todos los días.

Los préstamos de Manuela le han permitido implementar mejor su negocio,ya que sus clientes han aumentado últimamente para lo cual necesitaba implementarse más.

Con el crédito por S/. 500.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará ollas, cubiertos y platos que le permitirán ofertar variedad de menú ante la exigencia de su clientela.

La señora Giovanna tiene 24 años, no tiene hijos aún y su esposo trabaja en forma dependiente fuera del hogar y con la ayuda de su suegra atiende el negocio.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy pots and pans, lids, and plates for her business.

loans.name: Nelly Cecilia

texts.es:
Señora Nelly Cecilia M. V. de Chu is a member of the community bank "Alfonso Ugarte." She lives in the region of San Martín in the province of San Martín in the district of Tarapato. Her home and her business are located at Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Nº 218. She is dedicated to musical instrument sales.

The loans from Manuela Ramos have permitted her to purchase instruments of high demand in her area and it's thanks to this support that she has increased her business. The support is quite important to her because she can attend to all her clients with their different orders.

With the loan for 3,000 Soles, which she will be repaid in six months, she will buy six guitars, some imported and some national, and one Yamaha organ she had ordered pending payment.

At age 51, Señora Nelly Cecilia feels successful economically since she is able to contribute to realizing her dream of seeing her two children become professionals. They support her directly in the business because they like toning the instruments and they know the business well. Her husband taught her how to manage the business because he has substantial experience.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Nelly Cecilia M. V. de Chu pertenece al Banco Comunal “Alfonso Ugarte” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, su domicilio y su negocio están ubicados en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Nº 218, se dedica a la venta de instrumentos musicales.

El préstamo de Manuela Ramos le ha permitido adquirir instrumentos que tiene mayor movimiento en la zona y esta agradecida de este apoyo ya que le permite incrementar su negocio que le parece bastante importante ya que puede atender a sus clientes con sus diferentes pedidos.

Con el crédito por S/. 3,000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: 6 guitarras de toda variedad o número importadas y nacionales y 01 órgano marca Yamaha que tenía pedido pendiente de entrega.

La señora Nelly Cecilia a sus 51 años, se siente realizada económicamente ya que puede contribuir para realizar su sueño de ver profesionales a sus 2 hijos quienes le apoyan directamente en su negocio ya que les gusta entonar estos instrumentos y saben del negocio, su esposo le enseñó administrar el negocio porque tiene bastante experiencia.

loans.use: She will buy more musical instruments for her business.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44361

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Ms. Jessica M. Rengífo belongs to the Bank of Township “Alfonso Ugarte.” She lives in the region of San Martin and Province of San Martin, district of la Banda de Shilcayo Tarapoto,. Her home is located en el Jr. Jose Carlos Mariategui No. 159 and her business is located in el Jr. Raymond No. 292 de Tarapoto, where she lends her services doing Cosmotology.

The opportunity of a loan from Manuela Ramos has permitted her to renovate the furniture and supplies she uses in her beauty salon that generates income for the past 8 years and permits her to get necessities for her family.

With the credit of 800 soles that is paid over the 6 months, she would buy new seat covers and buy blow dryers.

Ms. Jessica lives with her husband and her 2 kids. She hired someone to help her in her business, at times even her husband sometimes supports her economically with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariah of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Jessica M. R. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Alfonso Ugarte” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo Tarapoto, su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. José Carlos Mariátegui Nº 159 y su negocio se ubica en el Jr. Raymondi Nº 292 de Tarapoto, en cuyo local presta servicios como cosmetóloga.

La oportunidad de un préstamo en Manuela Ramos le ha permitido renovar los muebles y maquinaria que utiliza en su salón de belleza que durante 8 años le genera ingresos que le permiten cubrir necesidades de su familia.

Con el crédito por S/. 800.00 que será pagado el 6 meses, mandara a confeccionar nuevas fundas para los mubles donde esperan le turno sus clientes asimismo comprará una secadora eléctrica para cabello.

La señora Jessica vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, en el negocio le ayuda un personal que contrató, asimismo su esposo en algunos momentos aporta también económicamente para implementar su negocio.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy a hair dryer among other things for her business.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44362

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria O. has been selling bread out of her own bakery for 20 years in Condega, a town in the city of Estelí. She started her business with little money but as time passed she was able to move forward. Today she has a better store for business and has hired two young men who help her make all types of bread. They also help her buy products when it is necessary to go out and buy something new.

Ceprodel has been an important pillar of support in the development of Mrs. O.'s business. For more than two years Ceprodel has provided Maria with credits that have enabled her to purchase more raw materials for making bread. Today she needs these raw materials so that she can make her delicious bread and distribute it in her sector.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

La señora Maria O. desde hace 20 años se dedica al negocio de venta de pan teniendo su propia panadería en el municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí. Con poco capital inició su negocio pero a través del tiempo ha logrado salir adelante y hoy en día posee un mejor local para el negocio y además ha contratado a dos jóvenes que le trabajan en la elaboración del pan de diferente tipo y en la compra de los productos cuando es necesario salir a buscarlos.

Ceprodel ha sido una columna importante en el mejoramiento de su negocio por el hecho que desde hace dos años atrás le ha venido apoyando otorgándole créditos que le han permitido adquirir su materia prima para la elaboración de los diferentes tipos de pan. Hoy en día su necesidad radica en la urgencia de la compra de esta materia prima para lograr elaborar el delicioso pan y comercializarlo en su sector.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Guineales Group

texts.es:
The women that belong to “Las Guineales” Communal Bank gather together every three weeks outside a home made of adobe. Their meeting place is next to Manuela G.’s kitchen where she is constantly making tamales to sell at a very modest price to her partners.

The house where the meetings take place is located in a town far from the Guatemalan coast and, sadly, it is occasionally plagued by delinquents. Nevertheless, the town of Los Guineales is blessed with fertile land. This is a place covered with coffee plantations and when the coffee berries appear, the town is painted red.

This group of women is known to be very organized and, despite the fact that they appear serious at first, they are full of smiles once they get to know you. The members of this group invest the money they borrow in two principal activities: woven items and convenience stores.

The women that work in the textile area use their loans to buy thread, which is used to weave traditional Guatemalan clothing utilizing a special technique. They also use the thread to embroider beautiful and colorful flowers on the blouses that are worn in the high plains of Guatemala.

The women who have convenience stores use the money they borrow to replenish inventory. They all buy laundry detergent, beans, rice, sugar, cooking oil and other products used in the home. But some of the women with a more entrepreneurial vision also buy products that can’t be found in other stores, like prepaid cards for cellular phones, cereals, deli items and even shrimp.

The Guineales women say that they like working with Friendship Bridge because of the convenience to pay back the loan in payments due every 42 days with no interest plus, the training they have received helps them grow their businesses. They also mention that they like working together because they all pay on time and feel like they have formed a solid group.

This is a special group of women to which Friendship Bridge has given the opportunity to grow. Nevertheless, it will be thanks to the money you are going to invest in them that will help this group succeed. Thank you for supporting and believing in them.  

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Las mujeres que agrupan el banco comunal Las Guineales se juntan cada tres semanas a las afueras de una casa de adobe. Su lugar de encuentra se ubica al costado de la cocina de doña Manuela G., la cual está constantemente cocinando tamales para venderlos a un muy módico precio al resto de sus compañeras.

La casa donde se lleva acabo los encuentros se encuentra en una aldea muy retirada en la costa de Guatemala y lastimosamente es asediada, ocasionalmente, por delincuentes. Sin embargo, la aldea los Guineales está bendita con una tierra muy productiva. Este dicho lugar está cubierto por cafetales que cuando están retoñando sus frutos colorean la aldea de rojo.

Este grupo de mujeres tienen la característica de ser muy organizadas y a pesar de que reflejan una imagen seria al principio, regalan sonrisas cuando entran en confianza. Las integrantes de este grupo invierten su crédito en dos actividades mayormente: tejidos y tiendas de conveniencia.

Las clientas que trabajan en el área textil utilizan su crédito para comprar hilo. Con este hilo ellas tejen los trajes tradicionales de Guatemala, utilizando la técnica de telar de cintura. También, usan el hilo para bordar bellas y coloridas flores en las blusas que se utilizan en el altiplano de Guatemala.

En lo que respecta a la actividad de tiendas de conveniencia. Las clientas utilizan su crédito para completar el inventario de sus respectivas tiendas. Todas ellas compran jabón para lavar ropa, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros productos que se utilizan en el hogar. Sin embargo, algunas clientas con visión empresarial compran productos que no se encuentran en otras tiendas, como tarjetas de celular prepago, cereales, embutidos y hasta camarones.

Las mujeres Guineales dicen que les gusta trabajar con Friendship Bridge porque tienen la facilidad de pagar en cuotas de cuarenta y dos días cada una, les acomoda el interés y las capacitaciones que han recibido las ayuda a que su negocio crezca. Ellas también mencionaron que, les gusta trabajar juntas porque todas pagan puntualmente y sienten que se ha formado un grupo consolidado.

Este es un grupo especial de mujeres al cual Friendship Bridge les ha dado una oportunidad de crecer. Sin embargo, va a ser gracias al capital que se ustedes van a invertir en ellas que va a impulsar a este grupo al éxito. Gracias por apoyarlas y creer en ellas.

loans.use: Purchase the materials necessary to make and embroider typical clothing; purchase products to sell in convenience stores

loans.name: Mayra Del Socorro

texts.es:
In the municipality of Condega, Nicaragua, there are many businesses, among them, the general store of Mrs. M., who is well recognized in the sector. Conscious of the situation and competition, Mrs. M. is dedicated to the business of her general store, which she has operated for the past nine years, over which time, it has helped her economic situation.

It is very important to note that she has been able to improve her situation largely with the helop of Ceprodel, which has lent a friendly hand with credits and support, which has allowed her to acquire merchandise to commercialize in her store.

In this way, sh hopes to help her family, providing them with better living conditions. e

loans.use: Purchase of goods for her general store

loans.name: Silvio  José

texts.es:
Mr. Silvio C. is dedicated to agriculture and the sale of cultivated foodstuff, which happens right near his fields, which means that he can be around his family, helping to raise their quality of life.

Mr. Silvio has been characterized as a person who is hard working, since he has been working in agriculture since he was very young. This kind of work requires effort, dedication and above all, strength, as it can include heavy work, meaning that people get tired quickly. In spite of this, Mr. Silvio is determined to raise to the level of living in his family, and to improve the quality of the seeds he cultivates. For this reason, he is asking for help n order to be able to receive more credit from Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase of basic material for cultivating/agriculture

loans.name: Maritza Marlene

texts.es:
Maritza A. is a strong woman, originally from the municipality of Condega, Nicaragua. For more than 15 years, she has dedicated herself to the sale of different purchases, right from her home, which has been able to turn into a store, by investing over the years.

In order to progress and invest in the education of her three young children, she is looking for a way to invest more in her business, and for that reason, she has asked for credit from Ceprodel, in order be able buy more products to see. Today, she is asking for the necessary credit, in order to enhance her commercialization work to her loyal clients.

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Mr. Alberto A. is dedicated to working in the tranport sector and has his own small truck that he uses to move cargo and passengers, according to the specific needs of his clients. For 6 years, he has worked in this sector, which has allowed him, over to time, to invest in the business in order to provide better conditions to the users of his transport services, either with him driving or using his truck to take products to the market.

Today, Mr. Alberto has the urgent need to buy parts for his truck, which is out of service, and therefore means, there is no income to maintain his family. For this reason, he is requesting assistance from Ceprodel to be able to benefit from a credit, that will allow him to buy parts and continue his business, and sustain his home and family.

loans.use: Purchase of truck parts

loans.name: Petrona Ermelinda

texts.es:
For 15 years, in the municipality of Condega, Nicaragua, Mrs. Petrona Calderon has been dedicated to the business of selling natural medicines, which she offers straight from her home, meaning that she maintains a humble home.

It is necessary to note that this woman is single, and for that reason, she has no help from other people to help her subsist, therefore only through her business of natural medicine is she able to progress. Today, she is in immediate need to purchase medicines for her business. For this reason, she is asking for Ceprodel for credit which will allow her to purchase more medicines to commercialize to her loyal clients, and in this way, she will be able to enhance her standard of life, using her own economic resources.

loans.use: compra de medicina natural

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Mrs. Francisca is 64 years old and despite her age she is a very active person and she never stops working. She works from 7 am till 1 pm as a janitor in a school, and if the afternoons she washes and irons clothes. She lives in the neighborhood of Walter Ferreti with her only daughter. In this area very seldom there is water delivery (when it does it usually happens in the early morning), and in other occasions they have to buy it and as such the use of the restroom is not possible. She is asking for a loan in order to build a latrine in her house and that way minimize her water supply problem.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Francisca tiene 64 años de edad y a pesar de su edad es una mujer activa que no para de trabajar, de 7 de la mañana a la 1 de la tarde trabaja como conserje en un colegio desde hace 22 años y por las tardes lava y plancha ropa ajena. Habita en el Barrio Walter Ferreti con su única hija, en ese barrio no llega agua casi todo el día, cuando llega lo hace en horas de la madrugada y en otras ocasiones tienen que comprarla por lo que el uso del servicio higiénico no es posible. Solicita un crédito para hacer una letrina en su casa de habitación y así minimizar un poco su problema de abastecimiento de agua para su casa..

loans.use: To build a latrine in her house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Carmen Maria lives in the neighborhood of Domitila Lugo in the capital of Nicaragua, Managua. She is single and has one child. With her work she supports both herself and her kid. She has been selling clothes in the street for the past two years; she feels that her customer base has been increasing and as such she has been expanding her inventory so that she can offer a wider variety of products. One of her biggest dreams is to be able to have a successful business with which she can obtain better earnings and that way have a more stable working capital. Mrs. Carmen is asking for a loan in order to make repairs in her house and that way have greater comfort in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Carmen Maria tiene su domicilio en el Barrio Domitila Lugo de nuestra capital, es soltera y tiene solamente un niño. Con su trabajo se mantiene ella y su pequeño niño. Se dedica al negocio de venta ambulante de ropa desde hace dos años, siente que su clientela ha ido creciendo cada vez más y por ello ha ido aumentando poco a poco sus inventarios para ofrecer más variedad en sus productos. Uno de sus grandes anhelos es tener un negocio próspero donde pueda obtener mejores utilidades y de esa manera manejar un capital de trabajo fijo.
