The loan will be used to buy instruments for physiotherapy and thus Patricia will be able to become independent and set up her own medical center. Her work, responsibility, and desire to improve have given her the opportunity to gain admittance to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Patricia es Fisioterapeuta y trabaja en un consultorio de lunes a viernes. Tiene una hija pequeña en edad escolar y esta separada de su esposo, es la única que genera ingresos en su familia. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago se su obligación. El crédito que solicita será utilizado para comprar instrumentos de Fisioterapia y así poder independizarse en su trabajo, y en el futuro instalar un consultorio. Su trabajo, responsabilidad y las ganas de superación le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito.

loans.use: Purchase instruments for physiotherapy to set up own medical center.

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es:
Fortunato is a chauffeur of the public transportation system “Inter” at the City of La Paz, El Alto. He owns a taxi and works a specific route, “trufi”. This activity provides his economic income which covers food and education. He lives in the Zone of Tembladerani in the City of La Paz. The loan will be spend on converting gasoline fuel to compressed vehicle gas and thus increase his income as the cost of gas is less than the cost of gasoline and with the transformation he will be able to save 50% of the cost of fuel. This is his first loan from Impro and he has been approved to receive the loan requested.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Fortunato es chofer de servicio público Inter – Ciudad La Paz - El Alto; es dueño de una movilidad que trabaja de trufi (ES UN TAXI QUE TIENE UNA RUTA FIJA). Esta actividad es su fuente de ingreso económico con el que cubre la alimentación y educación, vive en la Zona de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz. El crédito es requerido para la conversión de combustible de gasolina a gas comprimido vehicular, para poder incrementar sus ingresos, pues el costo de gas es mucho menor que el de la gasolina; con la transformación podrá ahorrar un 50% de costo en carburante. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado.

loans.use: Costs related to conversion of gasoline to compressed vehicle gas in order to reduce expenses.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe owns a small truck and he offers public service, transports construction material and freight in the town of El Alto and with the earnings he supports his son who is studying at the university as well as his wife. He lives in Zone “16 de Febrero, Río Seco” of the town of El Alto. The loan will be used to buy a small piece of land for his son so he can start building his home in the close future. This is the third loan from IMPRO and the punctual repayment of the other loans makes him a suitable client. Felipe has been a member of IMPRO since 2005.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Felipe tiene un pequeño camión que trabaja como servicio publico, trasporta material de construcción y cargas en la ciudad de El Alto, siendo esta actividad su fuente de ingreso con la que mantiene a su hijo que está estudiando en la universidad y a su esposa; vive en la Zona 16 de Febrero, Rió Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito que solicita es requerido para la compra un pequeño terreno que será destinado para que el hijo, en un futuro cercano pueda comenzar a construir su propia vivienda. Es el tercer crédito con Impro, su buen comportamiento de pago el permite acceder a otro préstamo. Felipe es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2005.

loans.use: Purchase of land to build home.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
.Orlando is a public service chauffeur “Inter – Ciudad La Paz El Alto”, he owns a vehicle and transports passengers, but the vehicle is not in perfect condition and the problems may intensify in the future. His wife works half-time as a domestic servant and she helps economically by covering the maintenance of their two children, 4 years and 9 months old. They do not own a house but rent in the Zona Pasankeri of the City of La Paz. The loan requested by Orlando will be used to buy a new motor to improve the performance of his vehicle (work tool). This is his first loan with Impro, and the evaluation made approves him for the loan requested.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Orlando es chofer de servicio publico Inter – Ciudad La Paz El Alto; tiene su movilidad con la cual trabaja como transporte de pasajeros y no se encuentra en perfecto estado y tiene problemas que pueden agudizarse en el futuro; la esposa trabaja medio tiempo de empleada domestica, y ayuda a los ingresos de la familia para cubrir la manutención de sus dos hijos de 4 años y 9 meses. No cuentan con casa propia y viven en alquiler en la Zona Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz. El crédito que ahora Orlando solicita es para comprar un nuevo motor que le ayudará a mejorar el rendimiento de su movilidad (herramienta de trabajo). Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitada por el prestatario.

loans.use: Purchase a new motor for a public transportation vehicle.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia lives in the street “6 de agosto” located in the western part of the city of La Paz. She lives with her two16 year-old sons, and a few months old baby girl. Her husband works in the interior of the country. At her home she runs a grocery store which is the main source of her income. The loan will be used to buy more merchandise for her business and thus increase the variety of products. It is her second loan from Impro, and the evaluation made qualifies her for the loan. She has been a client since 2007 and her history of payments is excellent.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Julia vive en la calle 6 de agosto ubicada en la ladera oeste de la ciudad de la La Paz. Vive junto a sus dos hijos de 16 años y una bebe de meses, su esposo trabaja en el interior del país. Tiene una tienda de abarrotes la cual se encuentra en su propio domicilio, y es su fuente principal de ingresos. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de más mercadería para su negocio y así poder ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes. Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo. Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2007 y su historial de pagos es excelente.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase stock  of a grocery store.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo lives in zone “14 de septiembre” in the city of La Paz. He owns a workshop located at the center of the city where he manufactures footwear for men and women. He lives with his son who is also dedicated to the same activity. The loan will be spent on buying material (leather, rubber studs, etc.) in order to continue manufacturing footwear as demand has been growing. This is the second loan with Impro, and the evaluation made qualifies him for the loan. The previous loan of $150 was repaid with no problems in four months.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Bernardo vive en la zona 14 de septiembre de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene un taller ubicado en una zona céntrica de la ciudad donde elabora calzados para damas y varones. Vive junto a su hijo el cual trabaja en la misma actividad. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de material (cuero, tacos de goma, etc.) para continuar elaborando calzados ya que es una actividad que tiene mucha demanda. Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo. El préstamo anterior fue de $us 150 y a solo cuatro meses de plazo y fue cancelado sin problemas.

loans.use: Purchase of raw material for the manufacturing of footwear for men and women.

loans.name: Hernando

texts.es:
Hernando lives on Cotaña St. in the Amor de Dios neighborhood in the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and their six children, aged 24, 22, 19, 17, 15, and 12 years old. He works as a bricklayer in the construction industry.

The credit from this loan will be used to purchase school supplies for his younger children, who need notebooks, colored pencils, crayons, etc. This is his fourth loan with Impro, and a credit evaluation qualifies him for its request. Hernando has been a customer of ours since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Hernando vive en la calle Cotaña de la zona Amor de Dios o ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposa y su 6 hijos de 24, 22, 19, 17, 15, 12 años respectivamente. Trabaja como constructor albañil. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de material de estudio para sus hijos pequeños ( necesitan cuadernos, lápices de colores,crayolas, etc.). Es el cuarto crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo. Hernando es cliente nuestro desde el año 2006.

loans.use: Purchase school supplies for his school-aged children.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is single and the mother of one child. She is twenty-four years old. She has been operating a hair salon, and selling artificial hair, purses, and blue jeans, for the past four years. Comfort sells her bags and jeans in the afternoon and operates the hair salon in mornings and evenings.

Comfort wants to use her loan to buy more hair products and clothing to sell. She is a member of the group called "Anointed." Members of the group exert peer pressure as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more hair creams, purses, and jeans.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar lives on 2nd st in the Villa Exaltación neighborhood in the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife, his seven-year-old child and his newborn. He uses his automobile in public transit. In this way he earns enough income to support his family.

The loan will be used to repair his vehicle, which needs new brakes, a motor adjustment, an oil change, and new belts. This is his first loan with Impro, and the evaluation performed qualifies him to request this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Edgar vive en la calle n. 2 de la zona Villa Exaltación ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 7 años y uno recién nacido, respectivamente. Trabaja con su automóvil como transporte publico. De esta manera obtiene los ingresos para mantener a su familia. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de repuestos para su movilidad (necesita nuevos frenos, ajuste de motor, cambio de aceites y correas. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Maintenance on his vehicle

loans.name: Saida

texts.es:
Enriqueta Rengifo de Vargas is a member of Banco Comunal "Las Victorias." She lives in the Juanjui district, San Martin region, Mariscal Caceres province. She rents out a place to run her grocery store, which is located in the La Punta neighborhood. She sells a variety of goods such as candies, carbonated drinks, and other food products for daily consumption. When her husband retired from working for a state institution, the couple decided to use the money that he received to start a small business. With the loan from Banco Comunal, the business grew. Today their business is well-stocked with a variety of products. With a loan in the amount of 1000.00 sols, which will be repaid in 6 months, she'll buy: different types and brands of packaged pasta, canned goods, sacks of sugar and rice, and bottles of cooking oil because these foodstuffs are much needed in the area. She will also stock her shelves with carbontaed drinks and candies. Enriqueta, 61, has 3 daughters. She is a persevering woman who fights for what she wants. She is a survivor because she overcame a serious disease and today serves as an example for her family who always stands by her side.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Enriqueta Rengifo de Vargas, es socia del Banco Comunal “ Las Victorias ” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui su negocio está ubicado en en un local especialmente alquilado para este propósito que se ubica en el Barrio La punta donde vende abarrotes en general, golosinas, bebidas gasificadas y otros productos comestibles de consumo diario. Al jubilarse su esposo que trabajaba en una institución del estado, con el dinero producto de su liquidación deciden poner un pequeño negocio, con el préstamo del Banco Comunal se incremento, hoy en día tienen un negocio bien surtido de variados productos. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 para pagar en 6 meses , comprará: fideos de distintas variedades y marcas en paquetes, conservas en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos en sacos, aceite en botellas de ha litros litro; debido a que estos alimentos son muy requeridos en la zona, además de surtir su estock de bebidas gasificadas y golosinas. Ella tiene 61 años de edad, 03 hijas, es una mujer perseverante y luchadora que dio ejemplo de vida al sobreponerse a una grave enfermedad y que hoy sirve de ejemplo para su familia que siempre se mantiene muy unida a ella. ,

loans.use: To buy large amounts of goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi is the owner and operator of a small pharmacy in the coastal town of Elmina.

Kofi started his business career by selling mobile phones. With the help of his first microloan, he was able to begin renting this shop. He now hopes to use this loan to expand his inventory and selection of drugs. In addition, he would like to begin saving some of his profits to build a home for himself. He has operated his shop for two years.

Kofi is a member of the "Trust God" lending group. The lending group uses a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure payment.

loans.use: To buy pharmaceutical drugs for his shop in Elmina

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
Moisé lives on Julio Arboleda street in the Villa Cooperative neighborhood in the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and their three children, a nine year old, a seven year old, and a baby.

He currently dedicates himself to recycling rubber by acquiring worn out shoes, separating the rubber soles, then cleaning them and selling them to a business that takes the soles and turns them into soles for new shoes.

The loan will be used for repairing his vehicle's motor; without it, he finds himself immobilized and must either pay or rent another vehicle to gather his materials.

This is his third credit with Impro, and a credit evaluation qualifies him to request this loan. Moisés has been a client of ours since 2005.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Moisés vive en la calle Julio Arboleda de la zona Villa Cooperativa ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a sus esposa y sus 3 hijos de 9, 7 y un bebe. Actualmente se dedica al reciclaje de goma, para ello adquiere zapatos que la gente ya no usa, separa las plantas de goma, realiza una limpieza de las mismas y las vende a una empresa la cual funde dichas plantas y fabrica plantas de zapatos nuevas. El crédito lo destinara en la reparación del motor para su movilidad, ya que por falta de repuestos se encuentra actualmente inmovilizado y tiene que pagar o contratar otra movilidad para recoger su materia prima. Es el tercer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo. Moisés es cliente nuestro desde el año 2005.

loans.use: Repair the motor on the vehicle he uses for his everyday work

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is a married man and the father of five children. He is fifty-seven years old. Two of his children are attending the university. Jimmy sells phone cards, polythene bags, washing soaps, etc.

Many people in his community use mobile phones, but they are not able to buy units (credit). Therefore, he wants to use his loan to buy credit transfer chips to enable him to sell credit in smaller and cheaper units to mobile phone users. He wants to use the profit from his increased business to support his children, who are currently in the university.

Jimmy is a member of the group called "Anointed." Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy phone cards and GSM units (credit) transfer chips.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina M. Shahuano is a member of Banco Comunal "Los Angeles." She lives in the Picota district, Picota province, San Martin region. She runs her grocery store from home which is located at Jr. San Martin No. 274. She also runs stand No. 35 in the "La Marginal" market. With a loan of 2000.00 sols, which will be repaid in 6 months, she'll buy staple products such as: sugar, bags of rice, boxes of soap for different uses, packages of toilet paper, and bottles of oil as these goods are much needed in the area. She also wants to stock her shelves with carbonated beverages and candies. Ernestina, 62, is married with three children who live on their own, but she does pay for the education of one granddaughter. She considers herself to be a responsible, hard-working woman with a great desire to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ernestina M. Shahuano, es socia del Banco Comunal “Los Ángeles” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia Picota y distrito de Picota su bodega está ubicado en su propia casa situado en el Jr: San Martín Nº 274, también tiene un puesto en el mercado “La Marginal” puesto 35 de la misma localidad tiene. Con el préstamo de S/. 2000.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprará productos de primera necesidad como: azúcar, arroz en sacos, jabón para diferentes usos en cajas, papel higiénico en paquetes, aceite en botellas de ha litros debido a que estos alimentos son muy requeridos en la zona, además de surtir su estock de bebidas gasificadas y golosinas. Tiene 62 años de edad, es casada con tres hijos independientes pero con una nieta a la cual esta apoyando en sus estudios, se considera una mujer responsable, trabajadora, sus deseos de salir adelante han hecho de ella una mujer de.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her grocery store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)
Correction due to overpayment for business 44502

loans.name: Orfelina

texts.es:
Orfelina M. P. es a member of Banco Comunal "Las Victorias." She lives in the San Martin department, in Mariscal Caceres province, Juanjui district. Her produce stand is located in the market "Pomarrosas" in Juanjui city. In this same market, she also has another stand where her husband sells braids, tassels, and other adornments. The idea behind these businesses comes from the need to help their children get ahead in life. Both are very grateful for the opportunity of receiving a loan that will allow them to continue to invest. With a loan of 2000.00 Sols, which will be paid in 6 months, they will invest in buying more fruits and vegetables that come from the region such as: oranges, lemons, bagged yucca, 2 bunches of bananas, plantains, avocado, around 100 lemons, boxes of papaya, among other produce, and for the adornment stand, they will buy thread, lace, elastic bands, ribbons of different colors and types, as well as plastic products that can be used at home. Orfelina is 59 years old, with 7 children who live on their own, and one who still lives with her and her husband. Her husband and child who lives at home help her with the business.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Orfelina M. P. es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Victorias” vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres distrito de Juanjui , su puesto es de ventas de frutas y verduras se ubica en el mercado “Pomarrosas” de al ciudad de Juanjui, además en este mismo mercado tiene otro puesto de ventas de pasamanería que es atendido por su esposo. La idea de estos negocios, surge ante la necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos, y ambos están muy agradecidos de tener la oportunidad de contar con un préstamo que les permita seguir invirtiendo. Con el préstamo de S/2000.00 que será pagado en 6 meses lo invertirá en la compra de más frutas y verduras propias de la región como: naranja, limones, yucas, en sacos, 02 racimos de plátanos y guineos en racimos paltas y limones en cientos, papaya en cajas y otros y para su negocio de pasamanería comprara hilos, blondas, elásticos, cintas en diferentes variedades y colores, además artículos de plástico para uso personal y del hogar. La señora Orfelina tiene 59 años, 07 hijos todos independientes, 1 que aun vive con ella que junto asu esposo le ayudan en el negocio.

loans.use: To buy more produce and merchandise for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)
Correction due to overpayment for business 44503

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is thirty-three years old and a mother of three children. Her two sons are in the senior high school. Beatrice operates a hair salon and also sells hair and body creams, artificial hair, soft drinks, etc. She wants to use her loan to buy more products to expand her operations.

She is a member of the group called “Ayeyi” (meaning Adoration). Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr:
Born around 1969 in Bopa in the Mono department of south western Benin, Mrs Béatrice D. is married to Paul Koubiya, a shopkeeper in the city of Cotonou, and is the mother of two children (Anna, aged 8 and in 3rd grade, and Stéphane, aged 5, in 1st grade). She lives in Gbedjewin, a busy neighborhood of Cotonou, where she runs a business selling meals. With a great deal of experience in this field, Mrs D.'s average revenue is 7,000 CFA francs per day. Her main customers are pupils who come in for meals during their breaks. Other customers, such as apprentices, local residents, etc., also come in for their meals. With a growing number of customers and insufficient financial means to satisfy them, she is requesting this loan in order to fulfill customer expectations and, in particular, to expand her area of activity by starting to sell a number of different products.Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer. 
Née vers les années 1969 à BOPA dans le département du MONO au sud-ouest du BENIN, dame D. Béatrice est mariée à KOUBIYA Paul commerçant dans la ville de COTONOU et mère de 2 enfants ( Anna 8 ans en classe de CE2 et Stéphane 5 ans en classe de CI ). Elle réside à GBEDJEWIN dans un quartier populaire de COTONOU où elle exerce son activité de vente de repas. Dotée d’une grande expérience dans le domaine, dame D. Béatrice réalise en moyenne un chiffre d’affaire de 7000 Francs CFA par jour. Ses principaux clients sont les élèves qui viennent prendre son repas aux heures de pause. D’autres clients tels que les apprentis, les riverains et autres viennent également prendre son repas. Le nombre de clients étant en progression et les moyens financiers manquant pour les satisfaire, elle sollicite ce prêt pour répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle et surtout pour élargir son champ d’activités en instaurant la vente des produits divers.

loans.use: To buy 4 boxes of soap, 2 bags of rice, 2 cans of oil and 1 bag of corn

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn A. is twenty-nine years old, married, and the mother of two children. She has been operating a beauty salon for the past ten years. An enterprising person, Evelyn has eight apprentices who are currently learning the hair business from her.

She wants to use her loan to buy more hair products, such as conditioner, perm gel, and lotions, to sustain her operation. She hopes to increase her savings to pay for her children’s education.

Evelyn is a member of the group called “Mpaebo Tiefo” (meaning Prayer Listening God). Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other in repaying the loan.

In the photo, Evelyn is seated in front of her apprentices.

loans.use: To buy more hair cream and other products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina is a forty-one-year-old married mother of four children, all of whom are in school. She has been operating a small roadside general store for six years.

She wants to use this loan to begin selling more produce and will start with onions. To purchase the onions, she will travel to Accra to get larger quantities at lower prices. To date, her store has not produced enough income to allow her to save. She hopes to begin saving with the increased sales from produce.

Augustina is a member of the "God is Alive" lending group. The lending group uses a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure payment.

loans.use: To travel to Accra and buy large bags of onions

loans.name: Virginie

texts.fr:
Born around 1966 in Ouidah in the Atlantique department, southern Benin, Mrs Virginie B. is married and the mother of four children. The children are cared for by both parents. She sells bags of coal at retail and wholesale. Having run this business for about 20 years, Mrs B. has a great deal of experience in the field. Working in a very competitive sector and lacking the means with which to meet demand, she is requesting this loan to expand her business activities as well as satisfy the ever-growing demand of her customers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers les années 1966 à OUIDAH dans le département de l'ATLANTIQUE au sud du BENIN, dame B. Virginie est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Les enfants sont à la charge des deux géniteurs. Elle est une revendeuse en détail comme en gros de sacs de charbon. Exerçant cette activité depuis une vingtaine d’années, dame B. Virginie est dotée d’une grande expérience dans ce domaine. Opérant dans un secteur concurrentiel et les moyens insuffisants pour répondre favorablement à la demande, elle sollicite ce prêt pour étendre son secteur d’activités et aussi pour satisfaire la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy 50 bags of coal

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is twenty-nine years old, divorced, and the mother of two children. Her children are currently in school. With her first loan from Sinapi, she has been able to sell cosmetics, such as body lotion, hair pomade, body powder, and varieties of deodorants, in her village market for the past six months.

Eunice wants to use this loan to buy more products, so that she can expand her business. She also plans to use some of her proceeds to register for National Health Insurance, so that she and the children will have access to free medical care.

She a member of the group called “Mpaebo Tiefo” (meaning Prayer Listening God). Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

In the photo, Evelyn is shown with the loan officer, Lawrence.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics for her shop

loans.name: Gehova Suple Group

texts.en:
Juan lives in San Perdro D. Macoris with his wife and three children (ages: 10, 8, 6). When he received his first loan from Esperanza about a year ago, he started a small business selling fried sandwiches on the roadsiD.. With this loan he is going to buy a small moped so that he can drive around selling his “Empanadas” to people walking or sitting along the busy streets. His dream for the future, however, is that he would have his own shop in town so that he could develop a regular clientele and a proper business. He said the most important part of his life is serving Jesus, and he hopes to raise his children in good health and with a love for God.

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you in advance for your support!

loans.use: To buy a moped to use for distribution

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Esperanza International, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is a thirty-four-year-old married mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She operates a small roadside store near the coastal town of Elmina.

Because she lives in a fishing community, she will use the proceeds of the loan to buy fish hooks to sell to the local fisherman. She also wants to start selling yams – a Ghanaian staple. In addition to adding inventory to her store, Aba hopes to use some of the loan to improve her store’s appearance and to replace some of the older wooden beams.

Aba is a member of the "God is Alive" lending group. The lending group uses a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure payment.

loans.use: To buy yams and fishhooks

loans.name: Chantal

texts.fr:
Born around 1976 in Adjohoun, in Africa's second richest valley situated in the south-east of Benin near its political capital, Mrs Chantal D. is married and the mother of three children. Mrs D. has been living in Avotrou, a shantytown in Cotonou, for over five years and sells sewing materials. She has worked in the sector for six years and has a great deal of experience. She is currently faced with an influx of customers whom she cannot satisfy. She is therefore requesting this loan in order to replenish her stock so that she can fulfill the expectations of her customers and in particular gain their loyalty.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née dans les années 1976 à ADJOHOUN dans la deuxième vallée la plus riche de l’AFRIQUE et située au sud-est du BENIN près de la capitale politique du BENIN, dame D. Chantal est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Installée à AVOTROU dans un bidonville de COTONOU depuis plus de 5 ans, dame D. Chantal est une revendeuse des produits de mercerie. Opérant depuis 6 ans dans ce secteur, elle est dotée d’une grande expérience. Actuellement elle est confrontée à une affluence des clients qui ne trouvent pas satisfaction. Elle sollicite alors ce crédit pour s’approvisionner afin de répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle et surtout gagner sa confiance.

loans.use: To buy 100 meters of lining, 10 boxes of sewing thread and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a thirty-five-year-old widowed mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She has been smoking fish for the last three years. After smoking the fish, she travels to Kumasi and Mankessim (large inland towns) to sell her fish.

Smoked fish is a popular accompaniment to Ghanaian staples, such as fufu, banku, and kenkey. She will use the proceeds of the loan to buy more fish and increase her sales as well as to help pay for transportation costs.

Comfort is a member of the "God is Alive" lending group. The lending group works as a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure payment.

loans.use: To buy ocean fish to smoke

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a sixty-four year old married mother of five children and twelve grandchildren. She has been baking bread and pastries for over thirty-three years.

She will use the proceeds of the loan to help increase her supply of many of her key ingredients – flour, margarine, and sugar. She will also buy firewood. She hopes to save more money from her increased sales to allow her to maintain her inventory at a consistent level between loan disbursements.

Mary is a member of the "God is alive" lending group. The lending group uses a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure payment.

loans.use: To buy flour, margarine, sugar, and firewood

loans.name: Noëlie

texts.fr:
Mrs Noëlie T. was born around 1961 in Savalou in the hills of Benin. Married and the mother of two children, she has lived in Yagbe, a Cotonou shantytown, for about 15 years. She sells a variety of cereals, such as corn, sorghum, millet, soya, etc, and has two stores that stock her very popular products. She is requesting this loan to replenish her inventory in order to fulfill the expectations of her customers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame T. Noëlie est née vers les années 1961 à SAVALOU dans les collines du BENIN. Mariée, elle est mère de 2 enfants et réside à YAGBE un bidonville de COTONOU depuis une quinzaine d’année. Elle est une revendeuse de diverses sortes de céréales tels que le maïs, le sorgho, le mil, le soja et autres et dispose de 2 magasins pour le stockage de ses produits qui sont actuellement recherchés .Elle sollicite ce prêt pour s’approvisionner afin de combler les attentes de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy 30 x 120 kg bags of corn

loans.name: La Alianza Group

texts.en:
Carmen is a busy woman, raising three children (ages: 16, 18, and 23) in the town of San Pedro D. Macoris. This will be her second loan with Esperanza, and with her first she started making money by driving people around on a moped that she bought. It operates like a taxi, and she makes about $1 per riD.. This loan will help with repairs, gas, and maybe another moped for her oldest child to start working with her. She said that her ambitions for the future are to continue pursuing growth for both herself and her children. Eventually she wants to buy an old car so that she can drive several people around at a time, and increase her profits.

Oh behalf of Esperanza, thank you for your support of this group! God Bless.

loans.use: For repairs and purchase of a moped

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is a forty-seven year old mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She designs and manufactures African cloth. She buys plain cloth and then designs floral and other arrangements in dye. These arrangements are then transfered to the cloth and dried. She has been in this business for three years.

After her cloth is ready for sale, she travels to Tema, Ghana’s largest harbor town, to sell the cloth. She will use the proceeds of the cloth to buy more plain cloth and dyes.

Alberta is a member of the "God is Alive" lending group. The lending group use a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure payment.

loans.use: To buy plain cloth and dyes

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is a married woman of forty-two years of age. She has six children. Yaa has been selling plastic containers for storing water and palm and palm kernel oils for the past eight years.

Yaa wants to use her loan to buy more containers for her customers so that they can gather and store more water during the rainy season.

She is a member of the group called "Abraham." Group members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

In the photo, Yaa is shown with Lawrence, the loan officer.

loans.use: To buy more plastic containers

loans.name: Olive

texts.fr: Born March 5, 1979 in the historic city of Abomey in Benin, Mrs Olive A. is married and has two children. She lives in Tanto and sells a variety of products, such as bags of rice, soap and tinned goods, in a small shop in Lokokoukoume, a neighborhoold of Cotonou. She also sells refill cards for the various cell phone networks that operate in Benin, including GSM-type networks. She is very popular and gets a large number of customers every day, which causes her inventory to become depleted very quickly. She is requesting this loan in order to replenish her stock.Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer. Née le 5 mars 1979 à ABOMEY dans la capitale historique du BENIN, dame A. Olive est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Résident à TANTO, elle est une revendeuse de produits divers tels que les sacs de riz, de savons, de boîtes de conserves et autres dans une boutique à LOKOKOUKOUME un quartier de COTONOU. Elle vend également les cartes de recharge des différents réseaux  de téléphonie mobile de type GSM installés au BENIN. Très appréciée, elle reçoit une multitude de clients par jour provoquant l’épuisement de son stock en très peu de temps. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour s’approvisionner.

loans.use: To buy 10 x 25kg bags of rice, 5 boxes of spaghetti and other common foodstuffs.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is a twenty-seven year old operator of a cloth design business. She purchases plain cloth from Accra, Ghana’s capital, and creates designs to place on the cloth. She uses dye to imprint the designs and then resells the completed product in Kumasi. She has been operating this business for five years.

In addition to purchasing more supplies for her business, she wants to begin saving to have her own store one day.

Eugenia is a member of the "Trust God" lending group. The lending group uses a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure payment.

loans.use: To buy dye, cloth, and other chemicals for her cloth design business

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is fifty-four years old and the mother of six children. She used to prepare pastries, but her business was not doing well, so she decided to sell cosmetics and second-hand clothes in her village.

Adwoa wants to use her loan to buy more second-hand clothes and cosmetics to sell.

She is a member of the group called “Adwen Da Ho” (meaning Well Thought Of). Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and used clothing.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is a married woman. She is thirty-nine years old and prepares and sells rice with vegetable sauce, banku, and rice balls in her village.

Vida says that prices of her products, like spices, vegetables, beans and rice, have increased, and she wants use her new loan to buy her products in larger quantities to avoid price hikes.

She is a member of the group called “Mpaebo Tiefo" (meaning Prayer Listening God). The group members exert peer pressure on themselves as social collateral to repay the loan.

In the photo, Vida is busy selling her food.

loans.use: To buy rice, maize, vegetables and spices

loans.name: Sabirathou

texts.fr:
Living in COTONOU for the past 5 years, Mrs. A. O. Sabirathou is originally from southern BENIN where she was born around 1968. She is married and a mother of 2 children of whom she takes care. She currently lives in AVOTROU, a popular district of COTONOU, with her husband and two children. She rents a shop not far from her home where she sells hardware and construction materials. Mrs. A. O. Sabirathou already received two successive loans and has managed them well. Currently, her stock is insufficient to satisfy her customers' needs. It is primarily for this reason that she requests this credit in order to satisfy her customers' needs and to be to provide them with new innovations and diversify her business.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Installée à COTONOU depuis plus de 5 ans, dame A. O. Sabirathou est originaire du sud du BENIN où elle est née vers les 1968. Mariée, elle est mère de 2 enfants dont elle a la charge. Actuellement, elle vit à AVOTROU un quartier populaire de COTONOU avec son époux et ses deux enfants. Non loin de sa résidence elle a loué une boutique où elle mène son activité de vente des articles de quincaillerie. Dame A. O. Sabirathou a reçu déjà deux prêts successifs et elle s’est toujours bien comporté. Actuellement son stock est insuffisant pour satisfaire sa clientèle. C’est essentiellement pour cette qu’elle sollicite ce crédit afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et d’être au rendez vous des nouvelles innovations dans le but de la diversification de son activité.

loans.use: Purchase of 10 packages of sheets, 100 kg regular nails, 100 kg galvanized nails and other building materials.

loans.name: Yabo Faouziath

texts.fr:
Born on June 7, 1972 in POBE in the PLATEAU area, Mrs. I. Yabo Faouziath is married and a mother of 2 children. She currently takes care of one of her children. 5 years ago, she settled in COTONOU where she has been selling various cosmetic products and hair strands. At the beginning, she sold her products from house to house and from district to disctrict. Today, she has her own shop where she sells her products. A very moral and honest woman, this is her second loan with this institution and she has shown to refund her loan in a timely manner.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Née le 07 juin 1972 à POBE dans la région du PLATEAU, dame I. Yabo Faouziath est mariée et mère de 2 enfants dont 1 à sa charge. Elle s'est installée depuis 05 ans à COTONOU où elle vend divers produits cosmétiques et mèches. Au départ elle exerçait son activité en passant de maison en maison et de quartier en quartier afin de distribuer ses produits. Aujourd’hui, elle dispose d’une boutique dans laquelle elle expose ses produits. D'une très bonne moralité, elle est à son deuxième prêt au niveau de l'institution et se montre très correcte dans ses remboursements.

loans.use: Purchase of 25 body lotions, of 20 packages of hair strands and other hair products

loans.name: Sabine

texts.fr:
Born on August 29, 1975 in PORTO NOVO in the economic capital of BENIN, Mrs. Z. Sabine is married and a mother of 3 children. A hairdresser by profession, she also sells cosmetic products and hair strands. She lives in SENADE, a shantytown suburb of COTONOU, where she runs a hair salon. Mrs. Z. is currently experiencing difficulties in the provisioning of her products which is why she is requesting this loan in order to satisfy her customers' needs and also to diversify her products by including fabrics, jewels and other. She is also getting involved in restoring used cars in a lot in SEME. This is the fifth loan she is requesting from Alidé.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Née le 29 août 1975 à PORTO NOVO dans la capitale économique du BENIN, dame Z. Sabine est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Coiffeuse de profession, elle exerce parallèlement à celle-ci la vente des produits cosmétiques et aussi de mèches. Résident à SENADE un bidonville de COTONOU où elle a également son salon, dame Z. Sabine éprouve actuellement des difficultés dans l’approvisionnement de ses produits ce qui l’amène à solliciter ce prêt pour satisfaire sa clientèle et aussi pour diversifier sa vente en développant la vente d'autres produits comme les tissus pagnes, les bijoux et autres. Elle s'essaie également à la restauration sur l'un des parcs de regroupements de véhicules d'occasions de SEME. Elle vient de solliciter son cinquième prêt au niveau de Alidé.

loans.use: Purchase of a drier, 30 packages of hair strands, 10 pots of gel and various hair products

loans.name: Pasadita 2 Group

texts.es:
Olga is 33 years of age and has been selling clothing in a small business space in her home for 4 years. At times, she goes out to sell her products in nearby communities. She buys her merchandise in La Mesilla, Guatemala. She supports her son with the profits earned from her business. She would like to invest the loan in purchasing merchandise and avoid the expense of having to travel to La Mesilla. The other members of the group are: Bertha H. A., who sells foodstuff from home (she was not able to come to the meeting because she is ill); Sulama H. N., Natividad G. G., and Ana Maria G. G., who sell cut-up chicken; and Ofelia G. V., who sells foodstuff.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

OLGA, TIENE 33 AÑOS DE EDAD, DESDE HACE 4 AÑOS SE DEDICA A VENDER ROPA EN UN PEQUEÑO LOCAL QUE TIENE EN CASA, EN OCASIONES SALE A OFRESER SU MERCANCIA A COMUNIDADES CERCANAS, SU MERCANCIA LA VA A COMPRAR A LA MESILLA EN GUATEMALA, CON LOS INGRESOS MANTIENE A SU HIJO, CON EL CREDITO QUIERE INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MERCANCIA Y EVITAR EL GASTO QUE GENERA VIAJAR A LA MESILLA. LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON: BERTHA H. A. VENDE ABARROTES EN SU CASA NO PUDO LLEGAR A LA REUNION POR QUE ESTA EMFERMA, SULAMA H. N., NATIVIDAD G. G., ANA MARIA G. G. VENDEN POLLO TROZADO Y OFELIA G. V. VENDE ABARROTES.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Bakte1 Group

texts.es:
Ms. Esperanza H. is a 35-year-old woman who would like to start a pig farming business from home. She hopes that with the profits generated from the business, she will be able to buy more pigs and build a large pigpen so that she can raise many piglets. She would also like to contribute to covering the family expenses because she has three children. She hopes to start her business with this loan. The other members of the group are: Rebeca M. G., who sells beverages; Leonides Pérez V., who raises and sells pigs; Edilia C. M., who sells clothing; and Matilde H. A., who raises and sells pigs, as well as foodstuff.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

DOÑA ESPERENZA TIENE 35 AÑOS DE EDAD, QUIERE COMENZAR SU NEGOCIO DE CRIANZA DE PUERCOS EN SU CASA, DECEA QUE CON LOS INGRESOS QUE LE GENERE ESTE NEGOCIO COMPRAR MAS PUERCOS Y CONSTRUIR UN CHIQUERO GRANDE PARA TENER MUCHOS PUERQUITOS , TAMBIEN DECEA APORTAR AL GASTO FAMILIAR YA QUE TIENE TRES HIJOS, CON EL CREDITO DECEA INICIAR SU NEGOCIO, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON REBECA M. GIRÓN VENDE REFRESCOS, LEONIDES PÉREZ V. VENDE Y CRIA PUERCOS, EDILIA C. M. VENDE ROPA Y MATILDE H. A. CRIA Y VENDE PUERCOS Y VENDE ABARROTES.

loans.use: Purchase pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Rayo De Luz Group

texts.en:
Minerva lives in San Pedro de Macoris with her three children (ages: 10, 9, and 4). She runs a small grocery store, which supplies basic foods and drinks for her community. With this loan she wants to buy more merchandise in order to increase her clientele. She thinks that if she has a larger stock with more variety she will attract new customers. Rice, beans, milk, and sugar are her most popular items. In the future she hopes to have a large business and a proper home for herself and her family.

We are excited to see what Minerva and the rest of her group will do with their loans. On behalf of everyone, Esperanza would like to thank you for your support! God Bless.

loans.use: For rice, beans, candy, sugar, and bread

loans.name: Bakte 3 Group

texts.es:
Blanca Celi is a 24-year-old mother who is raising a son on her own. She would like to start a poultry farming business from home so that she will not neglect her son. With this loan, she would like to purchase hens and roosters so that she can breed them in her yard. She would also like to buy chicken feed and the vaccinations necessary for breeding. The other members of the group are: Dora H. H., and Candelaria H. A., who sell groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

BLANCA CELI TIENE 24 AÑOS DE EDAD, TIENE UN HIJO AL QUE MANTIENE ELLA SOLA, QUIERE INICIAR EL NEGOCIO DE CRIANZA DE POLLO EN SU CASA Y ASI NO DESCUIDAR A SU HIJO CON EL CREDITO DECEA INVERTIR EN COMPRAR GALLINAS Y GALLOS PARA PODER REPRODUCIRLOS EN EL PATIO DE SU CASA, ASI COMO ALIMENTOS Y VACUNAS NECESARIAS PARA QUE SE CRIEN, LAS OTRAS INTEGRAANTES DEL GRUPO SON. DORA H. H. Y CANDELARIA H. A., LAS CUALES VENDEN ABARROTES.

loans.use: Purchase chickens and new scale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Alternativa Solidaria Chiapas (AlSol) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Quetzal 1 Group

texts.es:
Veronica del Rocio is 23 years of age. She has been selling cosmetics for a living for 8 years. She was only able to attend primary school because her parents asked her to help cover the household expenses due to the lack of financial resources. She would like to purchase more cosmetics catalogues and merchandise with this loan, so that she can sell her products to everybody in town. The other members of the group are: Cristina S. V., who raises and sells pigs; Martha V. G., who sells clothing; and Candelaria G., who sells groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

VERONICA DEL ROCIO TINEN 23 AÑOS DE EDAD, DESDE HACE 8 AÑOS SE DEDICA A VENDER COSMETICOS DE CASA EN CASA, UNICAMENTE PUDO ESTUDIAR LA PRIMARIA YA QUE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS SUS PADRES LE PIDIERON APORTARA DINERO A LA CASA, CON LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS ELLA AYUDA AL GASTO FAMILIAR, CON EL CREDITO DECEA COMPRAR MAS FOLLETOS DE COSMENTICO Y COMPRAR MUCHA MERCANCIA PARA OFRESER A TODA LA GENTE DEL PUEBLO, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON. CRISTINA S. V. CRIA PUERCOS PARA VENDERLOS, MARTHA V. G. VENDE ROPA Y CANDELARIA G. G. VENDE ABARROTES.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of cosmetics

loans.name: Quetzal 2 Group

texts.es:
Flor de Maria is a 43-year-old woman who has been cut-up chicken from home for over a year. With the profits generated from this business, she supports her 4 children. She would like to purchase a new scale and more chickens with this loan, thus increasing her profits and allowing her to provide for her household. The other members of the group are: Gloria A. D. and Virginia G. L., who raise and sell pigs; and Ana Isabel S. R..

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

FLOR DE MARIA DE 43 AÑOS DE EDAD VENDE DESDE HACE MAS DE UN AÑO POLLO TROZADO CON DICHAS GANANCIAS MANTIENE A SUS 4 HIJOS, CON EL CREDITO DECEA COMPRAR UNA PESA NUEVA Y MAS POLLOS Y OPTENER MAS GANACIAS PARA PODER PROVEER MAS COSAS EN SU HOGAR, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON GLORIA A. D. Y VIRGINIAG. L. SE DEDICAN ALA CRIANZA DE PUERCOS Y ANA ISABEL S. R..

loans.use: Purchase of a new scale and chickens

loans.name: Maria Teresa Alberti

texts.es:
Maria Teresa M. is a widower with one son. She makes skirts, blouses, shirts, pants, curtains, etc. This is her source of income that allows her, along with her 3 sisters, get ahead in life. She has been working as a seamstress and tailor for 15 years now. Currently, she owns 4 electric sewing machines, and two of her sisters help her make the clothes. She runs her workshop from home and searches for new customers in town. Right now she makes physical education sportswear for two schools. She goes out personally to look for customers so as to create more business for herself.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Teresa M., viuda, con un hijo; se dedica a los tejidos; hace faldas, blusas, camisas, pantalones, cortinas etc., Es una fuente de ingresos que ella tiene de la cual le sirve para salir avante junto a sus 3 hermanas. Lleva 15 años trabajando como costurera y sastre, actualmente cuenta con 4 maquinas eléctricas y las dos hermanas de ella le ayudan en el trabajo de tejidos y otros. Tiene su taller en su casa, y desde allí, ella sale a buscar clientes a quien le puede trabajar; actualmente tiene dos colegios de los cuales les hace los uniformes de educación física, así mismo sale a buscar clientes en forma directa para poder tener una mayor producción de prendas.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy more material with which to make clothing items.

loans.name: Ana Edelma

texts.es:
Ana Edelma G. R. is an energetic, creative businesswoman. In order to help her husband raise their two children, she runs a curiosity shop out of her home. To increase her revenue, she goes door-to-door selling cleaning products to customers and friends. This way she can earn more and improve her quality of life. As she herself says: "these days everything is more expensive, and you have to work hard to be successful." She is a leader in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana Edelma González R. es una mujer empresaria muy dinámica y creativa, para poder ayudar a su esposo en la educación de sus 2 hijos, cuenta con un negocio de venta de curiosidades, el cual esta en su casa. Para incrementar sus ingresos, ella esta vendiendo de manera ambulante con sus clientes y amigos productos de limpieza y de esa forma poder mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, ya que como Ella misma lo dice: “en estos días todo esta mas caro, y es necesario esforzarse mas para tener éxito”. Ella es una mujer líder dentro de su comunidad.

loans.use: To buy more goods at a better price

loans.name: María

texts.es:
In addition to farming and ranching, Doña María works patiently and successfully embroidering various garments to the specifications of her demanding clientele. Through the years, she has specialized in this work and, due to her good taste and excellent craftsmanship, she has become the most popular woman in her community. She is very eager to establish her own home embroidery workshop employing other female embroiderers like her and contribute to improving the quality of life for many mothers in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Doña María, además de dedicarse a la labor agrícola y ganadera se desempeña con mucha paciencia y éxito bordando diversas prendas a gusto y solicitud de sus exigentes clientes. A través de los años se ha especializado y a razón de su buen gusto y excelentes acabados se ha convertido en la dama más popular de su comunidad.Está muy deseosa de constituir su propio taller de bordados en casa a fin de emplear a mujeres trabajadoras como ella y contribuir con el mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de muchas madres de su comunidad.

loans.use: To acquire greater quantity of fabrics and start an embroidery workshop.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44534

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa works with great care and patience in her home and happily embroiders multicolored flowers on the costumes that the beautiful ladies wear in her city’s festivals. Her tasteful and superb finishes of each outfit have increased her list of customers and her list orders from now until a few months before the beginning of the city’s festival month. Her work has very important applications and for that reason she is seeking a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Elisa, trabaja con mucho esmero y paciencia en un espacio D. su hogar y con muy buen gusto va bordando flores multicolores a los trajes que lucirán las bellas damas D. su ciudad en las fiestas costumbristas.Su buen gusto y los excelentes acabados D. cada uno D. sus trajes han acrecentado su lista D. clientes y pedidos, desD. ahora y a pocos meses D. iniciarse el mes D. festejos en su ciudad tiene solicitudes muy importantes y esa razón atienD. su solicitud D. un préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity of fabric and thread to continue her work and fulfill each one of her client's requests.

loans.name: Manfred

texts.es:
From early childhood, MANFRED demonstrated abilities and attitudes conducive to dancing the typical dances of his community and belonged to a company of dancers every year. After many years, he decided to organize his own company called "America Dances" and served as a teacher and director. The company is welcomed by the youth of the city and the various colleges that request their services. In addition to utilizing his talent, this optimistic and hardworking young man makes the costumes for his artistic ballets; work that so far provides significant income and opportunities to improve his quality of life, but come with certain limitations due to the large capital investment required for this business.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

MANFRED, desde muy niño desarrolló habilidades y actitudes favorables para bailar las danzas típicas de su comunidad y año a año perteneció a un elenco de baile y después de muchos años decidió organizar su propio elenco y desempeñarse como maestro y director llamado “América Danzas”, el cual tiene mucha acogida por los jóvenes de la ciudad y los diversos colegios que solicitan sus servicios.Este joven optimista y trabajador además de explotar su talento, confecciona los trajes para la presentación de su ballet artístico; trabajo que hasta el momento le da grandes ingresos económicos y posibilidades de mejorar su calidad de vida. Pero sin duda con ciertas limitaciones debido al gran capital de inversión que requiere para este negocio.

loans.use: To improve the dance instruction space and acquire a greater quantity of fabrics.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
JULIA is widow. Since losing the great help of her husband, she devoted herself to many activities and now occupies a space in the market area of her city, where she offers hygiene services to all the residents of her community. Thanks to the cleanliness and maintenance of this space, she has been welcomed and has decided to improve the space and make it more accommodating to the customers who visit daily.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

JULIA, es viuda y desD. que perdió a su ayuda idónea se dedicó a muchas actividades y ahora se desempeña diariamente en un espacio del mercado D. su ciudad ofreciendo el servicio D. sus instalaciones a todos los pobladores D. su comunidad.Gracias a L. limpieza y buen trato D. este espacio tiene muy buena acogida y ha decidido mejorar los ambientes D. este espacio con el propósito D. otorgar mayor comodidad a los clientes que L. visitan a diario.

loans.use: To improve the small space used to offer hygiene services

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 44537

loans.name: Vidalina

texts.es:
VIDALINA is an enterprising woman who is grows flowers inside her home, cares much for their growth and development, and, when these beautiful flowers sprout, sells them at fairs and to her friends. She is also involved in animal husbandry. Now that her son has decided to study in another city, her ability to work and her hopes for improvement have increased. For this reason, she is seeking a loan in order to acquire more seeds and animals to increase her income and contribute to the wishes of her beloved son.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

VIDALINA, es un a mujer emprendedora que se dedica al cultivo de flores dentro de su hogar, cuida mucho su crecimiento y desarrollo para cuando estas broten le otorguen bellas flores a fin de venderlas en las ferias y a sus amistades. También se dedica a la crianza de animales. Ahora que su hijo a decidido estudiar en otra ciudad de su país su capacidad de trabajo y deseos de mejora se han maximizado por esa razón solicita un préstamo a fin de adquirir mayor cantidad de semillas y animalitos a fin de incrementar sus ingresos y colaborar con los deseos de su amado hijo.

loans.use: To acquire more seeds for flower cultivation and more animals for her animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
MARTHA is a selfless mother who recognized the needs of her beloved children and decided to sell beauty and cleaning products on the streets of her city. For a long time, things had been going well for her, but due to recent flooding of the river that runs through her city and the resulting tragedy the affected many homes like hers, she has suffered many difficulties. She still wants to continue and is seeking a loan to restart her business soon and rebuild the atmosphere of calm and security that prevailed in her home a few months ago.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

MARTHA, es una abnegada madre de familia que al observar las necesidades de sus amados hijos decidió desenvolverse como vendedora de productos de belleza y de limpieza por las calles de su ciudad.Las cosas durante mucho tiempo han ido marchando bien sin embargo el desborde del caudaloso río que atraviesa su ciudad la han sumido en múltiples dificultades debido a la tragedia que ocasionó en muchos hogares como el suyo. Aún tiene deseos de continuar y solicita el préstamo para repotenciar su actividad dentro de poco y volver a construir el ambiente de calma y seguridad que reinaba en su hogar hace pocos meses.

loans.use: To restart her sales of beauty and cleaning products.

loans.name: Ángel

texts.es:
Ángel is a self-sacrificing and hard-working single father. He has worked from his home, in his small carpentry workshop, with the same dedication and love that he has always given to his beloved children. His children have now become his main business partners; they hope to turn their small workshop into the best in the city. They currently do various jobs in their workshop and they also do work in individual’s homes, with the help of costly and numerous tools. They would like to obtain a loan so as to replace their most deteriorated tools.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

ÁNGEL, es un abnegado y trabajador padre soltero, se ha desempeñado dentro de su hogar en su pequeño taller de carpintería con la misma dedicación y amor que les otorgaba a sus queridos hijos, ahora éstos se han convertido en sus principales socios y tienen el deseo de convertir su pequeño taller en el mejor de su ciudad, actualmente prestan diversos servicios en este espacio y a domicilio con la ayuda de costosas e innumerables herramientas.Desean obtener un préstamo para poner en marcha su anhelado proyecto y para renovar sus útiles más deteriorados.

loans.use: An injection of capital for the replacement of tools, with the goal of making their small workshop into the best in the city.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin is a young father who, thanks to his effort and dedication to his work as a farmer, has oponed a small grocery store in his home. He works in the store every morning while his wife makes the necessary food. He later goes to work in his fields. He has many business plans and, thanks to the fact that this store is the only one in his community, he has the possibility of making his business into one that is profitable and useful to the residents of his town. He is requesting a loan with which he will increase his merchandise and provide his customers with a diversity of products.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

EDWIN, joven padre de familia que gracias al esfuerzo y dedicación en sus labores como agricultor ha instalado en su hogar una pequeña bodega en el que se desenvuelve todas las mañanas mientras su esposa prepara los alimentos necesarios, para luego trasladarse a sus terrenos de cultivo. Sin duda tiene muchos planes de negocio y gracias a que esta bodeguita es la única en su comunidad tiene la posibilidad de hacer de su negocio uno rentable y favorable para los pobladores. Con este fin solicita un préstamo con el que incrementará su mercadería y dará a sus clientes diversos productos.

loans.use: Injection of capital so that he can buy a larger number of products for his small grocery store

loans.name: Monica Maribel

texts.es:
Monica Maribel R. V. belongs to Banco Comunal "Los Eucaliptos." She lives in the Tarapoto district, in the San Martin region and province. Her home is located at Jr. Lencio Prado No. 1073. She works selling beauty products from home where she also displays the products she has in stock. The opportunity to receive a loan with the Banco Comunal allows her to take advantage of marketing offers so as to stock those products that are in great demand. She's content running this business because she's sure that she sells quality products. With a loan of 500.00 Sols, which will be repaid in 4 months, she'll buy a showcase to display the products that she sells. Monica is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and youngest daughter. Her husband works with her helping with home delivery of the products.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Mónica Maribel Reátegui Vásquez pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Lencio Prado Nº 1073 , ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, en su mismo domicilio muestra sus productos en stock. La oportunidad de un préstamo en el Banco Comunal le permite aprovechar las campañas que traen ofertas para tener en stock productos que tienen bastante demanda, le agrada desarrollar este negocio porque está segura que es un buen rubro. Con el crédito por S/. 500.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará una vitrina más para mostrar los productos que vende. La señora Mónica tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y su menor hija,su esposo la ayuda en la entrega de los productos a domicilio y trabajan coordinadamente.

loans.use: To buy a glass showcase to display her products

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo produces several varieties of potatoes. Through his land, he has been able to make this work one of his biggest productive investments. He learned how to do this work when he was a child from his parents, who were farmers. They taught him to plant and care for the land. This occupation has helped him to maintain his family and give his children an education and security. However, he needs support to achieve a good harvest this season.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

DON HUGO, se dedica a la producción de diversas variedades de papas, gracias a sus terrenos de cultivos ha podido hacer de esta labor una de sus más grandes inversiones productivas. El desde muy niño aprendió a realizar esta labor con la ayuda de sus padres quienes fueron agricultores y le enseñaron a sembrar y a cuidar los terrenos. Esta actividad hasta hoy le ha ayudado a mantener su hogar y brindarles a sus hijos educación y seguridad.Sin embargo requiere de apoyo para obtener una buena cosecha en esta temporada

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his potato crops

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa Victoria V. U. belongs to the "Eucalyptus Communal Bank". She lives in the San Martin Region, San Martin Province, Tarapoto District. She resides at the Mz F Lt 2 San Jose Street in the Tarapotillo sector, where her general store is also located

The opportunity of a loan with the communal bank has allowed her to develop her business and be with her children, reason why she left a dependable job. She is thankful to the communal bank because she was able to expand her business and satisfy the needs of her family.

With the 500.00 soles (Peruvia currency), which will be paid back in 4 months, Mrs. V. will buy sacks of rice, sugar and other groceries according to her customers' needs and orders.

Mrs. Rosa Victoria is 48 years old, lives with her husband and 3 children, she loves her business and makes her husband and her children participate and provide customer service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Rosa Victoria V. U. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos” vive en la Región San Martín ,Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, su domicilio está ubicado en Calle San José Mz F Lt 2 en el sector Tarapotillo, donde también se ubica su negocio de venta de abarrotes – bodega. La oportunidad de un préstamo en el Banco Comunal le permite desarrollar este negocio y poder estar junto a sus hijos, motivo por el cual dejó un trabajo dependiente y agradece al Banco Comunal porque pudo ampliar su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de su familia. Con el crédito por S/. 500.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: sacos de arroz, azúcar, y algunos otros abarrotes más, de acuerdo a los pedidos de los clientes. La señora Rosa Victoria tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, le encanta el negocio y hacer participar a su esposo e hijos en la atención a los clientes.

loans.use: Buying more merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Mrs. Yolanda L. F. belongs to the "Eucalyptus Communal Bank". She lives in the San Martin Region, San Martin Provence, Tarapoto District. She resides in Jr. Progreso #172, where her grocery store is also located. The communal bank loans have allowed her to start and grow her business. She is planning to increase her business with school supplies and groceries that she lacked to cover the needs of her customers. With the 500.00 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, which she will pay back in 4 months, Mrs. L. will buy: sack of rice and sugar, toilet paper, soft drinks and othe products to supply. She is 48 years old, lives with her husband and 3 children who help her with customer service and house chores. That way she has time for her personal things.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Yolanda L. F. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Progreso Nº 172, donde también se ubica su negocio de venta de abarrotes – bodega. Los préstamos del Banco Comunal le han permitido implementar su negocio y seguir creciendo, tiene planificado incrementar su negocio con pasamanería y útiles escolares y abarrotes que le faltan para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. Con el crédito por S/. 500.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: sacos de arroz, azúcar, papel higiénico, gaseosas y otros productos para surtir. La señora Yolanda tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, quienes le ayudan en la atención al cliente y en los quehaceres del hogar, por lo que ella tiene tiempo también para hacer sus cosas personales.

loans.use: Buying more merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Luce

texts.es:
Luce is a self-sacrificing mother who raises livestock animals in order to meet the needs of her home and her young children. She travels frequently to the city of Huancayo, to the agricultural markets to sell and buy young animals. Thanks to her constant effort in the home, things are going very well. She wishes to increase her working capital for the purpose of elevating her beloved family’s standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Luce es una abnegada madre de familia que se dedica a la crianza de animales para sostener satisfactoriamente las necesidades de su hogar y a sus pequeños niños. Continuamente viaja a la ciudad de Huancayo a las ferias agropecuarias específicamente para ofertar y adquirir pequeños animalitos, gracias a su constante esfuerzo dentro de su hogar las cosas marchan muy bien. Tiene deseos de incrementar su capital de trabajo con el propósito de elevar también la calidad de vida de su amada familia que está en continuo progreso.

loans.use: To increase her working capital so that she can raise a larger number of livestock animals

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mrs. Mariela S. G. belongs to the group Mientras Tanto "La Union Hace la Fuerza", lives in the San Martin Region, Lamas Province, Tabalosos District and San Miguel Del Rio Mayo Village. She resides at the Jr. Moyabamba S/N where her grocery store is also located.

The opportunity of a loan in Manuela Ramos will allow her to increase her business because she is also selling clothes according to the orders placed by her customers. With the 1,000.00 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy groceries and gently used clothes which she will sell at a fair price.

Mrs. S. is 53 years old, has 4 children but only one depends on her. At her business, she doesn't count with the support of anyone else but herself. She has always move forward by her own effort and has been able to do the same for her children

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Mariela S. García pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “La Unión Hace la Fuerza” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de Lamas, distrito de Tabalosos y Centro Poblado San Miguel del Río Mayo, su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Moyabamba S/N donde también se ubica su bodega, negocio al que se indica. La oportunidad de un préstamo en Manuela Ramos le permite incrementar su negocio puesto que ahora también vende ropas de acuerdo a los pedidos de los moradores de este lugar. Con el crédito por S/. 1,000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: abarrotes y ropa usada que vende a un precio cómodo. La señora Mariela tiene 53 años, tiene 4 hijos pero solamente uno depende de ella, en su negocio no tiene el apoyo de nadie más, ha salido adelante siempre sola, gracias a su esfuerzo pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos .

loans.use: She will buy products for her grocery store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Elvia Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Elvia Rosa R. L. belongs to the group Mientras Tanto "La Union hace la Fuerza" lives in the San Martin Region, San Martin Province, Tarapoto District. She resides in the Jr. Amorarca #228 where her grocery store business is also located.

The opportunity of a loan with Manuela Ramos has allowed her to open this business that she has always planned. She is also dedicated to rent rooms at her dwelling. With the 1,000 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, which she will pay back in 6 months, she will buy general groceries like: sacks of rice and sugar, boxes of milk and others, also some furniture since the one she has now belonged to a previous business.

She is 42 years old, has 4 children, lives with her husband and 2 of the children still depend on her. She has her family's support in developing her business and servicing her customers

Translated from Spanish by Maria R.-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Elvia Rosa Ramírez León pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “La Unión hace la Fuerza” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Amorarca Nº 228 donde también esta ubicado su negocio de venta de abarrotes – bodega. La oportunidad de un préstamo en Manuela Ramos le ha permitido aperturar este negocio, que siempre lo tenía planificado, también se dedica a alquilar cuartos en su mismo domicilio. Con el crédito por S/. 1,000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: abarrotes en general como: arroz, azúcar, en sacos leche en cajas y otros, ya que los muebles tenía de un negocio anterior. La señora Elvia tiene 42 años, tiene 4 hijos y vive con su esposo y 2 de sus hijos que dependen de ella, tiene el apoyo de su familia en el desarrollo de su negocio en cuanto a la limpieza y atención a los clientes.

loans.use: She will buy more merchandise for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris has been selling clothing for a long time. She offers her products in different areas of her town, and in the smaller towns nearby. Doris is a strong woman with many goals. She now wants to add to her business by selling shoes. She is 57 years old and is the mother of 7 children, who are now all grown and live with their own families. She and her husband, Octavio, live alone. She is requesting a loan for the purpose of achieving her goal. Let’s help Doris attain her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Doris se dedica a la venta D. ropas desD. hace mucho tiempo, sus productos los oferta por los diferentes lugares D. su zona, y a los caseríos aledaños a su ciudad. Doris es una mujer fuerte y con muchos objetivos, pues ahora quiere complementar su negocio con la venta D. zapatos. Ella a sus 57 años D. edad es madre D. 07 hijos los mismos que ya son independientes y viven fuera del seno familiar con sus respectivas familias, gozando actualmente solo D. la compañía D. su amado esposo, Octavio, para lograr su propósito solicita un préstamo. Apoyemos a la señora Doris a lograr su meta.

loans.use: An injection of capital so that she can begin to offer shoes, athletic clothing, and other clothing.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44549

loans.name: Miria

texts.es:
Selling shoes is the main occupation of Miria, who at 33 is a single mother of three young children. They are her motivation for trying to get ahead. She works very hard to be able to give her children all the necessities so that they can become successful professionals. She has decided to rent a small space where she can offer her beautiful shoes on a consistent basis and thereby keep her customers. To do this, she needs capital in the short run. Let’s help this mother in her fight to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de zapatos es la principal actividad de Miria, quien a sus 33 es madre soltera de tres pequeños niños, los mismos que le incentivan a seguir adelante, ella trabaja arduamente para brindarle a sus hijos lo necesario a fin de que se desenvuelvan y conviertan en profesionales de éxito. Ha decidido alquilar un pequeño espacio para ofertar sus bellos zapatos de manera constante y así acoger a sus clientes con comodidad y para lograr este propósito requiere de un capital a la brevedad. Apoyemos a esta madre que lucha por salir adelante.

loans.use: Injection of capital so that she can rent a permanent place for her sales

loans.name: Chery

texts.es:
Business Description and Loan Use

Chery is the owner of a small motorized vehicle used for urban transport services and additionally for the sale of local foods in the city's central working areas. Her total dedication to working for her beloved family has given her much satisfaction. Her desire to continue working to benefit her household has led her to seek a loan for the purpose of repairing her vehicle and also for purchasing ingredients to continue preparing her delicious juanes, a regional specialty.

Personal Information

Chery is 24 years old and mother of a two-year-old named José, who is the source of her inspiration and daily motivation.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio y Uso del Préstamo

La Señora Chery posee una pequeña moto para realizar servicios de transporte urbano y adicionalmente oferta el plato típico de su ciudad por los lugares céntricos de labor diaria. Su total entrega al trabajo a su amada familia le ha otorgado hasta el momento muchas satisfacciones y su deseo de continuar con su labor en beneficio de su hogar la conducen a solicitar un préstamo para reparar su vehículo e invertir una parte también en la compra de ingredientes al por mayor para seguir preparando sus deliciosos juanes.

Información Personal

Chery de 24 años de edad, es madre de 01 hijo de 02 añitos de edad de nombre José, quien es su inspiración y motivo de esfuerzo diario.

loans.use: Repair of work equipment and purchase of ingredients

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
From a very young age Deysi has had the innate ability to sell any manner of products, but with a special preference for the sale of articles of clothing. This inspiration has influenced her actual career path. She has two children and thanks to her ability to sell all types of clothing, she has obtained excellent financial returns for the benefit of her family. She would like to establish a sales room in an appropriate, new location so that the general population can visit her and purchase her products at this location.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson Kiva volunteer.

Desde muy joven Deysi, ha tenido una habilidad innata para vender todo tipo de artículos sin embargo una predilección especial por las pendas de vestir, a su inspiración y decisión atiende su desarrollo laboral actual.
