Tiene dos hijos y gracias a su habilidad para ofertar toda clase de prendas obtiene excelentes sumas de dinero para beneficio de su familia; desea implementar su espacio de ventas y convertirlo en un punto apropiado y novedoso para que la población en general la visite y adquiera sus prendas desde este espacio.

loans.use: Establishment and remodeling of work area

loans.name: Eufemia Nicolasa

texts.es:
Mrs. Eufemia is 55 years old and lives in Hialia. She works in her home supporting her husband, who works in construction, a trade he learned at a young age and currently practices. She also has some land on which she grows yuca, a starchy root, as well as wheat and corn which she sells in the market as extra income for her household.

Her four children are adults and live independently from them. She is requesting this loan to begin construction on a room for one of her grandchildren, as his parents live in Costa Rica. The little one is growing up, and his grandparents want to lovingly provide him with more comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Eufemia tiene 55 años, habita en Hialia trabaja en su casa de habitacion apoyando a su marido quien se dedica a la construcción, profesión que aprendio a temprana edad y que la ejerce de forma empiríca, tambien tiene un terreno que trabaja sembrando yuca,trigo y maíz lo cual venden en el mercado y es un ingreso extra para su hogar. Sus 4 hijos son mayores de edad e independientes a ellos. Solicita el crédito para iniciar la cosntrucción de un cuarto para uno de sus nietos, en vista que los padres viven en Costa Rica. El pequeño esta creciendo y sus abuelos con amor quieren brindarle mejor comodidad.

loans.use: Build a bedroom for her grandson

loans.name: Lili

texts.es:
Mrs. Lili C. D. V. belongs to the group Mientras Tanto "La Union Hace la Fuerza" lives in the San Martin Region, San Martin Province, Tarapoto district. She resides in the Jr. Manco Inca #234 and her business is located outsiD. D. main doors of the Central Cementery of this city. She is dedicated to sell drinks and beverages. The opportunity of a loan in Manuela Ramos will allow her to offer a greater quantity and more varieties of drinks and beverages, improve her stand, and also will allow her to finish the construction of her house since the preparation of her products doesn't need too much capital.

Her children help in the business as well as preparing the products and with customer service. With the 1,000 soles (Peruvian currency) loan that she will pay back in 6 months, Mrs. C. will buy a new, bigger umbrella, new pails and also some construction materials. She is 56 years aold, lives with her 3 sons, who help her in the business. Her children are her greatest strength to keep going. Her wish is to see them as professionals with careers.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Lili Córdova D. V. pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “La Unión Hace la Fuerza” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia D. San Martín, distrito D. Tarapoto, su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Manco Inca Nº 234 ,su negocio esta ubicado en las afueras D. la puerta principal del Cementerio Central D. esta ciudad, se dedica a la venta D. refrescos. La oportunidad D. un préstamo en Manuela Ramos le permite ofrecer en mayor cantidad y más variedad D. refrescos, mejorar su puesto D. venta, además le está permitiendo terminar la construcción D. su casa ya que para la preparación D. su producto no necesita más inversión. En el negocio la ayudan sus hijos tanto en la preparación como en la atención al cliente. Con el crédito por S/. 1,000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará una nueva sombrilla, baldes nuevos y además algunos materiales D. construcción. La señora Lili tiene 56 años, vive con sus 3 hijos, quienes la ayudan en el negocio , sus hijos son su mayor fuerza para salir adelante, su deseo es verlos profesionales.

loans.use: Buying a big umbrella, pails and other things for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
Magaly works daily in a small sales space from which she offers excellent fruits from all parts of the country. Given that she is the only person to offer this wide variety of products, she encounters a demanding range of clients and has decided to make improvements to her workspace with the goal of improving the quality of her service and her product display.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson Kiva volunteer.

La señora Magaly, se desempeña a diario en un pequeño espacio de ventas en el que oferta día a día excelentes frutas de todas partes de su país, debido a que es la única persona que ofrece estos productos y con gran variedad cuenta con una exigente gama de clientes y ha decidido mejorar las instalaciones de su espacio de desempeño diario a fin de mejorar la calidad de su servicio y la exhibición de sus productos.

loans.use: To improve workspace conditions

loans.name: Rosa Luz

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa Luz G. G. is a partener of the "Alfonso Ugarte" Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin region, San Martin Province, Tarapoto District. She is dedicated to the elaboration and sales of all kinds of handicrafts that are used in different environments around the house, business or office. Since she was little, Mrs. G. developed abilities to make all kinds of handicrafts. When she separated from her husband , she saw herself in need of supporting her daughters and herself. She decided to formally dedicate herself to this activity.

Today she is studying Education For Work (food and handicrafts production) at the Pedagogical Superior Institute of Tarapoto. She has strenghtened her creativity and experience. With the 3,000 soles (Peruvian currency) loan that she will pay back in 6 months, she will buy: colored threads, different types of fabrics like: canvas for embriodery, felp, and other fabrics in varied colors and designs and rails, all of this materials to make curtains, tableclothes, sheets, bedspreads, table covers, napkins, cushions, and stuff animals to satisfy her demanding clientele and to offer good service.

Mrs. G. is 39 years old and has 2 daughters who are students. They are her stimulus to continue working and to improve herself every day. With her entreprenurial vision, she plans to have a well-established handicrafts' shop and other related products.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Rosa Luz G. G., es socia del Banco Comunal “Alfonso Ugarte ” vive en la Región San Martín ,Provincia de San Martín , distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de todo tipo de manualidades para ser utilizados en los diferentes ambientes del hogar, negocio u oficina. Desde muy pequeña desarrollo habilidades manuales, al separarse de su esposo en la necesidada de sacarle a delante a sus hijas decidió dedicarse formalmente a esta actividad. En la actualidad esta estudiando en el Instituto Superior Pedagógico de Tarapoto la carrera de Educación para el trabajo (producción alimenticia y artesanal) en la que esta fortaleciendo su creatividad y experiencia. Con el préstamo de S/.3000.00 que será pagado en 6 meses comprará: hilos de colores, telas de diferentes tipos como: cañamazo, felpa, diolen. tapasol, pelón, en variados diseños y colores, rieles, todo esto para la confección de cortinas, manteles, sabanas, cubrecamas, tapetes, servilletas, cojines, peluches para satisfacer a su exigente clientela un buen servicio. Tiene 39 años de edad y 2 hijas estudiantes, quienes son el estimulo para seguir trabajando y superándose cada vez mas, con visión empresarial piensa instalar un taller bien implementado de manualidades y otros productos Afines.

loans.use: Buying more supplies for making her products.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44556

loans.name: Leydi

texts.es:
Leydi is a working mother of two small children. Her constant desire to improve her family's life has led her to work selling toys on the outskirts of a well-known and popular educational center. Much of the time, this activity has helped her family avoid financial crisis and now, due to the popularity of her enterprise, she wants to increase her working capital in order to be able to sell more toys.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Leydi es una trabajadora madre de dos pequeños niños, su constante deseo de mejora familiar la ha conducido a desempeñarse en las afueras de un conocido y popular centro educativo ofertando juguetes.Durante mucho tiempo esta actividad ha sido la que ha ayudado a su familia a evitar la crisis económica y ahora debido a la popularidad que ha adquirido desea incrementar su capital de trabajo para vender mayor cantidad de juguetes.

loans.use: To offer more toys for sale

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44557

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is the 32-year-old single mother of two children. She is dedicated to offering her cosmetological services to the public from her own home, thanks to the welcome and the experience she has obtained throughout many years. She would like to continue to be the preferred cosmetologist of her neighbors and clients and has is thinking of enrolling in the center in order to learn new haircutting and coloring techniques, besides implementing a workspace to improve her service.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Margarita de 32 años es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos, se dedica a prestar sus servicios de cosmetóloga al público en general desde su propio domicilio, gracias a la acogida y experiencia que ha ido obteniendo durante largos años. Desea seguir siendo la cosmetóloga preferida de sus vecinos y clientes y tiene en mente capacitarse en un centro para aprender las nuevas técnicas de cortes y peinados, demás de implementar su espacio de trabajo para mejorar su servicio.

loans.use: Development of workspace

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44558

loans.name: Ricardo Rodolfo

texts.es:
Mr. Ricardo F. is 23 years old, lives in the Memorial Sandino district, is an engineer for Sistema and is married. He has alwasy planned to build his house to give better and more comfortable conditions to his family.

Mr. Ricardo hopes that in the future to gain a better standard of living for his family. With this loan, he hopes to build a room and he needs to buy materials for this. He is asking for a loan for a time period of of 9 months, by means of monthly guarantees.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

El Señor Ricardo F. tiene 23 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Memorial Sandino, es ingeniero en Sistema y es casado.Entre sus planes ha estado siempre construir construir su casa para darle mayor comodidad y condiciones de vida a su familia.

Don Ricardo espera en un futuro lograr un mejor estatus economico y social para el y su familia , con este credito el espera construir un cuarto y necesita comprar materiales de cosntruccion por lo que solicita un prestamo con un lapso de 9 meses, mediante abonos mensuales

loans.use: To buy construction materials to continue working on his house.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
Marivel leaves her home very early every day to go to the city's port in order to acquire delicious fish that she sells from her home. The great welcome her products receive and the excellent quality of her service assure the complete sale of her inventory within only a few hours. She would like to improve the set-up of her sales space in order to welcome her hundreds of clients with a greater quantity of products.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Marivel, a diario abandona desde muy temprano su hogar para desplazarse al puerto de su ciudad a adquirir los deliciosos pescados que ofertará desde su hogar, la gran acogida de sus productos y su excelente calidad de servicio aseguran la venta total de sus productos en pocas horas.Desea mejorar las instalaciones de su espacio de venta para acoger con mayor cantidad a sus centenares de clientas.

loans.use: Set-up and improvement of sales space

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44560

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa Maria is a very active woman and with desires to succeed. Since a very long time Rosa sells cosmetics of the most recognized brands in the country. Thanks to her graciousness and patience she has a vast list of clients that come to her month after month. Her wishes to improve motivate her to add a space for cosmetic consulting, in order to continue to advise her clients and offer them the best products.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa Maria es una mujer muy activa y con deseos de superación, se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a la venta de cosméticos de las marcas más reconocidas de su país, gracias a su gentileza y paciencia tiene una gran gama de clientes mes a mes. Sus deseos de mejora la motivan a implementar un espacio de asesoramiento continuo con los mejores productos para satisfacción de sus queridas clientas.

loans.use: To Add Space for Cosmetic Consulting

loans.name: Angel Antonio

texts.es:
Don Angel is a 34-year-old man with two children and a wife who works at home. He works as a security guard for a business in addition to making and selling caps with his wife's help.

"Due to the lack of employment in our country, I am looking for an alternative to working, dedicating himself to making caps." He hopes to devote himself to just his business in future so he can make it grow and achieve higher levels of sales.

The loan he is requesting is to build a back wall for his home to provide it with greater security.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Don Angel es un hombre de 34 años de edad tiene 2 niños y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, el trabaja en una Empresa como guarda de seguridad , ademas de elaborar y comercializar gorras con ayuda de su esposa. Debido a la falta de empleo en nuestro pais busco otra alternativa de trabajo dedicandose a la elaboracion de gorras, espera en un futuro poder dedicarse solo a su negocio para hacerlo crecer y obtener mayores niveles de ventas. El prestamo lo esta solicitando para cosntruir un muro trasero en su casa y de esa manera darle mayor seguridad a su hogar.

loans.use: Construction of a back all to improve his home's security

loans.name: Bou

texts.en: 57-year-old Bou S. lives in Kampong Chnnang Province, where she is a professional tailor earning approximately $2 U.S. per day working from home. She has six children, three of whom are currently employed in a garment factory while the remaining four are seeking employment. She wants to take out a loan to help her purchase a sturdy motorbike that she can use to transport the clothing she works on to her clients’ homes. By providing this unusually good service, Bou hopes to gain more business and increase her family income.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to use as transportation for her business.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Prak L., a 55-year-old widow in Kampong Chnang Province, has three children, two of whom are employed as garment factory workers. Their wages of $5 U.S. per day constitute the family income. Because Prak wants to give her family a solid home to live in, she is requesting this loan to purchase the wood and zinc that their new house will be constructed from.

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: Prom S. P., 24 years old, lives in Siem Reap Province where she is employed by a local golf course, making $3 U.S. per day. Her husband, 28-year-old Hoin Hea, earns just under $2 per day working at the same course. They have two young children, both currently enrolled in school. During the rainy reason their house offers little protection from the elements, so Prom is requesting a loan of $400 to buy the materials needed to repair their roof. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase materials to repair their roof.

loans.name: Cham

texts.en: 56-year-old Cham S. earns her living as a tailor in Kampong Chnang Province, averaging $3 U.S per day. As a widow, it is her responsibility to care for her one child still living dependently in the family home and going to school. She has three older children as well, two of whom are garment factory workers, while another shares her mother’s tailoring business. Unfortunately, on their current income they are not able to build a larger home in which to house their family business. They are therefore requesting a loan of $750 to build this home as well as purchase additional sewing thread.

loans.use: To build a house and buy thread.

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en: 28-year-old Khiev S. lives in Kampong Chnang Province, where she runs a grocery store selling oils, ice, wines, and other food stuffs. She makes approximately $4.50 U.S. per day while her 39-year-old husband earns $3 per day as a high school teacher. They have two children, both of whom are students. With a loan of $350, she plans to purchase a piece of land to build a new house on as well as more grocery products to expand her inventory.

loans.use: To buy land and grocery products.

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en: Chhoeun S., a 48-year-old widow living in Siem Reap Province, has run her own laundry business since 2000, earning about $5 U.S. per day. She has six children, two of whom are already married. Three are still students while one is currently employed. Chhoeun wants to purchase wood to build a new house which will also serve as her place of work.

loans.use: To buy wood for a house.

loans.name: Srey Touch Nou Group

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Touch N. is the group leader of  four women in Ra Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 23 years old and married with a child who is too young to yet attend school. She is a grocer in the village and her husband, Tith Phoeurng, is a construction worker who can generate a small income to support the family.  Srey Touch and her husband now would like to live apart from their parents, so they need to build a house for themselves. It is for this reason that she is requesting the loan.

loans.use: To build a house.

payments.comment: Mrs. Srey Touch Nou does an extra repayment $7.50 and Mrs. Sokheourn Cheng also does an extra repayment $2.50.
Mrs. Srey Touch Nou does $7.50 as an extra repayment and Mrs. Yem Chreng does $2.50 as an extra repayment.

loans.name: Thị Oanh

texts.vi:
Mrs. C. Thi Oanh (MS 06020014) is currently 48 years old. She is very active within the community and is currently the president of the Women Union in her area. Outside of community work, she also have outside job to have more income for the family. Among her 3 children, one is currently in the motorcycle-taxi service, while the two others are factory workers. Her husband also help her in daily houseworks as well as her business. She would like to borrow 2.006.000 VND to buy food stuff for her chicken and pigs. She really like to participate in all the activities of Binh Minh-Kiva Partner Mrs. Le Thi Ha (MS: 06020015), now 40 years old, would also like to borrow the same amount to buy food stuff for her breeding pigs and for grocery. Mrs. Le Thi Chuc (MS: 06020016), 45 years old, want to borrow 2.006.000 VND to buy foodstuff for chicken and pigs as well as to fund her brick-making business. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Phuong (MS: 06020017) 40 years old, need the money to buy soil and charcoal to make bricks. Mr. Nguyen Ngoc Cuong (MS: 06020018), 24 years, need to borrow the same amount to buy coals for the charcoal oven, to be used for making bricks.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị C. Thị Oanh (MS: 06020014), năm nay 48 tuổi. Bản thân chị rất năng động, cô làm chi hội trưởng Phụ Nữ ở thôn, ngoài ra về nhà chị còn đi làm thuê để có thêm thu nhập hàng ngày. Chị có 3 con một con hiện đi làm lái xe, hai con đi làm công nhân ở nhà máy. Chồng chị cũng giúp chị rất nhiều trong việc làm kinh tế, anh đi đổ xi măng cho đường làng, ngõ. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám nuôi gà lợn. Chị rất thích tham gia và trở thành thành viên của Binh Minh. Chị Lê Thị Hà (MS: 06020015), năm nay 40 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám cho lợn và đi chợ. Chị Lê Thị Chúc (MS: 06020016), năm nay 45 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám nuôi gà, lợn, ngoài ra chị còn làm gạch. Chị Nguyễn Thị Phượng (MS: 06020017), năm nay 40 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND để mua đất và than làm gạch. Anh Nguyễn Ngọc Cường (MS: 06020018), năm nay 24 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND để mua than đốt lò gạch, ngói.

loans.use:
Chăn nuôi và làm gạch ngói
Breeding and making bricks

loans.name: Thea Chhin Group

texts.en: Four women form this group in Sala Khom Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Thea C., 42, is the group leader and a vegetable seller. She is married with three children, one of whom has immigrated to Malaysia as a house wife, and the second of whom is a motorbike taxi driver. The third child is enrolled in local school. Thea’s husband, Mr. Hout Soeurn, is a bike repairer in the village, but due to a shortage of parts,  Thea is  requesting a loan to buy bike implements; she will use the rest of her share to buy more vegetables to sell in the village.

loans.use: To buy bike implements and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy bike implements and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Thị Yến

texts.vi:
Mrs N. Thị Yến is 33 years old. She husks rice for a living, her husband is a laborer. They have 3 young children who attend school. Mrs Yến is applying for a loan of 2.006.000 VND to start a clothing sales business in order to increase the family income. She likes the way SEDA works because it allows her to pay back the loan in small installments.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị N. Thị Yến (MS: 06020019), năm nay 33 tuổi. Chị làm xay sát gạo phục vụ bà con trong thôn, chồng chị đi làm thuê cho bà con trong xóm để có thêm thu nhập. Chị có 3 con nhỏ đang đi học. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua quần áo đi bán tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Chị rất thích tham gia vì được trả dần phù hợp với thu nhập thường xuyên của chị.

loans.use: clothing sales

loans.name: Thị Thơm

texts.vi:
Mrs P. Thị Thơm is 39 years old. She is requesting a loan of 2.006.000 VND to buy feed for her paddle of 600 ducks. On a side job, she makes bricks to increase her wage. She has 3 children and her oldest is working. She likes SEDA because it allows her to make small weekly payment.

Translated form Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị P. Thị Thơm (MS: 06020020), năm nay 39 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám nuôi 600 con vịt để. Ngoài ra chị còn làm lò đốt gạch, ngói tạo thêm thu nhập. Chị có 3 con, 1 con của chị đã đi làm còn 2 con vẫn đang đi học. Chị thấy vay vốn trả góp rất phù hợp vơi gia đình chị.

loans.use: to buy feed for her paddle of ducks

loans.name: Thị Liễu

texts.vi:
Mrs N. Thị Liễu is 66 years old. She's requesting a loan of 2.006.000 VND to buy pigs to raise. She and her husband are hard working people. Her husband makes bricks and his income is steady. Mrs Liễu likes SEDA because it gives her a chance to increase her family income and make some savings.

Translated form Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Bác N. Thị Liễu (MS: 06020013), năm nay 66 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND mua lợn về nuôi. Bản thân bác và bác trai rất chịu khó. Hai bác làm lò đốt gạch có thu nhập thường xuyên nên bác thấy tham gia chương trình là biện pháp tiết kiệm tốt và tạo thêm công việc cho gia đình.

loans.use: buy pigs

loans.name: Quang Dự

texts.vi:
Mr N. Quang Dự is 27 years old. He applies for a loan of .006.000 VND to buy mash for his pigs. On a side job, he sells charcoal to the brick makers who have to dry their bricks. He likes the way SEDA works e.g being able to pay back in installments. his wife is working as factory worker.

Translated form Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Anh N. Quang Dự (MS: 06020012), năm nay 27 tuổi. Anh vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám chăn nuôi lợn và buôn bán than phục vụ cho nhưng hộ đốt lò gạch, ngói để có thêm thu nhập hàng ngày. Anh thấy rất phù hợp với hình thức trả của chương trình. Vợ anh hiện đi làm công nhân may ở xí nghiệp may.

loans.use: to buy pig mash

loans.name: Fajar

texts.id:
Translated from bahasa Indonesia by Carlos Patriawan , Kiva Volunteer.

F. activity every day is travelling everyday looking for the second-hand items by driving his motorcycle from Kuta to Gianyar. Usually the second hand item is taken directly from his customer who already prepared the items that already is not used and usually has been paid before.

After that F. afterwards brough the second hand items to his house where his wife Nanik is ready to sort the second-hand in accordance with its quality before ready to be sold.

F. expected the loan as capital to buy second-hand items and hope the profit that after getting the loan at this time is to be bigger thus he should be able to fulfil the requirement for his family.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Shapari

texts.en: Shapari lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and lives with her own family. She has a retail shop and she has good experience in her business. She already took out a first small loan, completed her stock, and improved her business. Now she has requested her second cycle loan to expand her business further and enlarge her shop to  support her family and make her income better than in the past .

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Fajar

texts.id:
Everyday Fajar travels from Kuta to Gianyar by motorcycle to look for second-hand goods and wrecks . He gets the goods from his regular providers who have goods that they don't use anymore. He usually has to pay upfront for those goods. After getting the goods, Fajar comes home and his wife sorts the goods according to the types of the goods and then finally the goods are ready to be sold. Fajar hopes to get the loan to add more capital for buying the second-hand goods and he hopes he can earn more profit so that he can afford his family's living expenses.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Kegiatan Fajar setiap hari adalah berkeliling mencari barang bekas dan rongsokan dengan menggunakan sepeda motor mulai dari Kuta sampai Gianyar. Biasanya barang diambil langsung dari langganannya yang sudah menyiapkan barang-barang bekas dan rongsokan yang sudah tidak terpakai lagi dan biasanya sudah dibayar terlebih dahulu. Setelah mendapatkan barang bekas, Fajar kemudian mengantarnya kerumah dimana istrinya Nanik sudah siap untuk menyortir dan memilah barang-barang bekas itu sesuai dengan jenisnya, dan setelah itu siap untuk dijual. Fajar sangat mengharapkan bantuan kali ini untuk dijadikan modal usaha membeli barang-barang bekas dan berharap keuntungan yang didapat setelah mendapatkan pinjaman kali ini lebih besar sehingga bisa mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is 30 years old and is married with one child, age 8 years old. Nuru is a fish seller. She started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8:30am to 12:30pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Kimadi

texts.en:
Kimadi is 38 years old and is married with 4 children, ages 16, 9, 7, and 2 years old. Kimadi is an egg seller. She started her business in 2005. Every day, she works from 7:30am to 4pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more eggs for her business.

loans.use: To buy more eggs for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en: Zakia lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is educated, married, and the mother of 3 children. She has a small knitting business. She has been involved in this business for more than 8 years. She works with her two daughters and with three more apprentices. They are all very hard workers. People purchase a lot of their knitted goods, so Zakia wants to expand her business. She wants to take an individual loan to be able to expand and to make good income to help her daughters and her family.

loans.use: To expand her small knitting business

loans.name: Mwanahija

texts.en:
Mwanahija is 25 years old and is a singe woman with 1 child, who is 8 years old. Mwanahija is a fish seller, she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 7am to 4:30pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Siaba's Upendo Center Group

texts.en:
Siaba is 32 years old and is married with 3 children, ages14,11, and 5 years old. Siaba is a charcoal seller. She started her business in 2001. Every day, Siaba works from 8am to 3pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwanahamisi, who has business in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Obidallah

texts.en: Obidallah lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single and a student at the university. He has a retail shop where he presently works part-time but after one month he will start working full-time so he wants to expand his business. He has requested an individual loan to complete his inventory so as to make a good monthly income to help his family and make a better future for himself. He is happy and he would like to thank Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand his little grocery store

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 24 years old and is a single woman with 2 children, ages 7 and 1. Amina sells tanks. She started her business in 2007. Everyday, she works from 7am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more tanks for her business.

loans.use: To buy more tanks for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Mwantumu's Umoja Ni Nguvu Group

texts.en:
Mwantumu is 35 years old and is a divorced woman with two children. Mwantumu owns a small food store, which she opened in 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 2pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwanaally, who has a business in firewood sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Batuli's Majengo North Group

texts.en:
Batuli is 23 years old and is married with one 4-year-old child. She also take care of one other child, a 7 year old. Batuli owns a small shop, which she opened in 2002. Every day, she works from 7am to 4.30pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $275 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items (shoes, clothes, bags) for her shop. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Zaina and Mwanahija, who have businesses in cloth sales and shoes sales.

loans.use: To buy more items (shoes, clothes, bags) for her shop.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun U. and her husband have been married since 1979. They have five children: two sons and three daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home. Of the other four children, two work in a garment factory, while another one is a construction worker - however, he now wants to change his job to become a motor-taxi driver. Mrs. Saroeun's two youngest children are in school. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Saroeun and her husband have been earning income selling food items for the past eight years. They buy food products from the Prek Pnao Market and cook them before reselling in front of a factory near their village. 

Mrs. Saroeun is now asking for a loan of US$500 to help her son purchase a motorbike, so that he can start working as a  motor-taxi driver.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike for a motor-taxi business

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthoeun K. and his wife have been married since 2006. They have one daughter and live about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Bunthoeun has been earning income driving a motor-taxi trailer for the last six years. He carries people and goods from the village to Phnom Penh and back. His wife stays at home and takes care of the children.

Mr. Bunthoeun is now asking for a loan of US$900 to purchase a new motor-taxi trailer to replace the old one.

loans.use: Purchase of a new motor-taxi trailer

loans.name: Yai

texts.en:
Yai Khieng is asking for a loan from Maxima in the amount of US$3,00 to purchase vegetables and rice for resale along the village road. Yai is a widow and a mother of three: two sons and a daughter, all of whom are in school.

Yai started her sales business in 1998, and now has ten years of experience selling vegetables and rice. She buys the vegetables in Phnom Penh and resells them locally. Doing so, she can earn between 10,000 and 30,000 riel a day. The local village road is currently being repaved, but after the Khmer New Year (April 13-15), Yai will again be able to sell vegetables there.

In the future, Yai hopes to be able to send her daughter to a university. She is working on improving her business and is building a new stall for the vegetable sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables and rice for resale

loans.name: Rehema's Central Group

texts.en:
ReH. is 42 years old and is married with six children. ReH. owns a small cloth shop, which she opened in 2005. Every day she works from 10am to 9:30pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth (khanga and Vitenge) for her shop. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Happiness, Aziza, Barke, and Aisha, who have businesses dealing in cloth sales and perfume sales.

loans.use: To buy more cloth (khanga and vitenge) for her shop.

loans.name: Chang

texts.en:
Chang R., 30 years old, lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband and their three children. She makes and sells various souvenir products to capitalize on Siem Reap’s thriving tourist industry based around the Angkor temples. She makes about $3 U.S. per day. Her husband, Phat Oun, is 27 years old and shares her business, adding an additional $3 per day to the family income. Their oldest child is 8 years old and currently enrolled in primary school while the other two are still too young to attend school.

Since both quantity and quality of product are the keys to being successful when so many other locals make their living in the same business, Chang is requesting a loan of $400 to buy better and more complex tools with which to make the handicrafts she sells to tourists.

loans.use: To buy equipment and tools used in making handicrafts as souvenirs.

loans.name: Nor Din

texts.en: Nor Din lives in district 12 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and the father of  one son. He has a retail shop. He took out his first cycle loan and started up his business, and now he wants to take his second cycle individual loan to complete his stock so as to attract more customers and make a good income to help his family. He wants to make a better future for his son. He is happy that he has been able to start up a business with his first loan and that now he can continue to grow his business with a second loan.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Pream

texts.en: Pream H., of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, is 42 years old and employed by a local golf course, making $3 U.S. per day while her husband, a construction worker, makes $2 U.S. per day. The couple has five children. one of whom works with his father in construction, adding $3 U.S. per day to the family income. Because Pream H.’s work is an appreciable distance from her home, she is requesting  a loan of $500 in order to purchase a motorbike to use for commuting.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mr. Sokha S. and his wife have been married since 1994. They have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of their children are in school, while the youngest one stays at home. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Sokha has been in the business of grocery sales for over a year. He buys grocery items from a market in Phnom Penh for resale at his shop. Thanks to the business, he earns between 10,000 and 20,000 riel per day. His wife works as a garment factory worker.

Mr. Sokha is now requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorbike for family use and to buy grocery items for resale.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike for family use and of grocery items for resale

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokun C. and her husband got married in 1984. They have seven children: five sons and two daughters. Two of their children are married, one of whom lives outside the family home. Two of their sons are construction workers, one of their daughters weaves silk at home, and the others are still at school. The family lives on an Island on Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sokun has been a weaver for twenty-three years. It is a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished product to middle-men in the village who then sell it in Phnom Penh. Mrs. Sokun's husband has been a fisherman for twenty-five years. He does fishing in the village and sells the fish to villagers.

Sokun is requesting a loan of US$400 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: Purchase of silk thread for weaving

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthoeun P. and his wife got married in 2005. They have one daughter and live on an Island on Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Currently, Bunthoeun is in the process of building his own house.
He has been a weaver for three years, which is a skill he learned from his parents. Bunthoeun's wife, too, has been working as a silk weaver for the past eleven years. The couple sells their finished silk products to middle-men in the village who then sell it in Phnom Penh. Besides weaving, Buntoeun also earns income raising pigs. 

Now, he is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to help finance the construction of his house.

loans.use: Construction of a house

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mr. Sam S. (pictured with his mother) and his wife got married in 2005. They have one daughter. Mr. Sam and his wife live with his mother who is a farmer and sells lotus flowers. Mr. Sam's father is a monk. The family lives about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Sam and his wife have been selling groceries for three years. They buy grocery items from a market in Phnom Penh for resale in front of their house. Beside of grocery store, the couple also has a lotus wholesale business in the village.

Sam is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase grocery items for resale.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery items for resale

loans.name: Catherine's Central Group

texts.en:
Catherine is 44 years old and is married with two children, ages 16 and 12 years old. She and her husband also take care of four other children. Catherine is a food seller, she started in 1999. Every day, she works from 7am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy flour, cooking oil, and other related items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Grace, Mary, Neema, Thea, and Asha, who have businesses dealing in food vending, cloth sales, kiosk, and grocery.

loans.use: To buy flour, cooking oil, and other related items for her business.

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreypov C. and her husband got married in 1988. They have three daughters, and all of them are silk weavers. The family lives on an Island on Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sreypov has been a silk weaver since 1988. It is a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished product to middle-men in the village who then sell it in Phnom Penh. Mrs. Sreypov's husband is a silk weaver as well. The family has three looms.

Mrs. Sreypov is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Mwanahawa's Central Group

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is 34 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. Mwanahawa owns a small food shop, which she started in 2002. Every day, she works from 7am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items (sugar, rice, blue band, cooking oil, etc) for her shop. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Urusara, who has a business in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more items (sugar, rice, blue band, cooking oil, etc) for her shop.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Tuutuuka Group 1

texts.en:
Rose N. is the chairperson of the group. She is a 36-year-old woman who, together with her husband, sells charcoal, tomatoes and watermelon to Kampala market vendors. They buy the bags of charcoal locally and sell them at a mark up of over 300% in town, where charcoal is in high demand and very expensive. The tomatoes and watermelon are grown on their land. They have been running this business for 10 years and are now in the position to rent a truck to take their produce to town each week. (Previously, they borrowed friends' cars and now they are pleased to be self-sufficient.) Rose and her husband are hoping to one day buy a market stall in town to complement their wholesale business.

Rose is planning to buy many more bags of charcoal with the loan. It provides the business with its best profit margin generally and purchasing in bulk will make it even more profitable.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To pay invest in the group's various businesses and for daily expenses.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary T. is a trader who is a second-hand dealer. She is a single parent of 2 children. She travels to Accra to buy used clothing for sale. Business is doing very well, and she plans to increase her sales.

She is asking for $825 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha U. and her husband got married in 2002. They have one daughter and live on an Island on Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chantha has been a silk weaver since 1995. It is a skill she learned from her mother. Chantha sells her finished product to the middle-men in the village who then sell it in Phnom Penh. Chantha's husband has been working as a construction worker for the past six years. He learned this skill from his father.

Chantha is requesting a loan US$150 to purchase construction materials for her husband.

loans.use: Purchase of construction material

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en: I am Nasreen A. from the small city of Mian Channu, Pakistan. I live here in a one room brick house with my husband and four kids: three boys and one girl. I used to run a grocery store but it was losing money so I had to shut it down. My husband drives a donkey cart to transport goods on order. We need to expand our income and therefore we have decided to buy an additional donkey cart, which we will rent out to supplement our income.  I have a few other women in my loan group who are also in need of loans for their businesses. Khalida B.’s husband works in a local food market, Sakina B.’s husband sells vests, Parween B. has a furniture business, and Salma B.’s husband sells rice.

loans.use: Buy an additional donkey cart

loans.name: Chanthun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthun H. and her husband got married in 2000. They have two children; one son and one daughter.  The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chanthun has been working as a scarf-weaver for three years. She sells her finished products at a market in Phnom Penh. Her husband works in a garment factory.

Chanthun is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a semi-machine loom and cotton for weaving.

loans.use: Purchase of a semi-machine loom and cotton for scarf-weaving

loans.name: Amna's Group

texts.en: I am Amna S.. I am 40 years old and I have lived all my life in Mian Channu, a small town in Pakistan. I am married and I have six children: four boys and two girls. My husband buys and sells fruits and vegetables in a nearby food market and my eldest son has a cloth dying business. Currently, my husband wants to start a vegetables shop and needs loan. I have been joined in my loan group by a few other women who are: Halima A.’s , Ghulam F. B. , Samina B. and Rukhsana B..

loans.use: Open a Produce store

loans.name: Arshad's Group

texts.en: B. is a mother of three. Her children currently are too young to attend school, what will do so in the immediate future. B. and her husband applied for a loan earlier to purchase cotton to support themselves in the grain market. B. and her husband would now like to apply for a loan to purchase a donkey cart, which will allow them to transport more materials and increase their profits. In addition, B.’s family owns a grocery store and also a toiletry dispensal service. With these sources of income, B. and her family are able to earn enough to support her family, but would like to increase her income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: Buy an additional donkey cart

loans.name: Mwasiti's Mkombozi North Group

texts.en:
Mwasiti is 24 years old and is a single woman. Mwasiti is a coconut seller; she started her business in 2007. Every day, she works from 9am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more coconut for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwanmkasi, Shakila, Batuli, Mwanakondo and Amina, who have businesses in tailoring, food vending, cloth sales, and hiring bicycles.

loans.use: To buy more coconut for her business.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en: Naseem M. was born in a small city, known as Vehari in Pakistan, but some twenty years ago moved to another small city, Mian Channu, with her family. She owns a small, one room brick mud house here in Mian Channu. She has ten kids: five boys and five girls. She has been Asasah’s client for two years, and this year, she requires a loan to buy her son a donkey cart. Naseem’s husband makes hand-embroidered clothes to make a living. There are few other women who have also joined Naseem in her loan group. They are Halima B., who wants to expand her cosmetics shop; Hanifa B., who wants to buy a donkey cart; Naseem B., who has a pickle business; Zahida B., who is borrowing for her family’s furniture business; and Zahida Z., who will invest her share of loan in her clothing business.

loans.use: Buy her son a donkey cart

loans.name: Tuutuuka Group 2

texts.en:
Annet N. represents the group. She is 28 years old and married with a nine-year-old child. She also cares for a ten-year-old orphan. Annet's husband works as a chauffeur and together they have hopes that their daughter will one day be a nurse.

Annet's menswear shop is only one year old, but it is already thriving. She has recently begun to complement her retail business in Kayunga by selling some of her stock at several markets in the area. The market side of the business is proving to be more profitable and so she is seeking a loan to buy more stock. Buying in bulk from Kampala will reduce the cost of the clothes as well as of transportation. Annet will sell this new stock at various markets in the area..

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To use in the group's various businesses and to pay for daily expenses.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 44 years old man. He is the father of three children and he works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh.

Hussein owns a grocery store. This is the fifth time he applies for a loan at Al Majmoua. With it, he wants to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his grocery store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 56 years old woman. She is the mother of three children. She works and lives with her family in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh.

Fatima owns a mini market. This is the second time she applies for a loan at Al Majmoua. She wants to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her mini market.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 54 years old man, the father of two children. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh.

Hassan is a taxi driver. This is the third time he applies for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to do some maintenance to his house.

loans.use: To do house maintenance.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Rafic

texts.en:
Rafic is a 53 years old man. He is the father of two children. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh.

Rafic sells shoes. This is the second time he applies for a loan at Al Majmoua; with it, he wants to buy new merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise for his shoe-selling business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Sadika

texts.en: Sadika is from a small village, Čubrić, near the town of Banovići. She is divorced  and she has 3 children  ranging from 15-27 years old. She has a full-time job and she works at a coal mine. Her monthly salary is  400 KM (about US$ 320). This is her first  loan at MCO WWI in the amount of  US$ 825. Sadika is going to buy feed for her goats which represent  her additional source of income. She will also buy  compost and seeds for sowing. She wants to increase income for her children and herself.

loans.use: To buy feed for goats

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en:
Sharif is a 42 years old man. He is the father of three children. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh.

Sharif is a car painter. He wants to develop his business. He is therefore planning to buy cars and then sell them.

loans.use: To buy cars to expand his business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 24, 2008)
